content:
めいうん〔命運〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: うんめい〔運命〕

content:
めいか〔名家〕
〈名〉
1. (=名門)a good family; an illustrious family

content.content: 彼は名家の出だ
He comes of a good family―He is sprung from an illustrious stock.

content: 2. (=知名の士)a notability; a celebrity; a renowned man; a great man

content.content: 名家演説集
speeches by great speakers

content:
めいか〔名歌〕
〈名〉A famous (Japanese) poem; a fine (Japanese) poem

content.content: 名歌集
an anthology

めいが〔名画〕
〈名〉A great painting; a masterpiece of painting

めいかい〔冥界〕
〈名〉The world of spirits; the abode of the shades; Hades

めいかい〔明解〕
〈名〉A clear solution; a clear explanation

content:
めいかい〔明快〕
〈形〉Clear (head); lucid (style); succinct (account); explicit (statement); luminous (writer, etc.)

content.content: 明快に説く
to give a lucid explanation―give a succinct account
明快に答弁した
He gave an explicit answer.

content:
めいかく〔明確〕
〈形〉Clear and accurate; exact; precise

content.content: 明確に説明する
to give a clear and accurate explanation
明確な記事
an exact account―a precise account

〈名〉Sale by description

めいかん〔銘肝〕
〈名〉A deep impression (on the mind)

めいき〔名器〕
〈名〉A utensil of rare excellence

めいき〔明記〕
〈名〉Specification:(=する) to specify; to state clearly; to mention expressly

content:
めいき〔銘記〕
〈名〉Impression:(=する) to impress (a fact) on one's mind

content.content: この事実は深く心に銘記すべし
You must have this fact deeply impressed on your mind.

content:
めいぎ〔名義〕
〈名〉
1. (=名前)a name

content.content: 彼は僕の名義で金を借りおった
He has been borrowing money in my name.
店は息子の名義になっている
The business is carried on in the son's name―under the son's name.
財産の名義を書き換える
to transfer one's property to another
名義は王だ
He is a king in name.
名義だけの王だ
He is a king only in name―a nominal king―a titular sovereign.
彼は名義だけの社長だ
He is a nominal president―a titular president.
名義だけの価で買った
I bought it at a nominal price.
名義だけの金額を払えば好い
You need only pay a nominal sum.

content: 2. (=口実)a pretext; justification; warrant; claim

content.content: 戦争を起こすに名義が無い
There is no pretext for war―There is no justification of a war―We have no warrant for war.
名誉回復だけは戦争を起こす名義が立たぬ
Mere vindication of honour does not justify a war―warrant a war.
名義のない戦争
an unjustifiable war―an unwarrantable war
彼は財産を争う名義が無い
He has no claim to the property.

content: 3. (=名誉)honour

content.content: これは名義にかかわることだ
The matter concerns my honour―My honour is concerned―My honour is at stake.

content:
めいきゅう〔迷宮〕
〈名〉A maze; a labyrinth

content.content: 迷宮に入る
to become complicated―become intricate
事件迷宮に入る
The case has become complicated―become “foggy.”
事件はますます迷宮に入る
The affair has become more complicated than ever.
問題はますます迷宮に入る
The problem has become more and more intricate.

めいきょう〔明鏡〕
〈名〉A clear mirror

めいきん〔鳴禽〕
〈名〉A singing bird; a song-bird

めいぎん〔名吟〕
〈名〉A famous poem; a fine poem

めいく〔名句〕
〈名〉(散文のなら)a beautiful expression:(詩歌のなら)a beautiful verse

めいくん〔名君〕
〈名〉A wise ruler; a just ruler

content:
めいげつ〔名月〕
〈名〉A bright moon

content.content: 仲秋の名月
the harvest moon

content:
めいげん〔名言〕
〈名〉A wise saying; a witty saying; a witty remark; a stroke of wit; a bon mot

content.content: そりゃ名言だ
Well said!

content:
めいげん〔明言〕
〈名〉Declaration; asseveration:(=する) to declare; to asseverate

content.content: 彼は新聞の記事を事実無根だと明言した
He declared the account in the papers to false.
首相の議会において明言せるところに依れば日本は出兵せぬとのことである
According to the Premier's asseveration in the House, Japan will not take the field.
しかと明言することはできぬ
I can not say for certain.
職権外のことだから明言するを憚ります
As the matter lies beyond my functions, I am not in a position to say.
役人は言質を取られることを恐れて明言しない
An official is afraid of committing himself.

content:
めいこう〔名工〕
〈名〉A master-hand; a master-artisan

content.content: この彫刻は名工の作だ
The engravings are by a master-sculptor.

めいこう〔名香〕
〈名〉A rare incense

めいこん〔迷魂〕
〈名〉A wandering spirit

content:
めいさい〔明細〕
〈名〉(説明なら)details:(話なら)particulars:(勘定などなら)items:(見積りなどなら)specifications:(=な) detailed (report); particular (account); minute (account); specified (estimate):(=に) minutely; particularly; in detail

content.content: 明細に説明する
to explain in detail―enter into details―go into details
明細に話す
to give a particular account―enter into particulars―go into particulars
明細に述べる
to state in detail―make a minute statement
明細に記す
to state the items―specify the items
勘定を明細に書き出して下さい
Let me have the account in detail―stating the items.
(見積もりなど)明細書き
specifications

content:
めいさく〔名作〕
〈名〉A great work; a fine piece of work; a masterpiece

content.content: これは近年珍しい名作だ
It is as fine a piece of work as has not been seen for many a year.

めいさつ〔名刹〕
〈名〉A famous temple

content:
めいさつ〔明察〕
〈名〉Discernment; penetration; insight; perspicacity; judgment

content.content: 彼は明察がある
He has a discerning eye―a penetrating eye―He is a perspicacious man―a man of insight.
斯の如き事情に候へば宜しく御明察下され度候
I wish you would consider the circumstances in which I am placed.
ご明察に任す
I leave it to your judgment.

content:
めいさん〔名産〕
〈名〉A noted product; a specialty

content.content: 北海道は名産が多い
Hokkaido is rich in noted products.
タバコは薩摩の名産だ
Tobacco is a Specialty of satsuma.
日本名産販売
Dealer in Japanese Goods.

めいざん〔名山〕
〈名〉A famous mountain; sacred mountain

content:
めいし〔名刺〕
〈名〉A card; a name-card; a visiting-card

content.content: 名刺を通ずる
to send in one's card―send up one's card
名刺をお出しなさい
Give me your card!
(入らずに)名刺を置いて来た
I left a card on him.
名刺を交換する
to exchange cards
新年名刺交換会
a New Year's meeting for exchanging cards
ほんの名刺代わりでございます
It is a mere sign of my call.
名刺入れ
a card-case
名刺受
a card-tray―a card-basket
名刺判の写真
a carte-de-visite

content:
めいし〔名士〕
〈名〉A person of note; a noted person; a notable; a notability; a celebrity

content.content: 名士の会合
an assembly of notables
彼は政界の名士だ
He is a notability of the political world―a noted politician.
教育界の名士だ
He is a noted educationist.
朝野の名士
the ?lite of society

content:
めいし〔名詞〕
〈名〉A noun

content.content: 固有名詞、普通名詞、集合名詞、物質名詞、抽象名詞
a proper noun―a common noun―a collective noun a material noun―an abstract noun

content:
めいし〔明視〕
〈名〉Clear vision

content.content: 明視範囲
the range of clear vision

content:
めいし〔明示〕
〈名〉An express statement; an explicit statement:(=する) to state expressly; to state explicitly

content.content: 黙示の許可はあっても明示の許可は無い
There may be implicit (or implied) permission, but no explicit (or expressed) permission.

content:
めいじ〔名辞〕
〈名〉A term

content.content: 名辞矛盾

content:
めいじつ〔名実〕
〈名〉The name and the reality; name and fact; name and deed

content.content: 彼は名実共に学者である
He is a scholar in name and in reality―a scholar in name and in fact―a scholar in name and in deed.
名実相叶う
The name and the reality correspond with each other―The name corresponds with the reality―It is true to its name.
名実伴わぬ
The name does not correspond with the reality―The reality does not come up to the name.

めいじてんのうさい〔明治天皇祭〕
〈名〉The Anniversary of the Death of Meiji Tenno

めいしばん〔名詞判〕
〈名〉A carte-de-visite

content:

〈名〉→『

content.content: かんしゃ〔感謝〕

めいしゃ〔目医者〕
〈名〉An eye-doctor; an oculist

めいしゅ〔名手〕
〈名〉A master hand

content:
めいしゅ〔盟主〕
〈名〉The leading power of a confederacy

content.content: 盟主の地位
leadership―hegemony
日本は絶東の盟主たるべき国である
Japan ought to enjoy the hegemony of the Far East.

content:
めいしゅ〔銘酒〕
〈名〉Sake of special brand

content.content: 銘酒屋
a dram-shop―(は英、米は)―a saloon
銘酒屋の女
a barmaid

content:
めいしょ〔名所〕
〈名〉A place of note; a noted place; a beauty spot; a landmark; sights to see; the lions of a place

content.content: 京都は名所が多い
There are many sights to see―many lions―in Kyoto.
ここは名所はたんと無い
There is not much to see here.
名所を探る
to see the sights
京都の名所を見物した
I have seen the sights of Kyoto―seen the lions of Kyoto―done (the sights of) Kyoto.
高尾は紅葉の名所だ
Mt. Takao is noted for its maples.
飛鳥山は桜の名所だ
Asukayama is famous for its cherry-blossoms.
名所旧跡
noted places of historic interest―classic ground
名所案内
a guide-book
日本名所案内
a guide to Japan
名所図絵
pictures of noted places
日本名所図絵
Picturesque Japan―Pictorial Japan.

めいしょう〔名勝〕
〈名〉A noted place; a beauty spot

めいしょう〔名匠〕
〈名〉A master hand; a master artisan

めいしょう〔名将〕
〈名〉A famous general; a great general; a conqueror

content:
めいしょう〔名称〕
〈名〉A name; a term; a title; a style; an appellation; a denomination; a designation

content.content: 「日の出商会」の名称にて営業仕候
Our business will be carried on under the name of―under the style of―“the Sunrise Company.”
学術上の名称
a technical term
名称学
terminology

content:
めいじょうする〔名状する〕
〈他動〉To describe; to define

content.content: 名状すべからず
It is not to be described―indescribable―beyond description.
その美名状し難し
It is beautiful beyond description―The beauty beggars description.
その混雑名状すべからず
The confusion defies description.
彼女は名状すべからざる愛嬌がある
She has an undefinable charm about her.

content:
めいしょきゅうせき〔名所旧跡〕
〈名〉Noted places of historic interest

content.content: この辺は名所旧跡だ
We stand on classic ground.

content:
めいしん〔迷信〕
〈名〉Superstition; bigotry; fanaticism; old wives' tales

content.content: 日本人はまだ迷信がある
The Japanese are still superstitious.
その信仰はほとんど迷信に近い
Their faith verges on superstition.
迷信家
a superstitious person―a bigot―a fanatic―old women of both sexes
迷信を打破する
to break down superstitions
迷信打破、迷信破壊
iconoclasm
迷信破壊者
an iconoclast

content:
めいじん〔名人〕
〈名〉A master; a master hand; a past master; a great artist; a genius; one who has attained perfection in anything

content.content: 彼は絵の名人だ
He is a master painter.
斯道の名人だ
He is a master of the art―a past master in the art.
すべて遊びごとの名人だ
He is a master hand at all sorts of games.
彼は射撃の名人だ
He is a capital marksman―a crack shot.
拳銃の名人だ
He is a dead shot.
名人の域に達する
to attain perfection
何事にも名人になるのは困難だ
It is difficult to attain to perfection in anything.
名人の癖
eccentricities of genius
彼は名人肌の人だ
He has the eccentricities of genius.
名人にも仕損じあり
“A good marksman may miss.”
名人は人をそしらす
Great men never speak ill of others.

めいすう〔名数〕
〈名〉A concrete number

content:
めいすう〔命数〕
〈名〉
1. (=寿命)one's natural term of existence; one's length of days

content.content: 汝の命数尽きなんとす
Thy days are numbered.
彼の死んだのは命数だ
His race is run―His career is run.
我が命数尽きぬ(時節到来)
My time has come―My hour has struck.

content: 2. (=天命、運命)fate; destiny

content.content: 彼も命数尽きた
His fate is sealed―His star has set―He is doomed.
彼は命数が尽きて失敗したのだ
He was doomed to failure.

content:
めいする〔銘する〕
〈他動〉To impress (a fact on one's mind); to stamp, engrave, imprint, inscribe(a fact into one's soul)

content.content: この事実を肝に銘じて忘れるな
You must have the fact impressed on your mind.
この教訓は肝に命じて忘れません
I will have your precept stamped into my soul―engraved into my soul―imprinted into my soul―inscribed into my soul.

content:
めいする〔瞑する〕
〈自動〉To rest in peace

content.content: その霊地下に瞑せん
His soul will rest in peace.
彼の霊乞う地下に瞑せよ
May his soul rest in peace!―Peace be to his soul!
地下に瞑せず
to turn in one's grave
沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}の霊をして地下に瞑せざらしむるなかれ
Do not make Shakespeare turn in his grave!

content:
めいずる〔命ずる〕
〈名〉
1. (=命令する)to command(one to do something―something to be done); to order (one to do something―to be done); to cause (something to be done); to direct (one to do something―something to be done); to instruct (one to do something―something to be done); to tell (one to do something); to bid (one do something)

content.content: 家人に家の掃除を命じておいた
I have ordered my people to clean the house.
家の掃除を命じておいた
I have caused the house to be cleaned―had the house cleaned.
食事の準備を命じた
I have ordered them to prepare a dinner―caused a dinner to be prepared―had a dinner prepared.
家の建築を命じた
I have ordered them to build a house―caused a house to be built―had a house built.
将校は撃ち方止めを命じた
The officer ordered his men to cease firing―ordered firing to cease.
その男に明日来るように命じた
I have told the man to come tomorrow.
その男に待てと命ぜよ
Tell the man to wait!―Bid the fellow wait!
僕は朝鮮出張を命ぜられた
I have been ordered to Chosen.
彼は英国留学を命ぜられた
He has been ordered to England to complete his studies.
帰朝を命ぜられた
I have been ordered home.
僕は弁当を命じた
I have ordered a lunch.
もう料理を命じた
I have given an order already.
一行は路傍の茶屋に休んで酒肴を命じた
The party stopped at a roadside tea-house, and called for wine and fish.
良心や理性の命ずる処に従う
to obey the dictates of conscience―obey the dictates of reason

content: 2. (=任命する)to appoint (one principal―one to the post of principal); to nominate (one to a post)

content.content: 彼は某県知事を命ぜられた
He has been appointed governor of a certain prefecture―appointed to the post of governor.
僕に調査委員を命ぜられた
I have been placed on the investigation-committee.

content:
めいずる〔銘ずる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: めいする〔銘する〕

content:
めいせい〔名声〕
〈名〉Fame; note; renown; celebrity; distinction; a reputation; a name

content.content: 名声を博す
to win a reputation
彼はこの本で名声を博した
The book won him a reputation.
赫々たる名声
a brilliant reputation
彼は名声赫々たり
He enjoys a brilliant reputation.
彼は名声の高い大将だ
He is a distinguished general―a general of great distinction.
その名声全国に轟く
His name is known throughout the land.
その名声世界に轟く
His fame rings throughout the world―(より普通の第二構文は)―The whole world rings with his fame―(また)―He enjoys a world-wide fame.
名声を天下に轟かす
to make a noise in the world
彼の名声は地に落ちた
His reputation is blasted―His fame is gone.

content:
めいせき〔明晰〕

content.content: 明晰な頭脳だ
He has a clear head.
言語明晰
He uses perspicuous language.
彼の文は明晰を欠いている
His style is wanting in clearness―wanting in perspicuity.
歴史家は明晰なる想像力を要す
A historian must have a vivid imagination.

めいせん〔銘仙〕
〈名〉A coarse silk cloth

めいせんじしょう〔名詮自性〕
〈熟語〉The name and the reality correspond with each other.; It is true to its name.

めいせんじゅつ〔名占術〕
〈名〉Onomancy

content:
めいそう〔名僧〕
〈名〉A famous priest; a great priest

content.content: 名僧智識
a learned priest

めいそう〔迷想〕
〈名〉A delusion; an illusion

content:
めいそう〔瞑想〕
〈名〉Meditation; contemplation:(=する) to meditate; to contemplate

content.content: 瞑想に耽る
to be sunk in meditation
瞑想を破る
to disturb one's meditations

めいぞく〔名族〕
〈名〉An illustrious family

めいた〔目板〕
〈名〉A narrow strip of board to cover the seam of two boards

content:
めいだい〔命題〕
〈名〉A proposition

content.content: 全称命題
a universal proposition
特称命題
a particular proposition
肯定命題
an affirmative proposition
否定命題
a negative proposition
命題の交換
variation of proposition

〈名〉Sagacious; perspicacious; talented and erudite

content:
めいだつ〔明達〕

content.content: めいたつ〔明達〕

めいたん〔明且〕
〈名、副〉Tomorrow morning

content:
めいだん〔明断〕
〈名〉A clear decision

content.content: 明断を下す
to cut the Gordian knot

めいち〔明智〕
〈名〉Sagacity; perspicacity; acumen

content:
めいちゅう〔命中〕
〈名〉Hitting the mark:(一回なら)a hit:(=する) to hit the mark; to take effect; to tell

content.content: 砲弾は標的に命中した
The shot hit the target.
五六発打ったけれども一発も命中しなかった
Five or six shots were fired, but none took effect.
一発も命中せざるは無し(百発百中)
Every shot tells.
弾は命中せぬ
The shot missed the mark.
敵の弾は命中せぬ
The enemy's shots go wide―go wild―The enemy shoot wide―shoot wild.
命中弾、不命中弾

めいちゅう〔螟虫〕
〈名〉The larva of the pearl-moth

めいちょ〔名著〕
〈名〉A fine work; a masterpiece

content:
めいてい〔酩酊〕
〈名〉Drunkenness; intoxication; inebriation:(=する) to get drunk; to become intoxicated; to become inebriated

content.content: 酩酊いたしました
I am drunk―I am intoxicated.
彼は酩酊している
He is drunk―intoxicated―tipsy―in his cups―in liquor―disguised in liquor―under the influence of wine.
ひどく酩酊している
He is dead drunk―beastly drunk―fuddled with drink.
酩酊の上とは言いながらあのようなことをしては言い訳がたたぬ

〈名〉A wise man; a sage

content:
めいど〔冥土〕
〈名〉The abode of the shades; Hades

content.content: 冥土へ行く、冥土へ旅立つ
to go down into the shades―go to one's last account
冥土の土産にする
to take anything with one out of the world
冥土の道連れにしてやす
I will make you bear me company in death.
冥土より帰りし客も無し
No traveller ever returned from that bourne.
冥土の道に王侯無し
“Death is a leveller.”
冥土の旅
a journey to the shades
門松は
The New Year's pine
冥土の旅の
Is nothing save
一里塚
A milestone to the grave.

めいとう〔名刀〕
〈名〉A famous sword; a fine blade

めいとう〔名答〕
〈名〉A definite answer:(=する) to give a definite answer

content:
めいどう〔鳴動〕
〈名〉Rumbling:(=する) to rumble

content.content: 大山鳴動して鼠一匹
“A mountain, rumbling in travail, brought forth a mouse”―“Much ado about nothing”―“ Much cry and little wool.”

めいとく〔明徳〕
〈名〉Glorious virtue; illustrious virtue

content:
めいにち〔命日〕
〈名〉The anniversary of one's death

content.content: 今日は親父の命日だ
Today is the anniversary of my father's death.

めいぬ〔牝犬〕
〈名〉A female dog; a bitch(は忌語)

content:
めいば〔名馬〕
〈名〉A good steed; a Bucephalus

content.content: 名馬には癖あり
A Bucephalus will have his vices―A great man will have great faults.

content:
めいはく〔明白〕
〈形〉Clear, plain, obvious (meaning); clear, lucid, perspicuous (style); clear, distinct, vivid (idea); clear, explicit, express (statement); clear, plain, evident, manifest (proof); clear, plain, obvious, patent, glaring (fact); clear, plain, evident, obvious (reason); clear, plain, evident, apparent (sign); clear, sharp (distinction); clear, decided (superiority); clear obvious, pronounced (tendency); clear, lucid (explanation); clear, luminous (writer); glaring (error):(=に) clearly; plainly; evidently; manifestly; obviously

content.content: 彼の無罪な事は明白である
It is clear that he is innocent.
明白にそう言ってある
It is explicitly stated―expressly stated.
それで事が明白になる
That makes the matter clear.
事実は極めて明白である
The fact is as clear as day―as plain as a pikestaff―as plain as the nose on your face.
事実は明白で証拠は要らぬ
The fact is too clear to require proof.
これほど明白な事実が挙がったにもかかわらず彼は服罪せぬ
He does not plead guilty in the face of these glaring facts.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼が凡人でないことは明白である
One can see at a glance―see with half an eye―that he is no common being.
彼の欠点は明白だ
His faults lie on the surface.
この話の嘘なことは明白だ
The story is false on the face of it.

めいはんがん〔名判官〕
〈名〉A great judge; a wise judge; a second Daniel; a second Ooka

content:
めいび〔明媚〕
〈形〉Beautiful

content.content: 風光明媚
The scenery is beautiful.
風光明媚の地
a place of scenic beauty

content:
めいひつ〔名筆〕
〈名〉(事)good handwriting; fine penmanship; skilful calligraphy; skilful painting; skilful drawing:(人)a master penman; a master painter

content.content: 君は名筆だ
You write a fine hand.
名筆は筆を選ばず
“The cunning workman does not quarrel with his tool.”

content:
めいひん〔名品〕
〈名〉A fine article

content.content: これはすてきな名品だ
It is a ripping article―a stunner―a gem.

content:
めいびん〔明敏〕
〈形〉Clear and quick; acute; astute; shrewd; sagacious

content.content: 彼は明敏な頭脳を持っている
He has an acute head.

めいふ〔冥府〕
〈名〉Hades; the judgment-seat of Yama(―Enma)

content:
めいふく〔冥福〕
〈名〉Heavenly bliss; the repose of one's soul

content.content: 冥福を祈る
to pray for the repose of one's soul

content:
めいぶつ〔名物〕
〈名〉Anything for which a place is noted; a noted product; a specialty; a notability; a lion; an institution

content.content: 火事は江戸の名物と言ったものだ
Edo used to be noted for its fires.
ご当地の名物は何ですか
What is your place noted for?
正則は東京の名物だ
S. E. G. is one of the institutions of Tokyo.
彼は大正の名物男だ
He is one of the notabilities of Taisho.
彼は文学界の名物男だ
He is a lion of the literary world―a literary lion.
東京の名物を見た
I have seen the lions of Tokyo.
その町の名物は城だ
A castle marks the town.
ロンドン名物の霧、東京名物の塵
the fog of London―the dust of Tokyo
名物にうまい物無し
The reality falls short of the fame―The fame outruns the reality.

content:
めいぶん〔名分〕
〈名〉
1. (=名義)justification; warrant; claim; legitimacy

content.content: 戦端を開いては名分が立たぬ
There will be no justification of a war―We shall have no warrant for a war.
名分の無い軍
an unjustifiable war―an unwarrantable war
彼は財産を争う名分が無い
He has no claim to the property.
名分を明らかにする
to establish the legitimacy (of a government, etc.)

content: 2. (=分際)one's moral relation, one's duty (to one's lord or parents)

content.content: 名分を正しくする
to know one's station

content:
めいぶん〔名文〕
〈名〉A model composition; a fine piece of prose

content.content: ここは実に名文だ
This is a fine passage―a beautiful passage.
名文集
a prose anthology―gems of prose

content:
めいぶん〔名聞〕
〈名〉Fame

content.content: 名聞に溺れる
to thirst after fame
名聞慾
desire for fame

content:
めいぶん〔明文〕
〈名〉An express provision

content.content: 法律に明文あり
The law contains an express provision―There is an express provision in the law―It is (expressly) provided for in the law.
この点については法律に明文無し
There is no provision in the law―It is not provided for in the law―on this point.
契約に明文あり
It is expressly stipulated in the contract.
事実は明文あり
The fact is down in black and white―The fact stands written in black and white.

content:
めいぼ〔名簿〕
〈名〉A register of names; a list of names; the rolls; the book

content.content: 名が名簿に載っている
His name is on the list―on the rolls.
名を名簿に載せる
to place one's name on the list―register one's name―enroll one's name
名を名簿から除く
to strike one's name off the list
その名は名簿の筆頭第一に出ている
His name stands first on the list―heads the list―leads the rest.
お名前を名簿にお付け下さい
Please write your name in the book
職員名簿
a list of the staff
寄付者名簿
a subscription list
会員名簿
a list of members

content:
めいぼう〔名望〕
〈名〉Repute; reputation; popularity

content.content: 名望を得る
to win a reputation―win popularity―rise in the public estimation
名望を失う
to lose one's reputation―lose popularity―fall in the public estimation
彼は名望家だ
He is a man of good repute―He enjoys a good reputation.

content:
めいぼう〔明眸〕
〈名〉Bright eyes

content.content: 明眸皓歯
bright eyes and white teeth―female beauty―a beautiful woman

content:
めいぼうか〔名望家〕
〈名〉A man of good repute

content.content: 彼は名望家だ
He enjoys a good reputation.

めいぼく〔名木〕
〈名〉A famous tree; a good tree

content:
めいみゃく〔命脈〕
〈名〉The thread of life; life

content.content: 命脈を保つ、命脈をつなぐ
to keep anything alive
会社は僅かに命脈を保っている
The company barely keeps itself alive―barely keeps its head above water.
現内閣の命脈は何年続くか
What will be the life of the present Cabinet?

content:
めいむ〔迷夢〕
〈名〉A delusion; an illusion; a fallacy:(女に迷うの意味なら)infatuation; fascination; enchantment:(宗教に迷うの意味なら)superstition

content.content: 迷夢が覚める
to be disillusioned―be disenchanted―come to one's senses
放蕩息子はまだ迷夢が覚めぬ
The prodigal son has not come to his senses yet.
人の迷夢を覚ます
to disillusion one―disenchant one―bring one to one's senses
(まだ夢が覚めぬなら)僕が迷夢を覚ましてやる
I will bring him to his senses.
迷夢を打破する
to shatter an illusion―explode a fallacy―open one's eyes
彼の一言に迷夢を打破された
His word was an eye-opener.

content:
めいめい〔冥々〕
〈形〉Dark

content.content: 冥々の裡に葬らる
to be buried in oblivion

content:
めいめい〔命名〕
〈名〉Naming; christening:(=する) to name (one something); to christen (ore something)

content.content: 長男を太郎と命名した
The eldest son was named Taro―christened Taro.
命名式
The ceremony of naming―christening.

content:
めいめい〔銘々〕
〈名〉Each:(=の) each one's own; respective; several

content.content: めいめいに名が付いている
Each has its own name.
めいめい部屋を持っている
Each has his own room.
めいめいの席にお着きなさい
Go to your respective seats!
生徒はめいめいの家へ帰った
The boys have gone to their several homes.
めいめいに役割が付いている
A part is assigned to each.
めいめいの好き好き
“Every man to his taste.”
予防法はめいめいの注意に俟たなければならぬ
As for preventive measures, we must look to each man to take care of himself.

content:
めいめいはくはく〔明々白々〕
〈形〉As clear as day; as plain as a pikestaff; glaring (fact or error); obvious (mistake)

content.content: これは明々白々だ
It is as clear as day―“He who runs may read.”
明々白々たる誤りだ
It is a glaring error―an obvious mistake.
これらの明々白々たる事実が挙がったにかかわらず彼はまだ無罪を主張している
He still assers his innocence in the face of these glaring facts.

content:
めいめつする〔明滅する〕
〈自動〉To twinkle; to flicker; to glimmer

content.content: 星は明滅する
The stars twinkle.
灯火風に明滅す
A light flickers in the wind.
遠方に灯火の明滅するを見る
I see a glimmering light in the distance.

content:
めいもう〔迷妄〕
〈名〉A delusion; an illusion; a fallacy

content.content: 迷妄を打破する
to shatter an illusion―explode a fallacy―open one's eyes
彼の一言に迷妄を打破された
His word was an eye-opener.

content:
めいもう〔溟濛〕
〈形〉Dark; gloomy

content.content: 溟濛咫尺{めいもうしせき}を弁せず
It is so dark that one can not see an inch before one.

content:
めいもく〔名目〕
〈名〉
1. (=名義)a name:(=の) nominal

content.content: 名目だけの君主だ
He is a king only in name―a nominal king―titular sovereign.
名目だけの社長だ
He is a nominal president―a titular president.
名目社員
a nominal partner
名目だけの価に買った
I bought it at a nominal price.
名目だけの金額を払えば好い
You have only to pay a nominal sum.

content: 2. (=口実)a pretext; a pretence; a justification

content.content: 戦争を起こす名目が無い
There is no pretext for war―no justification of a war.
彼は病気という名目で退いた
He resigned on the pretence of illness.

content:
めいもくする〔瞑目する〕
〈自動〉To close one's eyes; to breathe one's last; to expire; to die

content.content: そうすりゃ安心して瞑目することができる
Then I shall be able to close my eyes in peace.

content:
めいもん〔名門〕
〈名〉A good family; a noble family; an illustrious family:(=の) well-born; high-born

content.content: 彼は名門の出だ
He comes of a good family―He is sprung from an illustrious stock.
名門の公達
a scion of nobility
名門の姫君
a high-born maiden

content:
めいやく〔盟約〕
〈名〉
1. (=誓約)a covenant; a contract; a pact:(=する) to covenant, contract (with a power)

content.content: 何国と盟約を結ぶ
to conclude a pact with power
盟約書
a covenant
盟約国
the high contracting powers

content: 2. (=同盟)alliance; confederacy; league:(=する) to ally oneself, league oneself, confederate oneself (with a state)

content.content: 何国と盟約を結ぶ
to form an alliance―enter into an alliance―with a power
盟約国
an allied power―a confederate state

めいゆう〔名優〕
〈名〉A famous actor; a great actor; a star (actor)

content:
めいよ〔名誉〕
〈名〉
1. (=面目)honour; credit; character:(=の) honourable

content.content: あのような人は国家の名誉だ
Such a man is an honour to his country.
国家の名誉を維持する
to maintain the honour of the country
あのような生徒は学校の名誉だ
Such a student is a credit to his school.
この事は学校の名誉に関する
The matter concerns the honour of the school.
このような人を出すのは家の名誉になる
Such a man does honour to his family―redounds to the honour of his family.
息子の出世は親の名誉になる
The son's advancement does credit to his father―reflects credit on his father.
(お招聘を受けるのは)身の名誉と存じます
I appreciate the honour.
この演壇に立つのは私の名誉とする処です
I esteem it an honour to be allowed to address you.
これは身に余る名誉です
This is undeserved honour.
これは名誉に関することだ
The matter concerns my honour―My honour is concerned―My honour is at stake.
弁明しておかないと名誉に関する
I must clear myself, for my honour is at stake.
そんなことをすると名誉に関するぞ(李下の冠)
You will compromise your honour.
名誉に関することはせぬ(李下に冠を正さず)
I will not compromise my honour.
名誉に関する問題
a point of honour
これは名誉に関する問題だ
This is a point of honour with me.
借金を返さないと名誉に関する
It is a point of honour with me to pay my debts―I make a point of paying my debts.
彼は名誉を重んずる
He has a high sense of honour―He is (keenly) alive to feelings of honour.
紳士は生命よりも名誉を重んずる
A gentleman values honour above life.
名誉を惜しむ
to be jealous of one's honour―be tender of one's honour
名誉ある人だ、名誉を重んずる人だ
He is an honourable man―a man of honour.
名誉を汚す
too sully one's honour―soil one's reputation―dishonour oneself―disgrace oneself―bring disgrace on oneself
家の名誉を汚す
to dishonour one's family―disgrace one's family
先祖の名誉を汚すな
Do not bring dishonour on your fathers!―bring disgrace on your fathers!
名誉を回復する
to vindicate one's honour―redeem one's honour―regain one's character―one's character is rehabilitated
名誉回復
vindication of honour―rehabilitation of character
名誉に掛けて(誓って)これを為さん
Upon my honour, I will do it―I will do it,honour bright―I will make a point of doing it.

content: 2. (=栄誉、光栄、名声)fame; reputation; honour; glory; good name

content.content: 名誉を博す
to win a reputation
彼はこの本で名誉を博した
The book won him a reputation.
彼は名誉がある
He enjoys a good reputation.
僕は金も名誉も要らぬ
I don't care for wealth or fame.
国家の為に死ぬのは名誉だ
It is a glory to die for one's country.
彼は名誉の戦死をした
He died a glorious death in battle.
名誉戦死者名簿
the roll of honour
職に殉す殉するほど名誉の死は無い
Nothing can be more glorious than to die at one's post.
名誉の負傷をする
to receive an honourable wound in battle
君はあんなことを聞き捨てにすると君の名誉に関するぞ
If you pass over such a remark in silence, it will endanger your reputation―your reputation will suffer.
名誉を害す
to injure one's reputation―be injurious to one's reputation
人の名誉を害するようなことを言うものでない
You should not say things that are injurious to people's reputation.
名誉を毀損する
to injure one's reputation―cast a slur on one's name―take away one's character―defame one
そんな風説を立てられては君の名誉を毀損する
Such rumours will cast a slur on your name.
名誉毀損
defamation―libel
彼の名誉は地に落ちた
His reputation is blasted―His fame is gone.→『めいよしん〔名誉心〕』

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 私はこの学校で教えるのを名誉と思います
I am proud to teach this school.

content: 〈形〉Honourable; honorary

content.content: 名誉の平和
honourable peace―peace with honour
名誉職
an honorary post
名誉会員
an honorary member
名誉領事
an honorary consul
名誉幹事
an honorary secretary
名誉教授
a professor emeritus

content:
めいよかいふく〔名誉回復〕
〈名〉Vindication of honour; rehabilitation of character:(決闘をしてなら)satisfaction:(=する) to vindicate one's honour; to redeem one's honour; to regain one's character; to rehabilitate one's character:(決闘をしてなら)to satisfy one's honour

content.content: 名誉回復をしなければならぬ
I must vindicate my honour.

content:
めいよきそん〔名誉毀損〕
〈名〉Libel; defamation

content.content: そんな風説を立てられては君の名誉毀損になる
Such rumours will injure your reputation―east a slur on your name.

めいよしょく〔名誉職〕
〈名〉An honorary post

content:
めいよしん〔名誉心〕
〈名〉Sense of honour; love of fame; pride

content.content: 貧を恥じるは誤れる名誉心
It is false pride to be ashamed of poverty.
君の名誉心に任せる(紳士をもって遇す)
I will trust to your honour.

content:
めいり〔名利〕
〈名〉Wealth and fame; fame or fortune; praise or pudding

content.content: 世人は名利に奔走する
Men toil for wealth or fame―woo fame or fortune.
名利に走る
to hanker after wealth or fame
我は名利を欲せず
I do not care for wealth or fame.
彼は名利に超然たり
He in above wealth or fame.

content:
めいりしん〔名利心〕
〈名〉A worldly mind

content.content: 彼は名利心が有る
He is worldly-minded―He is a worldly man.
名利心が無い
He is unworldly-minded―He is an unworldly man.

content:
めいりょう〔明瞭〕
〈形〉Clear, plain, obvious (meaning); clear, distinct (pronunciation); clear, legible (handwriting); clear, lucid, perspicuous (style); clear, distinct, vivid (idea); clear, express, explicit (statement); clear, plain; evident, manifest (proof); clear, plain, obvious, patent (fact); clear, plain, evident, obvious(reason); clear, plain, evident, apparent (sign); clear, sharp (distinction); clear, lucid (explanation); clear, luminous (writer):(=に) clearly; plainly; distinctly; evidently; manifestly; obviously

content.content: それで事が明瞭になる
That makes the matter clear.
ここの意味は明瞭だ
The meaning is clear―The meaning is plain―The meaning is obvious.
意味は明瞭を欠いている
The meaning is wanting in clearness―obscure.
彼は発音が明瞭だ
He has a clear pronunciation―a distinct pronunciation.
明瞭に発音せよ
Pronounce distinctly―Speak clearly.
彼は筆跡が明瞭だ
He writes a legible hand.
明瞭な文章を書く
He writes a lucid style―a perspicuous style.
彼の陳述はかなり明瞭だ
His statement is quite explicit.
先生は明瞭に説明する
He explains quite clearly.
明瞭に見える
It is distinctly visible.

content:
めいる〔滅入る〕
〈自動〉To droop; to languish; to be depressed

content.content: 気が滅入る
I feel depressed.
陰気で気が滅入る
The gloom is depressing.
気が滅入るような天気だ
The weather is depressing.
彼は滅入らんばかりにこがれている
He is languishing for love.
滅入らんばかりに悲しんでいる
He is plunged in grief.

content:
めいれい〔命令〕
〈名〉
1. A command; orders; directions; instructions; injunctions; the word; one's wishes; a commission; dictates (of conscience or reason):(=する) to command (one to do something―something to do done); to order (one to do something―something to be done); to direct (one to do something―something to be done); to instruct (one to do something―something to be done); to tell (one to do something); to bid (one do something); to cause (something to be done)

content.content: 命令を発する、命令を下す
to issue orders―give orders―give the word―say the word
ご命令さえあれば何でも致します
If you will only give the word, I will do anything.
前進の命令が下った
Orders are given to advance―We are ordered to advance.
船は出帆命令を受けている
The ship is under sailing orders.
封緘命令の下に出帆する
to sail under sealed orders
命令に従う、命令を守る、命令を奉ずる
to obey orders
命令に従え
Obey me!
子どもは親の命令に従うものだ
Children should obey their parents.
命令を守れ
Mind the word!
御命令を堅く相守る可く候
I will obey your orders to the letter―Your word shall be law to me.
彼は命令を奉じて英国に赴いた
He proceeded to England in obedience to orders.
御命令に従い早速上京可仕候
I shall come to town without delay in obedience to your wishes.
良心や理性の命令に従う
to obey the dictates of conscience―obey the dictates of reason
命令に背く
to disobey orders―act contrary to orders―act against one's wishes
命令違反
disobedience to orders
君の処置は命令違反だ
You have acted contrary to orders―disobeyed orders.
彼は親の命令に背いた
He has acted contrary to his father's wishes.
お前は俺の命令に背いたね
You have acted against wishes.
親の命令を重んずる
to have a regard for one's father's injunctions
彼は親の命令を重んじて酒を飲まぬ
He abstains from wine with a regard for his father's injunctions.
そのままそこに居れという命令に接した
I have received orders―I have orders―I am under orders―My orders are―to stay where I am.
そういう意味の命令に接した
I have (received) orders to that effect.
命令を待つ
to await orders
弁護士は命令を持って訴訟を起こすことになっている
My lawyer awaits my instructions to institute a suit.
命令を執行する
to execute one's orders―execute a commission
命令通り手続きをふみました
Pursuant to my orders, I have gone through the formalities.
ご命令通りに致しました
I have followed your instructions.
命令に依り
by order
知事の命令に依ってしたことだ
It was done by order of the governor.
天皇陛下の命令に依り
by command of the Emperor
彼の命令が行われる
His orders are obeyed―His word is law.
艦隊は命令一下直ちに出勤の準備をしている
The squadron is ready to sail at a moment's notice.
命令一下直ちに出勤の準備すべし
Hold yourself in readiness to put to sea at a moment's notice.
命令的
imperative―peremptory
彼の言う事は命令的だ
His words are given as orders.
命令法
the imperative mood
命令文
an imperative sentence

content:
めいろ〔迷路〕
〈名〉A maze

content.content: 迷路に陥る
to be lost in a maze―perplexed―puzzled

content:
めいろう〔明瓏〕
〈形〉Serene

content.content: 明瓏の玉
a serene gem―gems of purest ray serene

content:
めいろん〔名論〕
〈名〉A good argument; a sound argument; an original argument

content.content: そりゃ名論だ
That's well put.
彼はなかなか名論を吐く
He speaks to the point.

content:
めいろんたくせつ〔名論卓説〕
〈名〉Sound views; original views

content.content: 会議ではずいぶん名論卓説が出た
Many original views were broached at the conference.
名論卓説の士だ
He is a man of original views.

content:
めいわく〔迷惑〕
〈名〉
1. (=当惑)perplexity:(=する) to be perplexed; to be confounded

content.content: 身に覚えの無い大罪を言い掛けられて実に迷惑する
Such an unjust accusation utterly confounds me―I am confounded by the false charge.

content: 2. (=面倒)trouble:(=する) to get into trouble

content.content: 彼の世話をして迷惑した者は一人や二人でない
Several people have got into trouble through helping him.
あんな者にかかり合うと迷惑するぞ
If you have anything to do with such a man, you will get into trouble―He will get you into trouble.
君のためにたいそう迷惑した
You have got me into trouble―You have caused me a great deal of trouble.
そんなことをされるとこちらに迷惑がかかる
That would bring us into trouble.
決してご迷惑はかけません
I will take care not to cause you trouble.

content: 3. (=不便、うるさいこと)inconvenience; imposition; nuisance; annoyance; a bother; a bore:(=する) to be inconvenienced; to be incommoded; to be annoyed; to be bothered; to be bored; to suffer

content.content: そりゃ迷惑だ
I am annoyed―bothered.
それは甚だ迷惑だ
That's very annoying―That's a great bore―That's a botheration.
迷惑をかける
to put one to inconvenience―cause one inconvenience―inconvenience one―incommode one―annoy one―bother one―bore one―impose on one
ご迷惑をかけてすみません
I am sorry to put you to inconvenience―Excuse me for bothering you!
さぞご迷惑でしたろう
I must have inconvenienced you―You must have been bothered―You must have been annoyed.
決してご迷惑はかけません
I will take care not to inconvenience you.
あの人には始終迷惑しました
He has always imposed on me.
これまで迷惑を忍んでいました
I have had to put up with an imposition.
道路を掘られるのは世間の迷惑だ
The diggings in the roads are a public nuisance.
あの人の音楽は近所迷惑だ
Her music is a nuisance to neighbourhood.
君にそんなことをされてはあたり迷惑だ
If you do such a thing, the other will suffer―You do it at the expense of others.
人に迷惑をかけて身の明りを立てるとは男らしくない
It is not manly of him to clear himself at another's expense.
彼は頼まれて迷惑がっている
He is annoyed by the request―bothered by the request.
迷惑そうに仕事を引き受けた
He undertook the work as if it bothered him―as if it bored him.
かえってご迷惑でしょうがぜひお出で下さい
It must be a positive bother to you, but I will take no denial.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この金をお取り下さらないと迷惑致します
If you will not take the money, I shall feel hurt.
しもしない悪いことをしたと言われては僕は迷惑する
Such an imputation will concern my honour.
銀行が破産すると多くの人が迷惑する
If a bank fails, many people will be involved in the loss.
好い迷惑だ
I must bear the blame for others' faults―I am made a scapegoat of.
ありがた迷惑
a mistaken kindness―an unwelcome favour―too much of a good thing

content:
めうえ〔目上〕
〈名〉One's superiors; one's betters

content.content: 目上を敬え
Reverence your superiors!
目上に媚びる者に限って目下に横暴だ
Those who fawn upon their superiors, will lord it over their inferiors.
目上に反抗する
to defy one's superiors―kick against authority

content:
めうし〔牝牛〕
〈名〉A cow

content.content: 牡牛と牝牛
bull and cow

めうち〔目打ち〕
〈名〉
1. Perforation:(=する) to perforate (postage-stamps, etc.)
2. (=目打器)a perforator

content:
めうつり〔目移り〕
〈名〉Embarrassment in one's choice:(=する) to be embarrassed in one's choice

content.content: あまりたくさんあって目移りがする
There are so many that the choice is embarrassing―There is an embarrassing choice.
目移りがして選択に苦しむ
I am embarrassed in my choice―I do not know which to choose, each seems better than the others.
美人揃いで目移りがする
Each looks more beautiful than the others.

content:
めうま〔牝馬〕
〈名〉A mare

content.content: 牡馬と牝馬
stallion and mare

めおと〔夫婦〕
〈名〉Husband and wife; man and wife; a couple

めおとぼたん〔夫婦ボタン〕
〈名〉Sleeve-links

content:
めかお〔目顔〕
〈名〉A look

content.content: 目顔で知らせる
to intimate by a look―wink at one

content:
めかくし〔目隠し〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: めがくし〔目隠し〕

content:
めがくし〔目隠し〕
〈名〉
1. (人のは)a bandage over the eyes:(家などのは)a screen:(窓のは)a blind; a window-blind:(馬車馬のは)blinders; blinkers

content.content: 目隠しをする
(人なら)to blindfold one―(場所なら)―screen a place
彼は目隠しをして敵軍へ導かれた
He was led blindfolded into the enemy's camp.
目隠しの鬼ごっこ
blindman's buff―hoodman-blind
目隠しをして遊ぼう
Let us play (at) blindman's buff!
目隠しの鬼
the hoodman

content:
めかけ〔妾〕
〈名〉A concubine; a kept mistress; a subordinate wife

content.content: 妾を蓄える
to keep a concubine―keep a mistress
彼は妾腹の子だ
He is a child by a subordinate wife.

content:
めがける〔目掛ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=狙う)to aim at (anything)

content.content: 牡牛は小娘を目掛けて走りかかった
The bull ran at the girl.
勇士は敵陣を目がけて突進した
The warrior charged at the enemy.
我が艦隊は敵を目がけて進んだ
We bore down upon the enemy.
彼は敵を目がけて斬りつけた
He delivered a cut at his enemy.

content: 2. (=野心がある)to have an eye to―(anything)

content.content: 彼はあの地位を目がけている
He has an eye to the position―He has designs upon the position.
彼は女の財産を目がけている
He has an eye to her fortune―He has designs upon her fortune.
主人の娘を目がけている
He aspires to the band of his master's daughter.

めかご〔目籃〕
〈名〉An open-work basket

content:
めかす
〈自動〉To dress finely; to dress smartly; to dress oneself up; to trick oneself out; to spruce oneself up; to smarten oneself

content.content: あの女はめかしている
She is smartly dressed―finely tricked out.
あの男はめかしている
He is finely dressed―in his war-paint.
たいそうおめかしですね
(男に向かって言えば)What a fine gentleman you are!―(女に向かって言えば)―What a fine lady you are!
あれはめかし屋だ
He is a dandy―a fop―a swell―(米国では)―a dude.

content:
めかた〔目方〕
〈名〉Weight

content.content: この指環は目方が有る、目方が無い
The ring is heavy (in weight)―light (in weight).
目方を掛ける
to weigh anything
目方がいくら掛かる、目方がいくら有る
to weigh so much
この鰻を目方を掛けてご覧
Weigh this eel!
この鰻は目方が三百目ある
This eel weighs nearly three pounds.
君は目方が何貫目あるか
How many pounds do you weigh?
目方が増える
to gain weight―put on weigh
目方が減る
to lose weight
僕は目方が十斤増えた
I have put on 10 pounds―gained 10 pounds.
目方が五斤減った
I have lost 5 pounds.
この手紙は目方が超えている
The letter is overweight.
目方が切れる
It is short weight.
あの店は目方が好い、目方が悪い
They give good weight―give short weight―at that shop.
目方で売る
to sell anything by weight―sell anything by the pound
米国では魚を目方で売る
In America, fish is sold by the pound.
運賃は目方で取る
The carriage is charged by weight.

content:
めがつら〔目鬘〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: めかづら〔目鬘〕

content:
めがね〔眼鏡〕
〈名〉
1. (A pair of) spectacles(往々―specs―と略す); glasses; eye-glasses:(欲に)barnacles

content.content: 眼鏡をかける
(常になら)to wear spectacles―(取って掛ける)―put on one's spectacles
彼は眼鏡をかけている
He is wearing spectacles―He is in spectacles―He has spectacles on.
眼鏡をかけて読書している
He is reading in spectacles―with spectacles on.
眼鏡をかけずに読書ができない
He can not read without spectacles.
眼鏡をかけて見る
to look through spectacles
眼鏡越しに見る
to look over one's spectacles
眼鏡をはずす
to take off one's spectacles
眼鏡を買わなければならぬ
I must get a pair of spectacles.
彼は十度の眼鏡を掛けている
He wears glasses of 10°(ten degrees).
君の眼鏡は何度か
How strong are your glasses?
強度の眼鏡
powerful glasses―thick-lensed glasses
色眼鏡
tinted glasses
君は色眼鏡をかけて物を見る(偏見がある)
You look through coloured spectacles.
片眼鏡
a monocle―an eye-glass
芥除け眼鏡
goggles
眼鏡の玉
the glasses
眼鏡の縁
the rims
金縁の眼鏡
gold-rimmed spectacles
縁無しの眼鏡
rimless glasses―frameless spectacles
眼鏡の蔓
the bows
眼鏡師
an optician

content: 2. (=眼識)judgment; discernment; discrimination; a critical eye

content.content: お眼鏡が高い
You have a critical eye.
お眼鏡は違わぬ
Your judgment has not erred.
僕の眼鏡は決して違わない
My judgment never errs.
僕の眼鏡違いであった
I have mistaken my man―He has proved unworthy of my confidence.
眼鏡違いでなかった
He has proved worthy of my confidence―justified my confidence.
眼鏡違いにならないように頼む
You must justify my confidence in you.
大勢の眼鏡は違わぬ
“There is safety in numbers.”
お眼鏡に適った人がありましたか
Have you found a man to your taste?―after your fancy?―after your heart?
彼は主人の眼鏡に適った
He gained his master's confidence.
私は亡くなられたお父様のお眼鏡で貴方の後見をしているのだ
Your father thought fit to leave me your guardian.

content:
めきき〔目利き〕
〈名〉A judge; a connoisseur; a virtuoso

content.content: 彼は書画にかけては目利きだ
He is a connoisseur of paintings.
あなたは刀剣の目利きをなさいますか
Are you a judge of swords?

content:
めきめき
〈副〉Perceptibly; noticeably; appreciably; remarkably

content.content: 彼の病気はめきめき快くなる
His health is perceptibly improving.
数がめきめき増える
The number is noticeably increasing―appreciably increasing.
彼の英語はめきめき上達する
He makes remarkable progress in English.

めくぎ〔目釘〕
〈名〉A wooden nail (fixing the blade to the hilt)

めくされ〔目腐れ〕
〈形、名〉(A) blear-eyed (person)

content:
めくされがね〔目腐れ金〕
〈名〉A paltry sum; a pittance

content.content: そんな目腐れ金で何ができるものか
What can you do with such a paltry sum?
目腐金を貰って働いている
I work for a mere pittance.
百や二百の目腐れ金は要らん
I don't want a beggarly hundred or two.

content:
めぐすり〔目薬〕
〈名〉Eye-water; eye-wash; eye-lotion; collyrium; ophthalmic

content.content: 目薬をさす
to drop eye-water into the eye―use eye-lotion
そりゃ二階から目薬だ
That's “fanning the sun with a peacock's feather.”

content:
めくそ〔目糞〕
〈名〉Gum (of the eye)

content.content: 目糞鼻糞を笑う
“The pot calls the kettle black.”

content:
めくばせ〔目配せ〕
〈名〉Winking:(=する)to wink at (one); to tip (one) the wink; to cock one's eyes at (one); to make a sign with the eye

content.content: 彼は僕に目配せをしてそう言った
He said so with a wink at me.
互に目配せする
to exchange giances
二人は互いに顔を見合わして意味有り気な目配せをした
They exchanged significant glances―exchanged a look of intelligence.

content:
めくばり〔目配り〕
〈名〉Watch; superintendence:(=する) to watch; to keep watch; to superintend

content.content: 目配りが厳重で逃げる隙が無かった
Such a strict watch was kept on him, that saw no chance of escape.

content:
めぐみ〔恵〕
〈名〉
1. (=天の恵)grace; blessing

content.content: 天の恵によって病人も全快しました
The invalid has recovered by the grace of Heaven.
神の恵と感謝した
I thanked God for the blessing.
これは天の恵みです
This is a blessing from Heaven.
豊かな恵を受ける
to receive blessings

content: 2. (=恩恵)favour; kindness; love

content.content: 人に恵みを掛ける
to bestow favours on one―show one kindness
人の恵を乞う
to ask a favour of one
親の恵
parental love

content: 3. (=慈悲)mercy

content.content: この罪人に恵みを垂れさせ給え
Have mercy on me, a miserable sinner!
助かったのは天の恵みだ(ありがたい)
It is a mercy that I have escaped.

content: 4. (=慈善)benevolence; charity

content.content: 人に恵みを施す
to render benevolence to people
人の恵みに生活する(貰って食う)
to subsist on charity

めぐみぶかい〔恵深い〕
〈形〉Merciful; charitable; benevolent; kind

content:
めぐむ〔恵む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=天が人を恵む)to bless; bestow a blessing on (one)

content.content: 神は我れを恵み給えり
God has blessed me.
日本は恵まれた国である
Japan is a blessed land―a favoured country.
彼は子宝を恵まれている
He is blessed with children.

content: 2. (=恩恵を施す)to bestow favours on (one); to show (one)kindness; to love

content.content: 親は子を恵み子は親を敬う
The parents love their children, and the children reverence their parents.

content: 3. (=慈悲を垂れる)to have mercy on, be merciful to (one)

content.content: この罪人を恵ませ給え
Have mercy on me, a miserable sinner!

content:
4. (=慈善を行う)to render (one)benevolence
5. (=施し与える)to give in charity; to give alms (to the poor)

content.content: 貧民を恵む
to give to the poor―give alms to the poor―give in charity
金を恵む
to give one money
可哀そうだから着物を恵んでやった
I gave him some clothes out of pity.
旦那様や奥様方、どうぞ一文恵んでやって下さい(と乞食が言う)
Throw me a copper, ladies and gentlemen!
僕にも一部恵んでくれ給え
Will you make me a present of a copy?

めぐむ〔萌む〕
〈自動〉To germinate; to bud; to sprout

content:
めくら〔盲〕
〈名〉
1. (=盲人)a blind man:(集合的に言えば)the blind:(=の) blind

content.content: 世の中は盲千人目明き千人
There are as many men who can see as who can not―The discerning and the undiscerning divide the world.
盲になる
to go blind―lose one's eyesight
彼は眼病で盲になった
An eye-disease made him blind―left him blind―lost him his sight.
盲蛇に怖じず
“Fools rush in where angels fear to tread”―“Ignorance is the mother of impudence”―Ignorance is bold.
盲の垣覗きだ
It is all Greek to me.
盲の盲手引き
the blind leading the blind
盲に道を教わる
to get a blind man to show the way
盲の杖
the blind man's eyes
盲が杖を無くなしたよう
He is “a sheep without a shepherd.”

content: 2. (=明き盲)an illiterate person:(=の) illiterate; unlettered

めくらがい〔盲買い〕
〈名〉Buying blindly:(=する) to buy (anything) blindly; to buy a pig in the poke

content:
めくらさがし〔盲捜し〕
〈名〉Groping:(=する) to grope for (anything)

content.content: 暗闇でマッチ を盲捜した
I groped for the matches in the dark.

content:
めくらさぐり〔盲探り〕
〈名〉Groping:(=する) to grope for (anything)

content.content: 暗闇を盲探りに歩いた
I groped my way in the dark.
懐を盲探りした
I fumbled in my pockets.

content:
めぐらす〔廻らす、繞らす、環らす、旋らす、運らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=囲む)to surround, enclose, encircle, engirdle―(a space with a wall, etc.)

content.content: 邸内に塀をめぐらす
to surround the grounds with walls―wall the grounds
庭に垣をめぐらす
to enclose the garden with a fence―fence the garden
城に掘をめぐらす
to encircle a castle with a moat―moat a castle
我が国は四方をめぐらすに海をもってす
Japan is surrounded by the sea―Japan is a sea-girt land.

content: 2. (=廻す)to turn

content.content: 踵をめぐらす
to turn on one's heels
首をめぐらせば
When I look back upon the past―reflect on the past.

content: 3. (=思い運らす)to revolve (a scheme); to devise (a stratagem); to contrive (a scheme); to meditate (revenge); to concoct (a plot); to form (a design); to lay (a plan)

content.content: 一策をめぐらす
to revolve a scheme―devise a scheme―contrive a scheme―concoct a scheme
一策をめぐらして政権を握った
He assumed the reins of government by a stroke of policy.
復讐の策をめぐらす
to meditate revenge
計{はかりごと}をめぐらす
to devise a stratagem―concoct a plot―form a design―lay a plan
悪計をめぐらす
to revolve an evil scheme―form an evil design―devise mischief―concoct schemes―machinate
百計をめぐらす
to try every means in one's power―leave no means untried―leave no stones unturned
智慧をめぐらす
to set one's wits to work
戦争の結果などについていろいろと臆測をめぐらす、想像をめぐらす
They speculate upon the issue of the war―speculate as to which side will win.

content:
めぐらす〔廻らす、繞らす、環らす、旋らす、運らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=囲む)to surround, enclose, encircle, engirdle―(a space with a wall, etc.)

content.content: 邸内に塀をめぐらす

庭に垣をめぐらす

城に掘をめぐらす
to encircle a castle with a moat―moat a castle

〈他動〉

content.content: 踵をめぐらす
to turn on one's heels
首をめぐらせば
When I look back upon the past―reflect on the past.

content: 3. (=思い運らす)to revolve (a scheme); to devise (a stratagem); to contrive (a scheme); to meditate (revenge); to concoct (a plot); to form (a design); to lay (a plan)

content.content: 一策をめぐらす
to revolve a scheme―devise a scheme―contrive a scheme―concoct a scheme
一策をめぐらして政権を握った
He assumed the reins of government by a stroke of policy.
復讐の策をめぐらす
to meditate revenge
計{はかりごと}をめぐらす
to devise a stratagem―concoct a plot―form a design―lay a plan
悪計をめぐらす
to revolve an evil scheme―form an evil design―devise mischief―concoct schemes―machinate
百計をめぐらす
to try every means in one's power―leave no means untried―leave no stones unturned
智慧をめぐらす
to set one's wits to work
戦争の結果などについていろいろと臆測をめぐらす、想像をめぐらす
They speculate upon the issue of the war―speculate as to which side will win.

content:
めぐらす〔廻らす、繞らす、環らす、旋らす、運らす〕

to encircle a castle with a moat―moat a castle

Japan is surrounded by the sea―Japan is a sea-girt land.

content: 2. (=廻す)to turn

content.content: 踵をめぐらす
to turn on one's heels
首をめぐらせば
When I look back upon the past―reflect on the past.

content: 3. (=思い運らす)to revolve (a scheme); to devise (a stratagem); to contrive (a scheme); to meditate (revenge); to concoct (a plot); to form (a design); to lay (a plan)

content.content: 一策をめぐらす
to revolve a scheme―devise a scheme―contrive a scheme―concoct a scheme
一策をめぐらして政権を握った
He assumed the reins of government by a stroke of policy.
復讐の策をめぐらす
to meditate revenge
計{はかりごと}をめぐらす
to devise a stratagem―concoct a plot―form a design―lay a plan
悪計をめぐらす
to revolve an evil scheme―form an evil design―devise mischief―concoct schemes―machinate
百計をめぐらす
to try every means in one's power―leave no means untried―leave no stones unturned
智慧をめぐらす
to set one's wits to work
戦争の結果などについていろいろと臆測をめぐらす、想像をめぐらす
They speculate upon the issue of the war―speculate as to which side will win.

content:
めくらばん〔盲判〕
〈名〉Stamping one's seal blindly

content.content: 盲判を押す
to sign a paper blindly―(without looking at the contents)

content:
めくらめっぽうに〔盲滅法に〕
〈副〉Blindly; at random

content.content: 盲滅法にやる
to go it blind
(捜す当てが無いから)盲滅法に捜すよりほかは無い
I must search at random.
人を知らないから盲滅法に選ぶのだ
My want of knowledge of the men obliges me to choose at random.

content:
めぐり〔廻り〕
〈名〉
1. (=回転)turn; rotation; revolution
2. (=周囲)the circumference; one's surroundings
3. (=循環)circulation

content.content: 血のめぐり
circulation of blood
按摩は血のめぐりを好くする
Shampooing promotes the circulation of blood.
血のめぐりが悪い(悟りが鈍い)
to be dull of comprehension
血のめぐりの悪い奴だ
What a dull witted fellow you are!

content: 4. (=遍歴)a tour

content.content: 名所めぐりをする
to make a tour round places of note
島めぐりをする
to make a tour of the island
伊豆廻りをしょうと思う
I am going to make a tour of Idsu.

content: 5. (=月経)catamenia; menstruation; the menses; the courses; the periods; the turns; the flowers; the monthlies

めぐりあい〔廻り合い〕
〈名〉A chance meeting

content:
めぐりあう〔廻り合う〕
〈他動〉To come across (one); to cross one's path

content.content: どうか仇敵にめぐり合いたい
I am dying to come across the enemy I seek.

めくりこよみ〔めくり暦〕
〈名〉A block-calendar

content:
めくる
〈他動〉
1. (=ひっくりかえす)to turn up (a card)
2. (=はぐ)to take off (the cover)

content.content: 蒲団をめくる
to take off one's bedclothes
床板をめくる
to tear up the flooring
屋根をめくる
to unroof a house

content: 3. (=捲る)to turn (the edge)

content.content: 刀の刃をめくる
to turn the edge of a sword―blunt the edge of a sword

content:
めぐる〔廻る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=一周する)to revolve; to move round; to go round; to come round

content.content: 地球は太陽をめぐる
The earth revolves round the sun―moves round the sun―goes round the sun.
季節がめぐって来る
The seasons come round.
因果はめぐる小車
Effect must follow cause.

content: 2. (=循環する)to circulate

content.content: 血がめぐる
Blood circulates―Blood flows in the veins.

content: 3. (=遍歴する)to make a tour of (a place); to go about (a place)

content.content: 彼は欧米をめぐって来た
He has made a tour of Europe and America―He has been travelling in Europe and America.
方々めぐりめぐった末遂に日本へ流れ込んだ
After wandering about everywhere,―After knocking about the world,―he at length drifted into Japan.

めくわす
〈自動〉To wink (at one)

めくわせ
〈名〉A wink:(=する) to wink (at one)

content:
めこぼし〔目溢し〕
〈名〉Connivance:(=する) to connive at, wink at, pass over, overlook (an offence, etc.)

content.content: 今度だけお目こぼしを願います
I beg you will overlook my offence for this time.

content:
めさき〔目先き〕
〈副〉(=目の前に)before one's eyes

content.content: 彼女の面影が目先にちらつく
Her face is present to my senses.
その恐ろしい光景がまだ目先に付いている
The dreadful sight still haunts my eyes.

content:
〈名〉
1. (=先見)foresight

content.content: 彼は目先が利く、目先が見える
He has foresight―He is far-sighted―long-headed.
目先が利かぬ、目先が見えぬ
He has no foresight―He can not see beyond his nose.

content: 2. (=外見)appearance

content.content: 景色は目先が変って面白い
The view is diversified.
目先の変った柄があるか
Are there any novel patterns?
目先を変える
to relieve the eye―relieve the monotony
何か目先を変える物を置くとよい
You must introduce something by way of relief.
目先を変えたというだけだ
It is “an old friend in a new house.”

content:
めざす〔目指す〕
〈他動〉To mark (a man as or for something); to spot (a man as the culprit); to fix upon, fasten upon (a man as a victim, etc.)

content.content: 氏は社会主義者として当局者に目指されている
He is marked as a socialist by the authorities.
彼は注意人物として警察から目指されている
He is marked by the police as a dangerous character―He has fallen under the eye of the police.
僕はあの男を犯人と目指した
I have spotted him as the culprit.
彼は田舎ふうなものだからスリに目指される
His rustic appearance often causes him to be fixed upon by pickpockets as an easy victim.
彼が彼らの目指す敵だ
He is the object of their enmity.

content:
めざとい〔目敏い〕
〈形〉
1. (=目が早い)quick-eyed; sharp-eyed

content.content: 彼は目ざとく癖を見つける
He has a quick eye for flaws.

content: 2. (=目覚め易い)(to be) a light sleeper

content.content: 僕は寝坊だが弟は目ざとい
I am a heavy sleeper, while my brother is a light sleeper.
老人は目ざとい
Old people are light sleepers.

content:
めざまし〔目覚し〕
〈名〉(=時計の目覚し)The alarum

content.content: 六時に目覚しをかけた
I have set the alarum at six.

content:
めざましい〔目覚しい〕
〈形〉Conspicuous (dress); striking (appearance); brilliant (success); dramatic (event); dazzling (sight); meteoric (spectacle); surprising (result); astonishing (feat); amazing (exploit, etc.)

content.content: めざましい光景だ
It is a striking sight―a dazzling sight―a meteoric spectacle.
めざましい功を樹てる
to perform a brilliant deed
めざましいことをして世を驚かす
to do wonders―set the river on fire
欧州戦には飛行機と潜航艇がめざましい働きをした
The aeroplane and the submarine were in evidence in the European war.

めざましどけい〔目覚し時計〕
〈名〉An alarum-clock; an alarm-clock

めざます〔目覚す〕
〈他動〉To awaken; to wake (one) up:(覚醒さすの意味なら)to open one's eyes

content:
めさめる〔目覚める〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: めざめる〔目覚める〕

content:
めざめる〔目覚める〕
〈自動〉To awake; to wake up:(覚醒するの意味なら)to awaken; to come to one's senses; to have one's eyes opened

content.content: 目覚めてみると自分は見慣れぬ所に寝ておった
I awoke to find myself lying in a strange place.
目覚めて見れば銀世界
I awoke to find the world turned white.
目覚めて見ればこはいかに
I awake and―10 and behold!

content:
めざわり〔目障り〕
〈名〉An eyesore; an offence to the eye:(=な) offensive to the eye

content.content: 目ざわりになる
to offend the eye
あの建物はめざわりだ
That building is an eyesore.
道路の目ざわりになる物を取り払え
Clear the road from everything that is offensive to the eye.
何か殿のお目ざわりになりましたか
Has anything offended my lord's eye?

content:
めし〔召し〕
〈名〉Summons; call

content.content: ご主人のお召しです
Master is calling you―Master wants you.
宮中からのお召しで急いで案内した
I hastened to court in response to an Imperial summons.
召しに応ずる
to obey the summons―respond to the call
召しに応じて国を守った
In response to the call,―Prompt at the call of duty,―he fought for his country.

content:
めし〔飯〕
〈名〉
1. (=米飯)boiled rice; cooked rice

content.content: 飯を炊く
to boil rice―cook rice
飯は炊くばかりに用意ができている
The rice is ready for cooking.
三杯の飯
three bowls of rice
金持ちやっぱり飯三杯
There are limits to the enjoyment of wealth.
白い飯
plain rice
硬い飯、軟かい飯
dry rice―moist rice
飯が硬い
The rice is too dry.
飯が軟らかい
The rice is too moist.
飯の上の蠅のようだ
It is a nuisance.
一粒の飯
a grain of boiled rice
飯粒
grains of boiled rice
飯粒で鯉を釣る
to throw a sprat to catch a whale
飯茶碗
a rice-bowl
飯びつ
a rice-tub
飯屋
an eating-house

content: 2. (=食事)a meal; a dinner

content.content: 飯を食う
to eat one's meals―take a meal―make one's meal
彼は飯を食いにうちへ行った
He has gone home for his dinner.
彼といっしょに飯を食った
I have dined with him―broken bread with him.
大飯を食う
to make a hearty meal
彼は臭い飯を食ったことがある
He has tasted prison diet―He has been in prison―He is an old jail-bird.
同じ釜の飯を食った仲だ
We have eaten off the same trencher―lived under the same roof.
飯を食って行き給え
Won't you stay dinner?
君が帰らないから飯を食わずに待っていた
We have been waiting dinner for you.
誰が帰らなくとも待たずに飯を食う
We wait dinner for no one.
この子はよく飯を食う子だ
The boy has a good appetite.
運動すると飯が食える
Exercise gives you a good appetite.
心配で飯がのどを通らぬ
Anxiety has deprived me of my appetite.
悪いことを聞いて飯をまずくした
The bad news has spoiled my dinner.
飯を食わずにいる
to go without one's meals
行って見ると家族は飯の最中だった
I found the family at table.
目に三度の飯
three meals a day
彼は三度の飯よりも読書が好きだ
Books are meat and drink to him.
三度の飯を二度にしても国家の為に尽す
I will make any sacrifices for the sake of my country.
飯時
meal-time―dinner-hour

content: 3. (=生計)living; livelihood; one's bread

content.content: どうして飯を食っているか
How do you live?―get your living?―make a living?―gain your livelihood?―earn your bread?
青年は第一に飯を食うことを覚えなければならぬ
The first thing a young man must learn, is to get his living.
飯が食えるか
Can you get your living?―gain your livelihood?―get enough to live on?
どうかこうか飯を食っている
I manage to live.
なんとかして飯を食わねばならぬ
I must live anyhow―make the pot boil―keep the pot boiling.
彼は独りで飯が食えるようになった
He can now get his own living―He has fallen into the way of getting his own living.
彼は僕に飯が食えるようにしてくれた
He has put me in the way of getting my own living.
彼は何で飯を食っているか
What does he live on?
月給で飯を食っている
He lives on his salary.
商売をして飯を食っている
He lives by his trade.
英語を教えて飯を食っている
He lives by teaching English.
筆の先で飯を食っている
He lives by the pen.
働いて飯を食っている
He works for his living―works for his bread―earns his living.
働いて飯を食うのは恥じるに及ばぬ
It is honourable to work for one's bread.
飯を食う為に働く
to work for a living―work for one's bread
働かないで飯の食えるようになりたい
I wish to rise above the necessity of labour.
彼は金が有るから働かないでも飯が食える
His wealth raises him above the necessity of labour.
遊んでおって働かないで飯が食えるなら結構だ
If you can live without working,―live in idleness,―eat the bread of idleness,―it is well.
彼は飯を食うだけの働きが有る(穀つぶしではない)
He is earning his salary―worth his salt.
飯を食うだけの働きがない(穀つぶしだ)
He is not worth his salt.
医者や弁護士は人の難儀で飯を食う
Doctors and lawyers live on people's distresses.
話し家は世間の
The story-teller lives upon
あらで飯を食い
The faults of men beneath the sun.
私は十年以上も海軍の飯を食っております
I have served in the navy for upwards of ten years.
あれは仙台の飯を食った男だ
He was once a retainer of the Lord of Sendai.
他人の飯を食う
to live among strangers―depend on strangers―to be in service
お前は他人の飯を食ったことがない
You have never been in service.
少しは他人の飯を食ってみるがよい
You ought to know what it is to love among strangers―to depend on strangers.
彼は免職になったら飯の食い上げだ
If he loses his place, he will have nothing to live on.
そんなことをしたら飯の食い上げだ
I should lose my place if I were to do such a thing―It would cost me my place to do such a thing―It is as much as my place is worth to do such a thing.
飯の種
means of livelihood
この本は飯の種だ
The book is a pot-boller.

めしあがりもの〔召上り物〕
〈名〉(Honorific for) food

content:
めしあがる〔召上がる〕
〈他動〉(Honorific for) to eat; to drink; to take; to have

content.content: 何をめしあがりますか

お茶を一つめしあがれ

何もめしあがるような物はありません

皆さんめしあがって下さい

どうぞたくさんめしあがれ

ちっともめしあがりませんね
I am afraid you are making a poor meal.
ごゆるりとめしあがれ
I shall leave you to your dinner.
(西洋人に向かって)貴方は日本食をめしあがりますか
Can you live on Japanese food?

stag and hind―buck and doe

content.content: その者を召し連れて参れ

彼は妻子を召し連れておった

content:
めじり〔目尻〕

content.content: 彼は目尻が上がっている

目尻が下がっている
He has turned-down eyes.
(女に)目尻を下げる
to cast sheep's eyes on a woman
目尻を上げる
to show one's spirit

content:

content.content: あの建物はこの辺の目じるしになる

〈他動〉
1. (=呼ぶ)to call; to summon; to send for (one)

content.content: お召しになりましたか

陛下には公を召されて密談数刻に渡らせられた

content: 2. (Honorific for) to wear, put on, have on (a coat); to take (a bath); to ride in, take (a ricksha); to buy (a flower); to suit, please (one's fancy)

content.content: 今日は洋服を召しますか
Will you wear foreign clothes today?
お召になっている着物が汚れました
The clothes you have on are soiled.
別のをお召しなさい
Put on another suit!
風呂をお召になりますか

自動車をお召になりますか
Will you take a motor-car?
花を召しませ
Will you buy a flower?
どれもお気に召しませんか
Do none of these suit you?―please you?
お年を召していらっしゃる
He is old.
お年を召すとその癖がお直りになります
You will grow out of your habit when you grow older.

めす〔牝、雌〕
〈名〉The female (of animals, birds or insects)

めす〔牝、雌〕
〈名〉The female (of animals, birds or insects)

めすおす〔牝牡、雌雄〕
〈名〉Male and female

めすおす〔牝牡、雌雄〕
〈名〉Male and female

content:
めずらしい〔珍しい〕
〈形〉
1. Rare (occurrence); curious (article); strange (sight); new (experience); novel (object); singular (case); uncommon (event); unusual (calmness); exceptional (success); phenomenal (genius); unexpected (visitor); nice (present)

content.content: 珍しいもの
a rarity―a curiosity―a novelty
これは珍しい出来事だ
It is a rare occurrence―an uncommon event.
京都で火事は珍しい
Fires are of rare occurrence in Kyoto.
珍しい品物だ
It is a curious article―a rare article―a novel article.
珍しい光景だ
It is a curious sight―a strange sight―a singular sight―a novel sight.
珍しい事件だ
It is a rare case―a curious case―a singular case.
珍しい成功だ
It is an exceptional success―a phenomenal success.
見るもの聞くもの珍しくないものは無い
Everything I see is new to me―strange to me―a revelation to me.
今時分雪の降るのは珍しい
Snow is a rare sight at this time of the year.
あの人の雄弁は珍しい雄弁だ
He is gifted with rare eloquence.
君が家に居るのは珍しい
It is a rare occurrence that I find you at home.
その頃は西洋人は珍しかった
A foreigner was a curiosity in those days.
西洋人が通ると人が珍しそうに眺めたものだ
People used to stare at a foreigner with curiosity.
あのような漢学者は当節は珍しい
Such a Chinese scholar is quite a rarity nowadays.
あんな正直な人は珍しい
Such an honest man is quite a curiosity.
この新趣向は珍しい
The new departure is quite a novelty.
先生の病気は珍しい
His illness is quite an event.
あれは珍しい人だ
He is a rarity―a man in a thousand.
今時の学生には珍しい勉強家だ
He is a rare worker among students nowadays.
明治天皇は世の帝王には珍しい名君であらせられた
Meiji Tennno was a rare instance of wisdom among the crowned heads of the world.
お珍しいものをありがとう存じます
Thank you for your nice present!
何か珍しい事がありませんか
Is there any news?
これは珍しいお客様だ
This is a rare visitor―an unexpected visitor.
(珍客に向かって)これはお珍しい
You are quite a stranger.
(途上で)これはお珍しい、田中さん
I am glad to have met you―Well met, Mr. Tanaka!
ご両親はお久しぶりでさぞお珍しいことでしょう
Your parents must be delighted to see you after such a long separation.
日本軍の勝利は珍しくなくなった
Japanese victories have ceased to be novel.
事が珍しくなくなった
The thing has ceased to be novel―lost its novelty―The novelty has worn off.
彼の病気は珍しくない
His illness is no news.
その頃は人殺しなどは珍しくなかった(日々の出来事だった)
Murders were the order of the day in those days.
近頃珍しい壮観であった
It was such a sight as had not been for many a year―It was the finest sight Tokyo had seen for many years.
近頃珍しい大喝采を博した
He won such an applause as had not been heard for many a day―such an applause as we had not heard for days.
近年珍しい大雪であった
It was such a snowfall as had not been seen for many a year―Such a snowfall had not been for years.
近年珍しい大地震であった
It was such an earthquake as had not been felt for many a year―the severest earthquake that had been experienced for years.
即位式は近年珍しく森巌な儀式であった
The enthronement was such a solemn ceremony as had not been seen for many a year―the most solemn ceremony that had been seen for years.

content:
めずらしがる〔珍しがる〕
〈他動〉To regard (anything) with curiosity; to regard (anything) as a curiosity; to make much of (a person or thing); to make a lion of, make a hero of (a person)

content.content: その頃は外人は珍しがられた
Foreigners were regarded as curiosities in those days.
その頃は人が唐物を珍しがった
People made much of foreign goods in those days.
彼はロンドンへ行ってたいそう珍しがられた
He was made a lion of―lionized―in London.
黒木大将は米国へ行って非常に珍しがられた
Gen. Kuroki was made a hero of in America.

content:
めずらしく〔珍しく〕
〈副〉Uncommonly; unusually; exceptionally

content.content: 新聞は珍しく沈黙を守っている
The papers preserve an unusual silence.
珍しく好い天気だ
It is exceptionally fine weather.
今日は仕事が珍しく早く片づいた
I have finished my day's work uncommonly early today.
今日は君は珍しく早起きだね
You are up uncommonly early today.
彼は珍しく外出した
His going out today is quite an event.
今日は珍しく夫婦揃って出かけた
Strange to say, the couple have gone out together today.

content:
めそめそ
〈副〉

content.content: めそめそ泣く
to sob―snivel―blubber
女は人がなにか言うとめそめそ泣き出す
If you speak to her, she will fall to crying.

〈名〉A kind of bamboo

content:
めだつ〔目立つ〕
〈自動〉To stand out; to strike the eye; to contrast well with (the others); to form a striking contrast to the others:(形容詞に訳せば)striking; conspicuous

content.content: あの女の器量は目立つ
Her beauty is conspicuous.
支度が目立つ
She is conspicuously dressed.
今政界に目立つ人物は無い
No one now cuts a conspicuous figure in the political world.
彼は幕末史に目立った人物の一人だ
He is one of the names that stand out in the history of the last days of the Shogunate.
あの建物は目立つ
That building strikes the eye.
この本の表装は目立つ
The book is strikingly got up.
まわりが日本造りだと西洋館は目立つ
A foreign house contrasts finely with Japanese houses.
彼の如き天才は他が凡庸だとひときわ目立つ
Such a genius forms a striking contrast to mediocrity.
この色はひときわ目立つ
This colour stands out conspicuously.
目立つ色
a conspicuous colour―a striking colour
僕は目立たない色(渋い色)が好きだ
I like a quiet colour―a neutral tint.
目立たない家だ
It is a modest house.
彼の赤いネキタイは目立つ
He wears a staring red necktie.
彼が英語を話すと間違いが目立つ
He makes glaring mistakes in speaking English.

content.content: めたて〔目立て〕

content.content: 目玉をぎょろぎょろさせる
to roll one's eyes―goggle one's eyes
お目玉を頂戴する
to get a scolding―get it
お目玉を喰うぞ
You will catch it.

content:

〈副〉→『

content.content: めちゃめちゃ〔滅茶滅茶〕

content:
めちゃめちゃ〔滅茶滅茶〕
〈副〉(To be) in a state of complete destruction

content.content: めちゃめちゃになる
to go to wreck―go to rack and ruin―go to smash―go to pieces―go to shivers―go to pot―go to pie―go to the dogs
めちゃめちゃにする
to ruin―spoil―smash―shatter―tear to pieces―pull to pieces―pick to pieces―tear to tatters―wear to rags―play havoc with anything
身代がめちゃめちゃになった
The fortune has gone to wreck.
家の中はめちゃめちゃだ
The house is going to the dogs.
会社はめちゃめちゃになってしまった
The company has gone to pieces.
事業がめちゃめちゃになってしまった
The undertaking has gone all to smash.
家がめちゃめちゃにこわれている
The house has gone to rack and ruin.
嵐で花がめちゃめちゃだ
The storm has played havoc with the flowers.
雨が降って運動会がめちゃめちゃになった
The rain has spoiled the field-day.
戦争のために僕の見込みがめちゃめちゃになった
The war has ruined my prospects.
艦隊がめちゃめちゃにやられた
The fleet was shattered.
新説はめちゃめちゃに駁された
The new doctrine has been torn to pieces―pulled to pieces.
本がめちゃめちゃに破れている
The book is torn to tatters―worn to rags.
放蕩息子が身代をめちゃめちゃにしてしまった
The prodigal son has squandered his fortune―made ducks and drakes of his fortune.
めちゃめちゃに負かしてやった
We beat them all to sticks―(は英国、米国は)―beat them all hollow.
めちゃめちゃに殴る
to pommel a man―beat a man to a jelly
園遊会で庭がめちゃめちゃに荒らされた
The garden-party has trodden the garden into a mire.

content.content: 金メッキ
gilt
金メッキの時計
a gold-plated watch
銀メッキ
silvered ware―silver-plated ware
メッキははげる
Gilt will come off Plated work will not stand wear and tear.
メッキがはげた
The gilt is off.
人中で揉まれるとメッキがはげる
Wear and tear will take the shine out of one.

gilt

content:

〈名〉The expression of one's eyes; a look

content.content: 彼女は目つきが可愛らしい
She has lovely eyes―pretty eyes―charming eyes.
優しい目つきをしてそう言った
She said so with a tender look.

He will leer at a woman.

腕がめっきり上がった

めつけ〔目付け〕

2. (=死ぬ)to die; to perish

content.content: 生ある者は必ず滅す

content.content: めっそうなことをおっしゃる
How you talk!―Far from it!―Not a bit of it!―God forbid!
めっそうもない(そんなことがあるものか)
Absurd!―Preposterous!
めっそうもない(どう致しまして)
Not at all!―Don't mention it!

to say heedless things―speak carelessly―talk thoughtlessly
めったなことを言うな
Be careful of what you say!
めったなことを言って言質を取られるな
Do not commit yourself!
あの人はじきに怒るからめったなことは言われぬ
You must be careful in speaking to him, for he is quick to take offence.

めったにない〔滅多に無い〕

1. Seldom; rarely; scarcely ever; hardly ever:(形容詞に訳せば)rare; few; scarcely any; hardly any; not every

content.content: そんな人はめったに無い
There are few such men―scarcely any such men.
そんなことはめったに無い
Such a thing seldom happens―rarely happens―hardly ever happens.
彼が本を開くことはめったに無い
He seldom opens a book―rarely opens a book―scarcely ever opens a book.
あのような学者はめったに無い
There are few such scholars―Such scholars are rare―Such scholars are rarely to be met with.
こんな機会はめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
真の詩人はめったに無い
True poets are rare―Not every man is a poet.
こんな果報はめったに無い
Such angel-visits are of rare occurrence―few and far between.
彼はめったに出かけない
He seldom goes out.

content: 2. (=決して)never

content.content: この手はめったに放されません
I will never let go my hold.

めったむしょうに〔滅多無性に〕

He ran like anything―ran like mad.
めったむしょうに殴り散らした
He laid about him.
めったむしょうに斬りまくった

content.content: 兵は暗闇でめったやたらに発砲した

めったやたらに本を呼んだ
I read whatever I could lay my hands on.
めったやたらに人を殴る
to pommel a man
あの犬はめったやたらにかみつく

content.content: 目つぶしを掛ける

content.content: 値段はめっぽうだ
The price is exorbitant.
今日はめっぽう暑い、めっぽう寒い
It is awfully hot―awfully cold―today.
この料理はめっぽううまい
The dish is awfully good.
めっぽう好い酒だ
The wine is stunning―ripping―rattling―spanking―thundering good.
めっぽう好い品だ
It is a stunner―a ripper―a rattler―a spanker―a scorcher―a screamer―a smasher.

content.content: 平家の滅亡

めでたい〔目出度い〕
〈形〉
1. (=縁起の好い、悦ばしい)auspicious (occasion); lucky (omen); happy, felicitous (event); joyful, joyous (day); favourable, propitious (sign); festive (occasion)

content.content: めでたいこと
an auspicious event―a happy event―a joyful event

a joyful day―a happy occasion―an auspicious occasion―a festive occasion―a red-letter day
このめでたい日に縁起でもないことを言うな

連隊はめでたく凱旋した

悪人亡びて善人栄ゆ、めでたしめでたし

(小説の終りに)めでたしめでたし

悪人亡び善人栄ゆ、めでたしめでたし

content.content: 目端が利く、めはしが利かぬ
He has tact―He has no tact.

〈名〉The features (of the face)

to assume a definite form―become definite―take shape―touch ground―materialize

Keep silent till the plan takes shape.
話に目鼻がついてからお話ししようと思っていました

先方の相談にまだ目鼻がつかない

どうかこのことに目鼻をつけなければならない
We must get the matter into shape―settle the matter―somehow.

〈名〉A female flower; a pistillate flower

めはなだち〔目鼻立ち〕

She has regular features―a regular set of features.

I estimated the distance by the eye―measured the distance with my eye.

〈名〉Loss in weight:(=する) to lose in weight

to fix one's choice upon a man―fix upon a man (as one's successor)―spot a man (as the culprit)―mark a man (for promotion)

I have fixed my choice upon a likely man.

The news gave me a turn.

content:

〈名〉American flour

めりけんこ〔米利堅粉<メリケン粉>〕
〈名〉American flour

The wall has caved in.

content:

〈名〉Hosiery; stockinet; knitted goods

content.content: メリヤスの肌着
a knitted underwear―an undervest
メリヤスのズボン下
knitted drawers.

a knitting-machine

a hosier

content:

〈名〉Cotton

content.content: この毛織には綿が入っている
This woolen has a mixture of cotton.

content:
めん〔面〕
〈名〉
1. (=顔)the face

content.content: 面と向かって言う
to say anything to one's face
彼は面と向かって悪口を言う
He will abuse you to your face.

You will as soon find two of a face as two of a mind.

content: 2. (=仮面)a mask

content.content: 面をかぶる
to put on a mask―put a mask over one's face―mask oneself―(平生)―wear a mask
ガラスの面をかぶって危険な実験をした
He made dangerous experiments with a glass mask over his face.
道徳家の面をかぶる
to assume a virtuous air―affect virtue

to conquer a country under the mask of religion
面をかぶったように白粉を塗り立てている
She wears a mask of paint.

to take off one's mask―(正体を顕すの意味なら)―throw off the mask

content: 3. (=撃剣の面)a face-guard

content.content: お面に一本参る
to deal one a blow on the head

content: 4. (=表面)the surface; the face

content.content: 地球の面
the surface of the earth

content.content: 斜面

content: 6. (=立体面)a side

content.content: 側面

content: 2. (=懲役の放免)discharge from penal servitude; release from prison:(=する) to discharge (a convict) from penal servitude; to release (a convict) from prison

content.content: 免役になる

主人は只今ご面会致します

あの人は誰が行っても面会してくれる

誰が行っても面会しない

彼は医者のほかは面会を謝絶している

(下男に向かって)今日は誰が来ても面会謝絶だよ

彼に面会を謝絶された

content.content: 免官になる

依願免官

諭旨免官になった

諭旨免官

めんくらう〔面喰う〕
〈自動〉To lose one's presence of mind; to lose one's head; to be flurried; to be flustered; to be bewildered; to be dazed

content.content: あまり突然で面喰らった
It was so sudden that I lost my head.
急に明るい処へ出て面喰らった
The sudden blaze bewildered me.
大勢の前へ出て面喰らった
The blaze of a hundred eyes dazed me.
面喰らって駈け出した
I took to my heels in a flurry.
面喰らうな
Keep your head!―Be cool!―Be steady!

彼とはほんの一面識だ

彼とは一面識も無い
He is a complete stranger to me―He is a perfect stranger to me―We are utter strangers.

content:
めんじて〔免じて〕
〈前置詞相当〉Foe the sake of (some one); for the love of (one's) children; in consideration of (one's youth); out of regard for (one's feelings); out of respect for (age); in deference to (one's position, etc.)

content.content: 僕に免じて彼を助けてやってくれ給え
Spare him for my sake!
彼の親父に免じて世話をしてやった
I helped him for the sake of his father.
君の子どもに免じて(子どもが可愛いなら)あの子を世話をしておやり
You might help the boy for the love of your children.
君に免じて止めよう
I will desist from the attempt out of regard for your feelings.
彼の年に免じて乞いを容れよう
I will comply with his request out of respect for his age.
年の若さに免じて無罪にされた
He was pardoned in consideration of his youth.
彼の地位に免じて大目に見ておこう
I will overlook his fault in deference to his position.

めんじゅうこうご〔面従後語〕
〈名〉Eye-service

めんじゅうする〔面従する〕
〈自動〉To obey in one's fight; to feign obedience

content:
めんじょ〔免除〕
〈名〉Exemption (from military service); excuse (from a task); freedom (from obligation); absolution (from a vow); release (from a promise); remission (of a fee):(=する)to exempt (one from military service); to excuse (one from a task); to free (one from obligations); to absolve (one from a vow); to release(one from a promise); to remit (one the fee)

content.content: 兵役免除になる
to be exempted from military service
身体不合格のために兵役免除になった
He was exempted from military service owing to physical disqualification―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Physical disqualification exempted him from military service.
租税を免除する
to exempt one from taxation―remit one the taxes
義務を免除する
to free one from obligations―release one from obligations―discharge one from obligations―dispense one from obligations
誓いを免除された
I am absolved from my vow.
約束を守る義務を免除された
I am released from my promise.
今日の勤めを免除する(今日は休ましてやる)

授業料を免除する
to remit one the school fee
本月入学する者に限り入学金を免除す
Those who apply for entrance this month are admitted free of entrance-fee.
本校生徒に限り傍聴料を免除す

中学卒業生は入学試験を免除す

期満免除

めんじょう〔免状〕

content.content: 免状を取る
to take a licence―obtain a certificate
彼は免状を取って医者を開業した
He took a licence and set as a physician.
この業に従事する者は特別の免状を取らねばならぬ
Those who engage in this occupation must have a special permit.
免状を下付する
to grant one a licence
免状下付を出願する
to apply for a licence
免状を持っている
I hold a licence.
免状所有者
a licence-holder
免状無くして医業を営む

免状行使を停止する
to suspend a licence
三カ月間免状行使を停止された
I had my licence suspended for three months.
免状を取り上げる
to revoke a licence
開業免状
a practitioner's licence
教員免状
a teacher's certificate
銃猟免状
a shooting licence
自動車運転手免状
a chauffeur's licence
旅行免状

本免状

仮免状

content:
めんしょく〔免職〕
〈名〉Dismissal from office; removal from office; cong?:(俗語)mittimus:(=する) to dismiss (one) from office; to remove (one) from office; to relieve (one) of one's office; to relieve (one) of one's post; to release (one) from one's office; to give (one) one's cong?; to discharge (an employ?); to cashier (an official); to break (an officer)

content.content: 免職になる

to be dismissed from office―be removed from office―be relieved of one's office―be relieved of one's post―be released from one's office―be cashiered―be discharged―receive one's cong?―get one's leave―get one's mittimus―get the bag―get the sack―lose one's place
彼は職務怠慢のため免職になった
He lost his place for neglect of duty―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Negligence lost him his place―Negligence cost him his place.
彼は免職になったらすぐから食うに困るだろう
If he loses his place,he will have nothing to live on.
そんなことをしたら免職になる
I shall lose my place if I do such a thing―It will cost me my place to do such a thing―It is as much as my place is worth to do such a thing.
彼の地位はいつ免職になるかも知れぬ危ない地位だ
He holds a precarious position.

content:
めんする〔面する〕

content.content: その家は海に面している

旅館は港に面している
The hotel faces the harbour―fronts on the harbour.
店は通りに面している
The shop faces the street―looks out on the street.
日本は四方海に面している
Japan faces the sea on every side.
僕の書斎は庭に面している

content:
めんずる〔免ずる〕

1. (=免除する)to exempt (one from military service); to excuse (one from a task); to free (one from obligations); to absolve (one from a vow); to release (one from a promise); to remit (one the fee, etc.)

to free one from obligations―release one from obligations―discharge one from obligations―dispense one from obligations
税を免ずる

本月入学する者に限る入学金を免ず
Those who apply for entrance this month are admitted free of entrance-fee.

content: 2. (=免職する)to dismiss (one) from office; remove (one) from office; to relieve (one) of one's office (or post); to release (one) from one's office

content.content: 職を免ぜらる
to be dismissed from office―removed from office―relieved of one's office―relieved of one's post―released from one's office
願に依り本官を免ず

めんじて〔免じて〕

content:
めんぜい〔免税〕

content.content: 免税品、免税輸入品
duty-free goods―free goods

content:
めんせき〔面積〕

content.content: 公園は約十町歩の面積を有す

content:

content:
めんせつ〔面接〕

content.content: 米国の大統領は誰でも面接することができる
