content:
めんぜんで〔面前で〕
〈副〉In one's presence; in one's sight; in one's hearing; under one's eyes; (to praise or blame one) to one's face; (to laugh) in one's face

content.content: 彼は僕の面前で細君を打った
He struck his wife in my presence―in my sight.
彼は僕の面前でそう言った
He said so in my hearing―He said so to my face.
彼は人の面前を憚らず傍若無人の振舞をする
He makes himself at home in the presence of company―in the face of the world.
僕の面前で品物を改めさせた
I had the goods examined under my eyes.
面前で人を賞める者に限って蔭で悪口を言う
A man who praises you to your face, is sure to speak ill of you behind your back.
彼は僕の面前で僕の悪口を言った
He abused me to my face.

content:
めんそ〔免租〕
〈名〉Remission of taxes; exemption from taxation:(=する) to remit (one) taxes; to exempt (land) from taxation

content.content: 免租地
land exempted from taxation―land free of taxes

content:
めんそ〔免訴〕
〈名〉Dismissal (of a case); acquittal; discharge, release (of a prisoner):(=する) to dismiss (a case); to acquit, discharge, release (a prisoner)

content.content: 事件が免訴になる
A case is dismissed.
被告は証拠不充分のため免訴になった
The prisoner was acquitted―discharged―released―for want of sufficient evidence.

content:
めんそう〔面相〕
〈名〉Physiognomy; features; looks

content.content: 面相の悪い男だ
He is an ill-looking man.
女は好い面相だ
She is good-looking.
ひどい面相だ
She is a fright―a perfect fright.
あのご面相で芸者をするとは
That such a fright should court public favour!
鬼のような面相をしている
He is hard-favoured―hard-featured―hard-visaged.
彼は面相を変えて怒った
He was white with anger.

content:
めんだん〔面談〕
〈名〉A personal interview:(=する) to have a personal interview with (one); to speak to (one)

content.content: 社長に面談したい
I want to speak to the president.
社長と直接面談をした
I have had a personal interview with the president of the company.
委細面談(広告文)
Particulars on personal application.

めんちぢみ〔綿縮み〕
〈名〉Cotton crape; crinkled cloth

めんちゅつ〔免黜〕
〈名〉Dismissal from office; removal from office:(=する) to dismiss (one) from office; to remove (one) from one's office; to cashier (an official); to break (an officer)

めんちょう〔面疔〕
〈名〉A carbuncle on the face

めんつう〔面桶〕
〈名〉A chip luncheon-case (used by beggars)

content:
めんてい〔面体〕
〈名〉A face; a countenance; looks

content.content: 面体あやしき奴だ
He is a suspicious-looking fellow.
面体をおおう、面体を隠す
to cover one's face―hide one's face
武士の面体に傷をつけおったな
You have wounded a samurai in the face.

content:
めんどう〔面倒〕
〈名〉
1. Trouble; difficult; complication:(=な) troublesome (affair); difficult (task); complicated (problem); awkward (state of affairs, etc.)

content.content: ご面倒をかけてすみません
I am sorry to trouble you―give you trouble―cause you trouble―occasion you trouble―put you to trouble.
なるべくご面倒をかけません
I will give you as little trouble as I can―give you no more trouble that I can help.
そうすれば面倒が省けます
That will save me trouble.
漢字は学ぶに面倒だ
Chinese characters are troublesome to learn.
ご面倒をかけてはすまないから自分で致しました
I did it myself to spare you trouble.
一々払うのは面倒だから月末にいっしょに取りに来い
It is troublesome to pay every time. Bring me a bill at the end of the month.
これは面倒な仕事だ
This is a troublesome task―a difficult task.
面倒な問題だ
It is a complicated problem.
面倒なことができた
Here is an awkward state of things―a pretty kettle of fish―a pretty go.
事を面倒にする
to complicate matters
僕がいると事が面倒になるからその場をはずした
As my presence would only complicate matters, I managed to keep out of the way.
面倒を生ずる
to give rise to complications
君が干渉すると事がますます面倒になるのみだ
Your interference will only give rise to complications.
ご面倒ながらそう願われましょうか
May I ask you to do so, if it is not (gibing you) too much trouble?
少しも面倒じゃありません(おやすい御用です)
It is no trouble at all.
ご面倒ながらここの意味を説明して下さいませんか
May I trouble you to explain the meaning of the passage?
ご面倒ながら質問を聴いて下さいませんか
May I trouble you with a question?
ご面倒ながら金を少々貸して下さいませんか
May I trouble you for some money?
面倒を見る
to be kind to one―look after one―take care of one
あの方が子どもの面倒を見て下さいます
He looks after the children―takes care of the children.
嫁は年が行かないから面倒を見ておやり
She is young and needs looking after.

content:
めんどうくさい〔面倒臭い〕
〈形〉Troublesome; tedious; tiresome; irksome

content.content: 家事は面倒臭い
Household matters are troublesome.
彼は家事を面倒臭がる
He finds household matters troublesome.
面倒臭がって家事にかまわない
He does not trouble himself about―trouble his head about―household matters.
あの人の話を聴いていると面倒臭い
It is tiresome―tedious―to listen to him.
同じ事を幾度も幾度も繰り返すのは面倒臭い
It is irksome to do the same thing over and over again.
役人は面倒臭いことばかり言う
Officials are always making difficulties.

content:
めんどり〔牝鶏〕
〈名〉A hen

content.content: 牝鶏が卵を生む
A hen lays eggs.
牝鶏が巣につく
A hen broods―A hen sits.
巣につく牝鶏
a brooding hen
牝鶏勧めて雄鶏時をつくる
The hen sets the cock crowing.
牝鶏時をつくれば家亡ぶ
When the hen crows, the house goes to ruin.

めんねる〔綿ネル〕
〈名〉Cotton flannel; flannelette

content:
めんぴ〔面皮〕
〈名〉Countenance

content.content: 面皮をむく
to put one out of countenance―put one to shame―humiliate one
面皮をかく
to be put out of countenance―be put to shame―be humiliated

めんびろーど〔綿天鵞絨<綿ビロード>〕
〈名〉Cotton velvet; velveteen

めんびろーど〔綿天鵞絨<綿ビロード>〕
〈名〉Cotton velvet; velveteen

content:
めんぶ〔面部〕
〈名〉The face

content.content: 面部をおおう
to cover one's face

めんふらん〔綿フラン〕
〈名〉Cotton-flannel; flannelette

めんぺき〔面壁〕
〈名〉Sitting in meditation with one's face to the wall

content:
めんぼく〔面目〕
〈名〉
1. (=顔、名誉)countenance; face; honour; credit; reputation

content.content: 面目を保たしむ(恥をかかせぬ)
to keep one in countenance
君がそう言ってくれれば僕の面目が立つ
You will keep me in countenance.
面目を失わしむ(恥をかかせる)
to put one out of countenance
君がそう言うと僕は面目を失う
You will put me out of countenance.
有難き御錠を蒙り拙者の面目之に過ぐるは無し
I am deeply honoured by your gracious commands.
あのような人は国家の面目だ
Such a man is an honour to his country.
あのような生徒は学校の面目だ
Such a student is a credit to his school.
あのような息子を持つのは親の面目だ
Such a son is a credit to his father.
面目を施す
to do one honour―do one credit―reflect credit on one
彼は手柄をして大いに面目を施した
His deed does him great honour―does him great credit.
子の出世は親に面目を施す
The son's advancement reflects credit on the father.
面目を維持する(顔を立てる)
to save one's honour―save one's face
この社説は新聞社の面目を維持するために書かれたものらしい
The leader seems to have been written to save the honour of the office.
面目を失する
to disgrace oneself
そのようなことをしては僕は面目を失する
Such conduct would disgrace me.
そのようなことをしては武士の面目に関する
It would concern a samurai's honour to do such a thing.
それでは僕の面目がつぶれてしまう
Then my honour will be gone―my reputation will be blasted.
面目無い、面目次第も有りません
I am ashamed of myself.
面目無くて合わす顔が無い
I am ashamed to show my face.
何の面目有って家に帰られようか
How can I have the face to go home?
面目を改める、面目を一新する
to undergo a transformation
鉄道が通じてから市は面目を一新した
Since the railway communication was opened, the city has under gone a complete transformation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The railway has transformed the city.
学校は面目を一新した
It is quite a new school―quite another school.
面目を一新せしむ
to find it brick and leave it marble
彼が校長になって学校は面目を一新した
He found the school brick and left it marble.

content: 3. (=様子、人格)appearance; character

content.content: その面目文中に躍如たり
His character is vividly drawn.

content:
めんぼくない〔面目無い〕
〈叙述形容詞〉To be ashamed; to be abashed

content.content: どうも面目無い
I am ashamed of myself.
面目無くて合わす顔が無い
I am ashamed to show my face.
彼は面目無げな様子をしている
He looks abashed.

content:
めんみつ〔綿密〕
〈形〉Minute (observation); nice (observer); close (examination); thorough (care); scrupulous(attention); elaborate(workmanship)

content.content: 綿密な観察
minute observation―nice observation―close observation
綿密な注意
close attention―thorough care―scrupulous care
綿密な計算
minute calculation
綿密な検査
a close examination
綿密な調査
a thorough investigation
綿密に調査する
to investigate a matter thoroughly―probe a matter to the bottom
綿密な細工
minute workmanship―elaborate workmanship
彼は頭が綿密だ
He has a closely-thinking head.
彼は綿密な人だ
He is a closely-thinking man―a nicely-observing man―a scrupulous man.
綿密過ぎる
to be overminute―minute to excess―to split hairs
この本は綿密過ぎるのきらいがある
The book has the fault of over-minuteness.

content:
めんめん〔面々〕
〈名〉Every member; every one; all

content.content: 列座の面々は皆発議に賛成した
Everybody present seconded the proposition.
有志の面々ご参会あれ
All who are interested in the matter are welcome to the meeting.
面々の好き好き
“Every man to his taste.”
面々の蠅を掃え
“Let each man sweep before his own door.”
面々の楊貴妃なれや家桜
Let every man think his geese are swans.

content:
めんもく〔面目〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: めんぼく〔面目〕

content:
めんよう〔面妖〕
〈形〉Strange (occurrence); wonderful (event); mysterious (fate); unearthly (sound); weird (tale); uncanny (voice in the air, etc.)

content.content: はて面妖な
Oh, wonder of wonders!

めんるい〔麺類〕
〈名〉Kinds of macaroni and vermicelli

content:
も
〈副〉
1. (=もまた)too:(打消に伴えば)(not...) either:(略して言えば)so (am I):(打消を略せば)nor(am I); neither (am I)

content.content: 僕もそう思う
I think so, too―I think so myself.
僕も知らない
I do not know, either.
君はそう思うか、僕もそう思う
Do you think so? So do I.
君は嬉しいか、僕も
Are you glad? So am I.
君は風邪をひいたか、僕も
Have you taken cold? So have I.
君は知らんか、僕も
Don't you know? Nor do I―Neither do I―Nor I either.
君は行かないか、僕も
Are you not going? Nor am I―Neither am I―Nor I either.
君はまだ見ないか、僕も
Have you not seen it? Nor have I―Neither have I―Nor I either.
馬は好い運動だ、僕も若い時はやったものだ
Riding is a good exercise. I used to ride, too, when I was young.
君の兄さんは洋行したのか、僕の兄も
Has your brother been abroad? So has my brother.
君の兄さんは細君が無いのか、僕の兄も
Is your brother not married? Nor is my brother―Neither is mine.
君が行くなら僕も行こうか
If you will go, so will I.
君が行かないなら行くまい
If you will not go, nor will I―neither will I.
俺がばかなら貴様もばかだ
If I am a fool, you are another.
一同よりも御喜び可申上様申出候
My family unite with me in congratulating you on your success.

content: 2. (=をもまた)also; as well:(打消に伴えば)(not...) either

content.content: 彼は英語ができる、ドイツ語もできる
He knows English; he knows German also―he knows German as well.
彼は英語を知らぬ、ドイツ語も知らない
He does not know English; he does not know German, either.

content: 3. (=程も)as much as; as many as; no less than; no fewer than; to the amount of; to the number of; to the extent of; to the tune of; to a length of ; to a height of; to a depth of

content.content: 彼は一万円も借金がある
He owes as much as 10,000 yen―no less than 10,000 yen―He is in debt to the amount of 10,000 yen―to the extent of 10,000 yen―to the tune of 10,000 yen.
彼は十人も兄弟がある
He has as many as ten brothers―no fewer than ten brothers―no less than ten brothers.
一万人も集まった
There came together as many as 10,000 people―People gathered to the number of 10,000.
この線は一千マイルにも達する
The line extends to a length of 1,000 miles.
この木は三百尺にも達する
The tree grows to a height of 300 feet.
あそこは雪が六尺も降る
Snow falls there to a depth of six feet.［注意］形容詞をもってこの意味を表わすことあり。
彼はこの本を書くのに七年もかかった
It took him seven long years to write the book.
三時間も待たされた
I was kept waiting for three mortal hours.
僕はこの本を三度も読んだ
I read this book three several times.

content: 4. (=さえも)even; the very; oneself:(打消に伴えば)(not) so much as

content.content: 鬼神も為に泣く
Even the gods―The very gods―The gods themselves―Even the very gods themselves―cry over it.
本を明けてもみない
I have not so much as opened the book.
彼はさようならもせずに帰って行った
He went away without so much as saying good-by.

content: 5. (=しかも)and that; and... too; and... at that; and... into the bargain

content.content: 彼は地所をもっている、それも東京だ
He owns plots, and that in Tokyo.
今日は日曜だ、そして天気も好い
It is Sunday today, and it is fine weather too―and it is fine weather at that.
彼は不幸に逢って、そして 病気もした
He has met with a misfortune, and been ill into the bargain.

content: 6. (=一つも、一人も)not one; not a; not a single

content.content: 一人も助からぬ
Not a single man was saved.
あの人々のうち一人も知らない
I do not know one of those men.
ここには友人は一人も無い
I have not a friend here.
彼は酒は一滴も飲まない
He does not drink a drop of wine.
昨夜は一睡もしない
I did not get a wink of sleep last night.
一言半句も言うな
Do not breathe a syllable of it to any one!
人っ子一人も通らぬ
Not a soul is to be seen in the streets.
彼らは一人も残らず死んだ
They were killed to a man.
一文も残らず金を返す
I will pay to the last cent.
一銭も引け無し
I can not take a cent less.

content: 7. (=多くも、少なくも)at most; at least

content.content: 多く見ても彼は百万はあるまい
He can not be worth a million at most.
いくら少なく見ても百万はあるだろう
He must be worth a million at least―at the very least.
ごく好く見ても二流の役者だ
He is, at best, but a second-rate actor.
遅くても今月末には帰る
I shall be back by the end of the month at the latest―at the furthest.

content:
〈接続詞〉
1. (=たとい何々しても)even if; if; though; whoever; whatever; whichever; whenever; wherever; however:(前置詞に訳せば)notwithstanding; is spite of; for all; with all

content.content: 雨が降っても行く
I will go even if it should rain.
たといできてもそんなことはせぬ
I would not do so if I could.
たといしようと思ってもそんなことはできぬ
I could not do so if I would.
誰がそう言っても間違っている
Whoever may say so,―Say so who will,―it is false.
どこへ行っても辛抱が無くては出世ができぬ
Wherever you may go,―Go where you will,―you can not get on without perseverance.
彼はいくら働いても相変わらず貧乏だ
He remains poor in spite of his labours.
あれほど金があっても満足せぬ
For all his wealth, he is not contented.
あれほど欠点があっても彼は偉い
With all his faults, he is a great man.
誰がなんと言っても僕は曲ったことはせぬ
No one can make me do wrong.

content: 2. (=かれもこれも)both... and...; and; not only, but also; as well as; no less than:(打消に伴えば)neither... nor...

content.content: 彼は英語もドイツ語もできる
He knows both English and German.
英語もドイツ語も知らぬ
He knows neither English nor German.
彼は知識も経験もある
He has both knowledge and experience―He has not only knowledge, but also experience―He has experience as well as knowledge―He has experience no less than knowledge.
彼は夜も昼も働く
He works night and day.
父も母も承知
Father and mother have consented.
男も女も老人も子どももいる
There are men and women, young and old.
黒いのもある白いのもある
Some are black, and some are white.
今も昔も変わらぬ
It is the same now as formerly.
嬉しくもあり悲しくもある
I have a mingled feeling of joy and sorrow.

content: 3. (=どうしてもこうしても)whether... or...; either... or...

content.content: 欲しくても欲しくなくても買わにゃあならぬ
You must buy it whether you may want it or not.
買っても買わなくてもよろしい
You may either buy it or not buy it.
照っても降っても彼は必ず来る
He makes a point of coming in sunshine or in rain―Rain or shine, he is sure to come.

content: 4. (=又何々もせぬ)nor (do I...); neither(do I...)

content.content: 僕は金は無い、又金持ちになりたくもない
I am not rich, and I do not wish to be―nor do I wish to be.
僕は洋行したことが無い、またしようとも思わぬ
I have never been abroad, nor do I intend to go abroad.

content: 〈その他〉

content.content: 百円もあれば好い
A hundred yen will do.
僕も閉口した
I am nonplussed.
彼に持たせると鈍刀も正宗
A dull blade becomes a Masamune in his hands.
今日の仕事もすんだ
I have finished my day's work―(は英、米は)―I am through for today.
まず試験も済んだ
The examination is over.
師匠もはだしだ
He is outdone his master.
人の来そうな気配も無い
There is no sign of any one coming.
その値段の倍でも安い
It is cheap at twice the price.
その半分でも高い
It is dear at half the price.
願っても無いことだ
It is a boon.
ひと月も経たぬに
before a month had passed
二人は結婚してひと月も経たぬに夫婦げんかを始めた
They had not been married a month before they began quarrelling.

content:
も〔喪〕
〈名〉Mourning

content.content: 喪中
to be in mourning
彼は親の喪で引きこもっている
He keeps his house in mourning for his father.
誰の喪に服す
to go into mourning for some one
彼女は夫の喪に服している
She has gone into mourning for her husband―She is in mourning for her husband.
喪が明ける
The period of mourning expires―One goes out of mourning.
喪が明けた
My mourning is over―I am out of mourning.

content:
も〔藻〕
〈名〉Seaweeds

content.content: ここは足に藻がからまるから泳ぐのは危険だ
It is dangerous swimming here, for your legs get entangled among the seaweeds.

content:
もあい〔催合〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: もやい〔催合〕

content:
もう
〈副〉
1. (=既に)already; yet(?); by this (time)

content.content: もう鐘が鳴った
The bell has rung already.
もう鐘が鳴ったか
Has the bell rung yet?
もう鐘が鳴ったのか
Has the bell rung already?
今頃はもう京都に着いたころだ
He must have reached Kyoto by this.
もう支度ができた
I am already dressed―I am ready.

content: 2. (=もはや)now:(打消に伴えば)(not) any longer (no longer)

content.content: もう夏だ
It is summer now.
もうすんだ
It is over now.
もう間に合わない
It is too late now.
彼はもう来るころだ
He ought to be here now―It is time he should be here.
もう学校へ行かない
I do not go to school any longer―I go to school no longer.
その学校はもう無い
The school exists no longer.
もうこれからは行くまい
I will no go there any more―I will go there no more.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 病人はもう助からぬ
The invalid is past cure―past help of man.
もう駄目だ
It is all over with him―It is all up with him.
彼女はもう子を産む年じゃない
She is past the age of bearing.
彼女はもうそろそろ解る年頃だ
She is old enough to understand such things―She is of an age to understand such things.

content: 3. (=程無く)soon; before long

content.content: もう来るでしょう
He will soon be here.
もう試験が始まる
The examination will begin before long―It will not long before the examination begins.
もう花が咲く
The blossoms will soon be out.

content: 4. (=この上)more

content.content: もう無い
There is no more.
金はもう無い
I have no more money.
もう一つ
one more―another
もう一つの方
the other
もう一つお尋ねしたいことがある
I have one more question―another question―to ask you.
もう一つで十になる
One more will make ten.
もう一人来る
One more is coming.
もう三人来る
Three more are coming.
もえ一時間経てば月が出る
The moon will be up in another hour.
もう入れませんか
It there room for no more?
もう一人入れます
There is room for one more.
もう一人のお方はどうなさいました
What has become of the other gentleman?
もう一息というところで負けた
Another effort, and we should have own the day.
もうひと目見て死にたい
O for another glimpse of her before I die!
ここには もう一つ解釈がある
There is another interpretation of the passage.
もう少し
a little more
もう少し下さい
Give me some more.
もう少しも無い
There is not any more―no more.
もう一度
once more―again
もう一度やってみよう
I will try again.
金はもうそれだけある
There is as much more money.
金はもうその倍だけある
There is twice as much more money.
雨はもうたくさんだ
We want no more rain―We have had enough of rain.
もうたくさん
No more, thank you!
これでもう当分君には会えぬ
I shall see no more of you for the present.

content:
5. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 彼はもう居ない
He is gone.
東京へ来てもう三年になる
It is three years since I came to Tokyo.
彼はもうひとかどの職人だ
He is an able workman.

content:
もう〔毛〕
〈名〉
1. Hair

content.content: 九牛の一毛
It is a drop in the ocean.

content: 2. ［銭の単位］One tenth of a rin

もう〔盲〕
〈名〉Blindness:(形容詞に用いれば)blind

content:
もう〔蒙〕
〈名〉Ignorance

content.content: 蒙を啓く
to enlighten one's mind

content:
もうあ〔盲唖〕
〈名〉Blind and dumb

content.content: 盲唖学校
a blind and dumb school
盲唖教育
education of the blind and dumb

もうあく〔猛悪〕
〈形〉Cruel; brutal; ferocious

content:
もうい〔猛威〕
〈名〉Fury

content.content: 猛威を振るう、猛威を極める、猛威をたくましうする
to make its fury felt―rage―run riot―to be rampant
過激主義が中央アジアに猛威を振るっている
Bolshevism is rampant in central Asia.
暴風雨が到ところに猛威を極めた
The storm made its fury felt everywhere.
暴風雨が猛威を極めて襲来した
The storm burst upon us in all its fury.
情欲が猛威をたくましうする
The passions rage―The passions run riot.
大砲が猛威をたくましうした
The guns did fearful execution.

content:
もうか〔猛火〕
〈名〉Raging fire; raging flames; conflagration; the devouring element

content.content: 猛火へ飛び込んで子どもを助けた
I plunged into the flames, and rescued a child.
子どもが猛火の中より救われた
The child was rescued from the flames.
猛火を防ぐ
to fight the conflagration
猛火は全市に蔓延した
The conflagration spread all over the city.
猛火に取り巻かれた
I was surrounded by the devouring element.
猛火は全市をなめ尽くした
The devouring element swept the whole city.

content:
もうかる〔儲かる〕
〈自動〉
1. (商売などを主格とすれば)to pay; to be profitable; to be lucrative

content.content: この商売は儲かる
The business pays―The business is profitable―The business is lucrative.
すてきに儲かる
It is very profitable.
儲かる商売だ
It is a paying business―a profitable business―a lucrative business.
この商売はだいぶ儲かる見込みがある
The business promises large returns.
新聞業は儲かるか
Does journalism pay?
私立学校は儲からぬ
A private school does not pay.
そう安く売っては儲かりません
It does not pay to sell it so cheap.

content: 2. (人を主格にすれば)to make money; to make a profit; to gain (so much)

content.content: どうだ金が儲かるか
Do you make any money?
月にいくら儲かるか
What do you make in a month?
ちっとも儲からん
I can make no money at all―make nothing at all.
でも食うだけは儲かるだろう
But you must make enough to live on.
この品では儲かりません
I can not make money on this article―This article yields me no profit.
彼はどんどん儲かる
He makes money hand over hand―He is coining money.
彼は儲かるからどんなぜいたくでもできる
He can afford any extravagance, for he makes money.
彼は戦争でだいぶ儲かったろう
He must have made a great profit―reaped an immense profit―by the war.
儲かったらお前にも分けてやる
If I make any profit, you shall have a share.
千円儲かった
I have gained 1,000 yen―made a profit of 1,000 yen.
この取引で千円儲かった
I have gained 1,000 yen by the transaction―the transaction has gained me 1,000 yen―I am 1,000 yen in pocket by the transaction.
田中先生が休みで二時間儲かった
We have gained two hours by Mr. Tanaka's absence.
いくら儲かっても命には換えられぬ
No gain can compensate for the loss of life.

content:
もうき〔濛気〕
〈名〉A haze; a mist; a fog

content.content: 海上濛気探し
A dense fog hangs over the sea.

content:
もうきん〔猛禽〕
〈名〉A bird of prey

content.content: 猛禽類
the raptores

content:
もうけ〔設け〕
〈名〉Establishment; institution; provision:(=る) to establish; set up (an office); to institute, adopt (a system); to provide (seats for ladies―a house with a bath-room); to set up (a room for some purpose); to create (a new chair, a fund, etc.)

content.content: 図書館を設ける
to establish a library
本校には図書館の設けあり
The school is provided with a library.
簡易科を設ける
to establish a shorter course
本校には簡易科の設けあり
The school is provided with a shorter course.
婦人席を設ける
to provide seats for ladies
本館は婦人席の設けあり
The house is provided with sears for ladies.
設けの席につく
to take the seats provided
初学者のために設けた組がある
There is a class provided for beginners.
園内に休憩所の設けあり
The garden is provided with a pavilion.
本館には浴室の設けあり
The house is provided with a bath-room.
本紙には投書欄の設けあり
The paper provides a contributor's column contains a contributor's column.
市内には各所に公衆電話の設けあり
The city is provided with many public telephone stands.
教育制度を設ける
to institute a system of education―adopt a system of education
関係を設ける
to establish a relation (to something)―establish a connection (with something)
そこに一室が設けてある
A room is set apart for the purpose.
学生を洋行させるために教育資金を設けた
An educational fund was created for sending students abroad.
法律にはあらゆる犯罪に対して箇条が設けてある
The law provides against all possible crimes.
我が国にはまだそういう設けは無い
Our country has as yet no such provision.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 子を設ける
to beget a child―get a child
彼は子を三人設けた
He had three children.
条件を設ける
to make terms―stipulate
彼は禁酒すべしという条件を設けた
I stipulated that he should give up drinking.
口実を設ける
to make an excuse―assign a pretext
何とかかとか口実を設けて断る
He refuses on some pretence or other.
理由を設ける
to assign a reason(for doing something)
城廓を設ける
to be reserved with people―to keep people at arm's length
彼は人に接するに城廓を設けない
He is frank and unreserved―free and easy―with people.
仮説を設ける
to form a hypothesis
正面に玉座が設けてある
A throne is erected fronting the space.

content:
もうけ〔儲け〕
〈名〉Profits; gains; gainings; makings; earnings; a haul:(=る) to make (money―so much); to make a profit (of so much); to gain (so much); to realize (so much); to clear (so much); to be the gainer; to come off a gainer; to be in pocket; to make a haul

content.content: 金を儲ける
to make money
彼はどんどん金を儲ける
He is making money hand over hand―He is coining money.
月いくら儲けるか
What do you make in a month?
千円儲けた
I have made 1,000 yen―made a profit of 1,000 yen―gained 1,000 yen―realized 1,000 yen―cleared 1,000 yen.
この取引で儲けた
I have gained by the transaction―I am the gainer by the transaction―I am in pocket by the transaction.
この取引で千円儲けた
I have gained 1,000 yen by the transaction―The transaction has gained me 1,000 yen―I am 1,000 yen in pocket by the transaction.
あの取引きではだいぶ儲けたろう
You must have made a great profit by that transaction.
こういう取引きは儲けが薄い
I make little profit by such transactions.
彼はこの本で金を儲けた
He has made money on this book.
この品は儲けが無い
I can make no money on this article―This article yields me no profit.
十円で買っては儲けが無い
I can make no money by selling it for ten yen.
安く売る者は結局儲ける
One who sells cheap gains in the end―comes off a gainer in the end.
あの男はこすく立ちまわっていつも儲ける
He plays his cards well, and always comes off a gainer.
儲けて売る
to sell at a profit
彼はあの家をだいぶ儲けて売った
He has sold the house at a great profit.
買って儲ける
to gain by buying
これを買って儲け物をした
I had a good bargain in this purchase.
一儲けする
to make a haul―do a stroke in business
大儲けをする
to make a fortune―make a good haul―do a good stroke of business―reap a golden harvest
彼は不正なことをして金を儲ける
He makes money by cheating.
あれはあやしい儲けでこしらえた身代だ
He has built his fortune by questionable gains.
儲けはいくらあるか
What are the profits?―What are the gains?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は金儲けが上手だ
He is a good man of business.
金儲けに抜目が無い
He is a shrewd man of business.
うまい儲けにぶつかる
to come across a good job
彼はうまい儲けをしている
He is making a good thing out of it.
株でうまい儲けをした
He has done a good thing in shares.
働いて銭を儲ける
to earn money turn an honest penny
お指値にては儲け無之候
Your limits leave me no margin.
儲け少なく子だくさん
He has little to get and many to keep.
骨折り損のくたびれ儲け
I was a fool for my pains.

猛撃によって要塞を略取する
to take a fortress by storm carry a fortress by assault

the Buddhistic commandment against falsehood

capillarity
毛細管引力

content:
もうしあげる〔申し上げる〕
〈他動〉(Honorific for) to say, tell, speak, state

content.content: 申上げます
Please, sir―May it please your honour.
ありていに申し上げろ
Confess everything!
厚くお礼を申し上げます
I beg to tender my cordial thanks.
(お気の毒で)なんとも申し上げようがございません
I do not know how to console you.

content:
もうしあわせ〔申し合せ〕
〈名〉Mutual agreement; common consent; arrangement; appointment:(=る) to agree upon (a plan); to arrange (a matter); to appoint (the time or place)

content.content: 手筈を申し合わせる
to agree upon the plan of operations
京都で逢うように申し合わした
We have agreed to meet in Kyoto.
経費のことについては先方と申し合わした
I have arranged with the other party about the expenses.
申し合わした時、申し合わした場所
the appointed time―the appointed place
夫婦は申し合わして別れた
The couple separated by common consent.
都下の新聞はこの事について申し合わせたように沈黙を守っている
The papers preserve silence on the subject as if by common consent.
申し合わした通り訴訟を起こした
A suit was instituted as was agreed upon (between us).

content:
もうしいで〔申出〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: もうしで〔申出〕

content:
もうしうける〔申し受ける〕
〈他動〉To ask for (a fee); to charge (a price); to accept (a present)

content.content: 鑑定料を申し受けます
We ask for―expect―a fee for legal advice.
実費を申し受けます
We charge the actual expenses.
茶代一切申し受けず候
No tea-money accepted.

もうしおくる〔申し送る〕
〈他動〉To send (one) word; to write (one) word; to write to (one)

content:
もうしおくれる〔申し後れる〕
〈他動〉To have omitted saying; ought to have said before

content.content: これは申し後れましたが私は何某と申す者でござります
I ought to have said before that I am one So-and-so.

content:
もうしかねる〔申し兼ねる〕
〈自動〉To find it hard to say; to shrink from saying

content.content: (そうかもしれませんが)しかとは申しかねます
I can't say for certain.
知ってはいるが申しかねます
I shrink from saying what I know.
申しかねますが
if I were to ask you
まことに申しかねますが金を少々拝借できますまいか
Would you lend me some money (if I were to ask you)?―Might I ask you to lend me some money?

content:
もうしきかせる〔申し聞かせる〕
〈他動〉To say (to some one); to tell (one something); to speak (to one about something); to reprove (one for a fault)

content.content: 彼に申し聞かせます
I will say so to him.
そのことはきっと本人に申し聞かせます
I will speak to him about the matter―reprove him for his conduct.

content:
もうしきける〔申し聞ける〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: もうしきかせる〔申し聞かせる〕

content:
もうしご〔申し子〕
〈名〉A child born in answer to prayer; a gift-child

content.content: 天神様の申し子
the god Tenjin's gift-child

content:
もうしこす〔申越す〕
〈自他動〉To write to say; to write (one) word; to send (one) word; to write to (one); to communicate with (one)

content.content: 父が早速上京する旨申し越しました
My father writes to say that he will come to town without delay.
兄は来られないと申し越しました
My brother has sent me word―written me word―that he can not come.
御出席無之時は左様お申越し被下度候{ごしゅっせきこれなきときはさようおもうしこしくだされたくそうろう}
In case you can not attend, you will please write to me to that effect.
何事にても不都合有之候節は当方まで御申越し被下度候
If anything goes wrong, you will please communicate with us.
御申越の品は持合せ無之候
We do not happen to have on hand the article you write for.
御申越の件委細承知仕候
I will see to what you write about.
御申越の趣き正に了承仕候
I have duly noted the contents of your letter.

content:
もうしこみ〔申込〕
〈名〉An offer (of marriage); a proposal (of union); an application (for insurance); a subscription (for shares); a challenge (to a duel); overtures (of peace); an entry (for a contest); a notice

content.content: 申し込みに応ずる
to accept an offer―agree to a proposal
申し込みを謝絶する
to decline an offer―reject a proposal
申し込みがたくさんある
We have many offers.
申し込みは溢れるほどある
We are deluged with offers.
結婚の申し込み
an offer of marriage―a proposal of marriage
娘には結婚の申し込みがあった
She has had an offer.
入会の申し込み
an application for admission
保険の申し込み
an application for insurance
株券の申し込み
a subscription for shares―an application for shares
申し込みは募集額の倍に達した
The subscriptions have reached twice the amount to be raised.
決闘の申し込み
a challenge to a duel
講和の申し込み
overtures of peace
料理の品によっては三日前にお申し込みを願います
Some dishes require three days' notice.
座敷がご入用に節は前日にお申し込みを願います
When you want a room, please give us a day's notice.
お申込次第規則書を送ります
The prospectus will be sent on application―immediately on application.
お申し込み次第技師を出張させます
We shall send an expert at a moment's notice―at a minute's notice.
端書でお申し込みになればいつでも品物を送ります
We are ready to send you the goods on application by postal card.
申し込み順に入会を許す
They will be admitted in the order of application.
申込用紙
an application-form―an application-blank
申込証拠金
a deposit (for security―in security)

content:
もうしこむ〔申込む〕
〈他動〉To propose (a coalescence); to make a proposal; to offer (one a position); to make an offer; to make overtures; to apply for (insurance); to subscribe for (shares); to challenge (one to a duel); to enter for (a contest)

content.content: 結婚を申し込む
to make a proposal of marriage―propose to a lady
入会を申し込む
to apply for an admission
保険を申し込む
to apply for insurance
株券を申し込む
to subscribe for shares―apply for shares
地位の相談を申し込む
to offer one a position
決闘を申し込む
to challenge one (to a duel)―call out a man
試合を申し込む
to challenge a school to a match
和睦を申し込む
to make overtures of peace―hold out the olive-branch
寄付を申し込む
to offer a donation
会見を申し込む
to solicit an interview
政府に抗議を申し込む
to enter a protest―lodge a protest―file a protest―with the government―against a measure
会社に苦情を申し込む
to enter a complaint―lodge a complaint―file a complaint―with the company
書面にて申し込むも苦しからず
One may apply by letter.

content:
もうしたて〔申し立て〕
〈名〉A statement; a declaration; an allegation:(=る) to state (a fact); to allege (one's reason); to enter (a protest); to declare (that such is the case, etc.)

content.content: 事実を申し立てる
to state the facts
理由を申し立てる
to state one's reason―allege one's reason
不服を申し立てる、異議を申し立てる
to make a protest against a measure―enter a protest against a measure
故障を申し立てる
to make objections to a measure―raise an objection to a measure
虚偽の申し立てをする
to make a false statement―give false evidence―bear false witness―perjure oneself
証人の申し立て
the testimony of the witness
彼は新聞の記事は虚偽だと申し立てた
He declared the account in the papers to be false.

content:
もうしつけ〔申し付け〕
〈名〉
1. (=言い付け)a command; a charge; orders; directions; instructions; injunctions:(=る) to charge (one to see that...); to tell (one to do something); to bid (one do something); to order, direct, instruct (one to do something); to enjoin (a duty on one)

content.content: 万事不都合無きように頼むと彼に申しつけておきました
I charged him to see that all was right.
正直にするように親に申しつかりました
My father enjoined on me the duty of honesty.
車夫に迎えに来るように申しつけました
I directed my rickshaman to come for me.
今日伺うように主人から申しつかりました
I was ordered by my master to call on you today.
食事の用意をするように家人に申しつけました
I have told my people to prepare a dinner.
しかと申しつけたぞ
I charge you to see that it is done.

content: 2. (=任命)an appointment:(=る) to appoint (one governor―one to the post of governor)

content.content: 私は中学校の校長を申しつかりました
I have been appointed principal of the middle school―appointed to the post of principal of the middle school.

content:
もうしで〔申出〕
〈名〉A proposal; an offer:(=る) to make an offer; to make a proposal; to propose (a coalescence); to offer (one a position); to tender (one's resignation); to apply for (a position); to claim (a lost article); to enter (a protest); to come forward; to report oneself

content.content: 連合を申し出る
to propose a union
辞職を申し出る
to tender one's resignation
土人は帰順を申し出た
The natives have tendered their submission.
不服を申し出る
to enter a protest against the measure
心当たりの者は三日以内に申し出るべし
The loser of the article must claim it within three days.
受験希望者は本月中に申し出るべし
Those who are desirous to be examined shall apply for it―report themselves―in the course of the month.
書面にて申し出るも苦しからず
One may apply by letter.
申出に応ずる
to accept an offer
そんな申し出なら悦んで応ずる
I would jump at such a proposal.
申し出を断る
to decline an offer
申し出をはねつける
to spurn at an offer―reject a proposal

content:

content:
もうしぶん〔申分〕
〈名〉
1. (=言い分)one's say

content.content: こちらにも申し分がある
I must have my say―say my say.
双方に申し分がある
Much might be said on both sides.
先方の申し分を聞こう
Let us hear what he has to say!
双方の申し分を聞こう
Let us hear both sides!
これに申し分があるか
Have you anything to say to this?
それには申し分が無い
I have nothing to say to that―nothing to say against that.
もっともな申し分
You may well say that―You are justified in saying that―There is justice in your statement.

content: 2. (=主張)a claim

content.content: この財産に対して申し分があるか
Have you any claim to the property?

content: 3. (=異存)an objection

content.content: これに申し分があるか
Have you any objection to this?
それには申し分が無い
I have no objection to it.
その話には申し分がある
There are objections to that arrangement―There are two words to that bargain.

content: 4. (=不平)a complaint

content.content: 君はなにか申し分があるか
Have you anything to complain of?
なにも申し分は無い
I have nothing to complain of.

content: 5. (=欠点)a fault

content.content: 申し分無し

to be faultless―perfect―ideal―satisfactory―unexceptionable―unimpeachable―above reproach―all that one can desire―all that can be desired―everything a person or thing should be―as it should be―to leave nothing to be desired
文章は申し分が無い
The style leaves nothing to be desired.
結果は申し分が無い
The result is satisfactory.
彼の申し立ては申し分が無い
His statement is unexceptionable.
支度は申し分が無い
His dress is unimpeachable.
この家なら申し分が無い
This house would suit me to perfection―suit me to a T.
品物は申し分が無い
The article is faultless―The article is perfect.
申し分の無い紳士だ
He is a perfect gentleman.
申し分の無い細君だ
She is an ideal wife.
天気は申し分が無い
The weather is all that one can desire―all that can be desired.
彼は教師としては申し分が無い
He is everything a teacher should be.
万事申し分無し
Everything is as it should be.
お手際実に申し分無し
Your performance leaves nothing to be desired.
彼は実に申し分の無い人だ
He is the pink of perfection.
礼儀においては申し分の無い人だ
He is the pink of politeness.
雅致においては申し分の無い文章だ
The style is the pink of elegance.

content:
もうしゃ〔猛射〕
〈名〉A severe fire; a heavy fire

content.content: 猛射を受ける
to be subjected to a severe fire―receive a heavy fire

もうじゃ〔亡者〕
〈名〉
1. (=亡き人)the dead
2. (=幽霊)a ghost

もうじゅう〔猛獣〕
〈名〉A beast of prey; a wild beast

content:
もうじゅう〔盲従〕
〈名〉Blind obedience:(=する) to obey (one) blindly; to follow (one) blindly; to follow (one) like sheep; to be led by the nose

content.content: 彼らは頭に盲従している
They follow their leader blindly―follow their leader like so many sheep.
人に盲従するなかれ
Do not suffer yourself to be led by the nose.

もうしょう〔猛将〕
〈名〉An intrepid leader

content:
もうしょう〔猛省〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: もうせい〔猛省〕

content:
もうしよう〔申し様〕
〈名〉The manner of saying; the way to say; how to say

content.content: お礼の申しようがありません
I know not in what words to thank you―I have no words with which to express my gratitude―I can never thank you enough.
なんともお詫びの申しようがありません
I know not how to apologize.
このたびのことはなんとも申しようがござりません
I deeply deplore your loss.

content:
もうしわけ〔申訳〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いいわけ〔言い訳〕

content: 』［注意］「言い訳」と異なる所は次の例によって見るべし。

content.content: 実に申しわけの無い失錯を致しました
I have committed an inexcusable blunder.
なんとも申しわけがありません
I don't know what excuse to make―I know not how to apologize.
金を無くして主人に申しわけが無い
I do not know what to say to my master for losing the money.
そんなことをしては主人に申しわけが無い
If I do such a thing, what shall I say to my master?
彼は申しわけ無さそうにそう言った
He said so, as if not knowing what to say.
申しわけばかりの鼻だ
It is an apology for a nose.
ほんの申しわけだけに試験をするのだから心配することは無い
You need not make yourself uneasy, for the examination is gone through for form's sake.
申しわけ的の
perfunctory
申しわけ的の助力ならお断りだ
I decline perfunctory assistance.
あの学校の先生達の授業は申しわけ的だ
The teachers attend to their duties perfunctorily.

content:
もうしわたし〔申渡し〕
〈名〉A sentence; judgment

content.content: 裁判の申し渡しをする
to pass a sentence―pass judgment―on a prisoner
死刑の申し渡し
sentence of death
死刑の申し渡しを受ける
to be condemned to death
死刑の申し渡しを受けた罪人
a criminal under sentence of death―a condemned criminal
懲役の申し渡しを受ける
to be sentenced to penal servitude

content:
もうしわたす〔申し渡す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=宣告する)to sentence (one to imprisonment); to condemn (one to death); to pass a sentence on, pass judgment on, deliver judgment on (a prisoner)

content.content: 判決を申し渡す
to pass a sentence―pass judgment―deliver judgment―on a prisoner
死刑を申し渡された
He was condemned to death.
死刑を申し渡された罪人
a condemned criminal―a criminal under sentence of death
懲役三年を申し渡された
He was sentenced to three years' penal servitude.
無罪を申し渡された
He was acquitted (of the charge)

content: 2. (=命ずる)to order

content.content: 退校の旨を申し渡された
He was ordered to leave school.

content: 3. (=告げる)to announce

content.content: 願いの趣き聞届け難しと申し渡された
It was announced that the petition could not be granted.

もうしん〔妄信〕
〈名〉Superstition:(=する) to be superstitious

もうしん〔猛進〕
〈名〉Rushing forward:(=する) to rush forward; to dash onward

もうしん〔盲信〕
〈名〉Blind faith:(=する) to have blind faith (in priests, etc.)

もうしん〔盲進〕
〈名〉Going it blind:(=する) to go it blind

もうじん〔盲人〕
〈名〉A blind man:(集合的に言えば)the blind

content:
もうじんする〔蒙塵する〕
〈自動〉(For an emperor) to fly from the palace

content.content: 天子蒙塵
The Emperor fled from the capital.

content:
もうす〔申す〕
〈他動〉
1. (Honorific for) to say

content.content: 彼は決してご恩を忘れぬと申しております
He says he will never forget you kindness.
実を申せば嫌いです
To tell the truth, I do not like it.
そう申してはなんですがあなたの演説は二番でした
If I may venture to say so, your speech was the second best―Your speech was, under favour, the second best.
申すまでも無い
I need not say―I need scarcely say―It is needless to say―It goes without saying―to say nothing of―not to speak of―not to mention―let alone.
彼は英語は申すまでも無く、英語は申すに及ばず仏独にも通じております
He knows French and German, to say nothing of his English―not to speak of his English―not to mention his English―let alone his English.

content: 2. (Honorific for) to name (a boy Taro); to call (a flower camellia, etc.)

content.content: この子は太郎と申します
The boy is named Taro.
私は田中と申します
My name is Tanaka―I am one Tanaka.
この花は何と申しますか
What do you call this flower?
椿と申します
We call it camellia―It is called camellia.

content: 3. (An honorific suffixed to verbs) to do oneself the honour (to do something); to beg leave (to do something)

content.content: ご案内申しましょう
I will do myself the honour to show you the way.
此段御屈申上候成
I beg to report that...

content:
もうすこし〔もう少し〕
〈副〉(量なら)a little more, some more:(数なら)a few more, some more:(時間なら)a little longer

content.content: 酒をもう少しお上がりなさい
Take some more wine!
もう少し下さい
Give me a little more!
もう少し大きな声で
Speak a little louder!
もう少し待つて下さい
Wait a little longer!
もし少し遊んで行き給え
Won't you stay a little longer?
もう少しで
very nearly―almost―well nigh―nigh upon―close upon
もう少しで十二時だ
It is very nearly twelve―nigh upon twelve.
彼はもう少しで四十だ
He is well nigh forty―nigh upon forty.
もう少しで河で死ぬ所だった
I was very nearly drowned―I came near being drowned―I had a narrow escape.
僕はもう少しで出かけるところだった、ちょうどよいところだった
I had very nearly gone out. You came just in time.

content:
もうすにおよばず〔申すに及ばず〕
〈熟語〉→『

content.content: もうすまでもなく〔申す迄もなく〕

content:
もうすまでもなく〔申す迄もなく〕
〈熟語〉I need not say; I need scarcely say; it is needless to say; it goes without saying; to say nothing of; not to speak of; not to mention; let alone

content.content: 申すまでもなく英語は達者です
It is needless to say―It goes without saying―that he is proficient in English.
英語は申すまでもなく仏語独語もできます
He knows French and German, to say nothing of his English―not to speak of his English―not to mention his English―let alone his English.

野には毛氈を敷いたようにいろいろの野花が咲いている
The field is carpeted with wild flowers.

content.content: 彼は猛然奮起した

もうでる〔詣でる〕

content.content: 毎日何千という人がこの宮に詣でる
Thousands of people worship at this shrine every day.
伊勢詣で
a pilgrimage to the Ise Shrine

content:
もうとう〔毛頭〕
〈副〉(Not) the least; (none) at all; (none) whatever; (not) a bit; (not) a whit; (not) a jot; (not) a little; (not) a shadow (of doubt); (not) a spice (of humour); (not) a hint (of obscenity); (not) a trace (of wit, etc.)

content.content: もうとう疑い無し
There is not a shadow of doubt―not the shadow of a doubt―about it.
そんなことはもうとう無い
Not a bit of it.
僕はもうとう異存は無い
I have no objection at all―no objection whatever.
彼はこっけいなどはもうとう無い
He has not a spice of humour.
彼と僕との間に悪感情はもうとう無い
There is not a trace of ill-feeling between him and me.
僕は不平はもうとう無い
I have nothing whatever to complain of.
人を誹謗するような精神はもうとう無い
Nothing is farther from my intentions than―Far be it from me―to detract from others' merits!

もうねん〔妄念〕
〈名〉A delusion; a mistaken grudge

content.content: 毛髪病
trichosis

trichology

content.content: むちもうまい〔無智蒙昧〕

content.content: 網膜炎
retinitis

content.content: 濛々たる霧
a dense fog
黒雲濛々として天にみなぎる
Dark clouds cover the sky.

content:
もうもく〔盲目〕
〈名〉Blindness:(=の) blind

content.content: 盲目的
blind
盲目的に人に従う

もうら〔網羅〕
〈名〉Inclusion; comprehension:(=する) to include; to comprise; to embrace; to comprehend; to contain; to take in; to cover

content.content: この名簿は文学のあらゆる大家を網羅している
The list includes―comprises―embraces―all great names in literature.
この会合は社会のあらゆる階級を網羅している
The meeting comprises―embraces―all classes of society.
この字書にはあらゆる熟語が網羅されている
The dictionary contains all idiomatic phrases.
事実を網羅する
to cover all the facts―be comprehensive of all facts
現内閣は国中の人才を網羅している
The present Cabinet covers all the talent of the nation.

content:
もうれつ〔猛烈〕
〈形〉Fierce (love); furious (gale); savage (attack); vehement (abuse); severe (fighting); violent (storm); drastic (medicine, etc.):(=に) fiercely; furiously; like fury; like Hell; like blazes; like the devil; like thunder; like anything

content.content: 猛烈なる攻撃
a fierce attack―a furious attack―a savage attack
猛烈に攻撃する
to make a fierce attack―make a furious attack―make a savage attack―fling oneself at the enemy―hurl oneself at the enemy
女が男に猛烈に持ちかける
A woman makes fierce love to a man―flings herself at his head.
猛烈な砲火を受ける
to be subjected to a severe fire―receive a heavy fire
暴風雨が猛烈に吹きすさんでいる
A violent storm is raging.
暴風雨猛烈を極めて襲い来た
A storm burst upon us in all its fury.
その言い方は猛烈だ
You put it strong.
猛烈にやれ
Go at it tooth and nail!
猛烈に降る、猛烈に吹く、猛烈に戦う、猛烈に働く
to rain or blow or fight or work like fury―like blazes―like Hell―like the devil―like thunder―like anything

content:
もうろう〔朦朧〕
〈形〉
1. Dim; indistinct; vague; obscure; hazy; misty; foggy; dreamy

content.content: 島が遠方に朦朧と見える
An island is dimly seen―indistinctly visible―in the distance.
船が暗闇に朦朧と現れた
A ship loomed in the darkness.
人の姿が朦朧と現れた
A man's form appeared like a phantom.
彼の思想は朦朧としている
His ideas are vague―obscure―dreamy―misty―foggy―hazy―in a haze.
酔眼朦朧として
with eyes dimmed with drink
(油絵の)朦朧派
the woolly style of painting―ultra impressionism
朦朧車夫
a hooligan rickshaman
朦朧政治家
a demagogue

content:
もうろく〔耄碌〕
〈名〉Dotage; second childhood:(=する) to dote; to be in one's dotage

content.content: 先生も耄碌した
He is in his dotage―in his second childhood.
君もずいぶん耄碌したね
Your memory begins to fail you.
僕も年のせいで耄碌してきた
Age begins to tell on me.
耄碌はしたくないものだ
The Lord keep my memory green!
耄碌するな
Keep your bones green!
あの耄碌老爺め
The dotard!

content:
もえあがる〔燃え上がる〕
〈自動〉To blaze up; to burst into flames

content.content: 燻っていたのがパッと燃え上った
The smouldering mass burst into flames.
風が当たるとパッと燃え上がった
The wind fanned it into flames.

content:
もえうつる〔燃え移る〕
〈自動〉To catch fire; (fire) spreads to (a house, etc.)

content.content: 火が隣家に燃え移った
The fire spread to the neighbouring house―The neighbouring house caught fire.
蝋燭の火が火薬に燃え移った
The gunpowder caught fire from the candle-flame.

content:
もえきる〔燃え切る〕
〈自動〉To burn itself out

content.content: 火が燃えきった
The fire has burnt itself out.

content:
もえさし〔燃えさし〕
〈名〉A brand

content.content: 蝋燭の燃えさし
a candle-end
マッチの燃えさし
a match-end

もえたつ〔燃え立つ〕
〈自動〉To blaze up; to flame up; to flare up

content:
もえつく〔燃え付く〕
〈自動〉To catch fire; to kindle; to light

content.content: 火が障子に燃えついた
The paper-screen caught fire.
薪が生まで燃えつかない

content:
もえる〔燃える〕
〈自動〉
1. To burn:(焚き火のように燃える)to blaze

content.content: 火が燃える
Fire burns.
火が盛んに燃えている
The fire is blazing up.
火がなかなか燃えない
The fire will not burn―I can not make the fire burn.
薪が燃える
Wood burns.
薪が生でなかなか燃えない
The wood is green and will not burn―refuses to burn.
家が燃えている
The house is burning―on fire.
家が盛んに燃えている
The house is in flames―in a blaze.
火事が燃えすさんでいる
The fire is raging.
燃える物
combustible things―combustibles
燃えやすいガス
inflammable gas
燃えるような太陽に照らされて進んだ
We proceeded under a burning sun―a blazing sun.

content: 2. (=情などが燃える)to burn ; to glow; to be ardent; to be aflame

content.content: 彼は彼女に対する情に燃えている
He burns with love for her.
燃える思い
ardent love―ardent passion
彼は燃える思いを胸に包んでいる
He cherishes an ardent passion.
心は青春の情に燃えている
His beat glows with all the ardour of youth.
血が燃えた
My blood boiled―My blood was up.

content:
もえる〔萌える〕
〈自動〉To sprout; to germinate; to spring up; to come up

content.content: 麦が萌えた
The wheat is sprouting―The wheat has come up.
種を蒔いたのが萌えた
The seed I have sown has sprung up.

content:
もがく
〈自動〉
1. To struggle; to writhe; to wriggle; to squirm; to flounder (in the mire) :(子どもなら)to kick and struggle

content.content: 彼は縄目を抜けようとしてもがいた
He struggled to free himself from his bonds.
苦しんでもがく
to writhe in agony
痛がってもがく
to writhe with pain
もがきまわる
to wriggle and squirm about
空をつかんでもがいた
He clutched at the in agony.
もがき死にした
He died in agonies.

content: 2. (=畢生の力を振るう)to strive (to the utmost)

content.content: 彼は目的を達しようとしてもがいている
He is striving hard to attain his object.

content:
もぎ〔模擬〕

content.content: 模擬戦
a sham fight
模擬攻撃
a sham attack―a mimic attack
模擬試験
a sham examination
模擬店

もぎせん〔模擬戦〕
〈名〉A sham fight

content:

content.content: 没義道な人

content:
もく〔目〕
〈名〉
1. (=眼)the eye

content.content: 彼は一目眇{ひとめくら}なり
He is blind of one eye―one-eyed.
一目瞭然
One may see at glance―One may see with half an eye―“He who runs may read.”
彼の欠点は一目瞭然だ
One may see his faults at a glance―He who runs may read his faults―His faults lie on the surface.
彼の罪は十目の見るところ(十指の指すところ)
Everybody points to him as the culprit―Everything points to his guilt.

content: 2. (=碁盤の目)a square

content.content: 十目勝つ
to win by ten squares
何目置く
to take so many odds
何目置かせる
to give one so many odds
一目置く
to yield the palm to one―yield to one
君には一目置く
I must yield the palm to you―I acknowledge your superiority over me.

content:
もぐ
〈他動〉To wrench; to pluck; to pick; to break off

content.content: 彼の手から短刀をもぎ取った
I wrenched the dagger from his grasp.
人形の首をもいだね

to pick the pears off the tree

content:
もくあみ〔木阿弥〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: もとのもくあみ〔元の木阿弥〕

content:
もくげきする〔目撃する〕
〈他動〉To witness (a scene); to observe (a fact); to see (anything) with one's own eyes

content.content: 僕は現場を目撃した
I witnessed the scene―I was a witness of the scene―I was an eye-witness of the scene.
僕は現に目撃したから間違い無い
I am certain of the fact, for I saw it with my own eyes.
僕が目撃した面白い事実がある
I have observed a curious fact―A curious fact has come under my observation―come under my notice―come under my eyes.
目撃者
an eye-witness―an ocular witness

〈名〉
1. (=見積り)an estimate; estimation; valuation; calculation

content.content: 千円には売れる目算だった
I estimated the price at 1,000 yen―counted on getting 1,000 yen for it.
目算がはずれた
But I have miscalculated.

content: 2. (=目論見)a design; a scheme; a project; a plan

content.content: 目算を立てる
to form a design―lay a plan
目算ががらりとはずれた
My scheme has entirely gone wrong―My plans are upset.

the Revelation―the Apocalypse

content:
もくしする〔黙視する〕
〈自他動〉To overlook (a fault); to pass over (a matter) in silence; to wink at (a fault); to connive at (an offence); to shut one's eyes to (a fault); to disregard, have no regard to (truth); to countenance, give countenance to (wrong-doing); to look on

content.content: 人の悪事を黙視するのは悪事を奨励するに当たる
We should not countenance wrong-doing―give countenance to wrong-doing.
彼は事実を黙視している(顧みない)
He disregards facts―He has no regard to facts.
こんな甚しい過失を黙視することはできぬ
I can not wink at such gross faults―shut my eyes to such glaring faults.
そんな不埒な行為を黙視することはできぬ
I can not overlook such wrong―pass over such wrong in silence.
黙視するに忍びず口を出した
Unable to remain a passive spectator, I interfered.

content:

content.content: 木質組織
ligneous tissue

もくしょう〔黙笑〕
〈名〉A grin:(=する) to grin

content:
もくしょう〔目睫〕
〈名〉Imminence

content.content: 目睫の間に迫る
to be imminent―close at hand
危険が目睫の間に迫っている
The danger is imminent.
目睫の間に迫った危険
an imminent danger
試験は目睫の間に迫った
The examination is close at hand.

もくしょうする〔目笑する〕
〈自動〉To exchange smiling glances

content:
もくず〔藻屑〕
〈名〉Seaweeds

content.content: 海底の藻屑となる
to go the bottom―go to Davy Jones's locker―find a watery grave
彼らは日本海の藻屑となった
They found their watery graves in the Japan Sea.

content:
もくする〔黙する〕
〈自動〉To be silent; to keep silent; to observe silence; to be reticent; to hold one's peace; to hold one's tongue; to contain oneself

content.content: 数ならぬ身とは言えこの場合黙していられぬ
Humble as I am, I can not remain silent―I must make myself heard.
その目的を黙して語らず
He did not allude to his object―He did not hint at his object.
黙して答えず
He would not reply.
(法廷にて)黙して答えぬ
to stand mute

content:
もくする〔目する〕
〈他動〉To regard, look upon (some one as something)

content.content: 人彼を目して狂人となす
People regard him as a madman―look upon him as a madman.
彼は狂人をもって目せられてる
He is regarded as madman―look upon as a madman.

もくせい〔木犀〕
〈名〉The fragrant olive

もくせい〔木精〕
〈名〉
1. (=木から取った酒精) wood-spirit; methyl alcohol
2. (=木霊)a wood-nymph; a dryad

content:
もくせい〔木製〕
〈形〉Made of wood; wooden

content.content: 器具は木製だ
The utensils are made of wood.
木製器具
wooden utensils

もくせいそう〔木犀草〕
〈名〉The mignonette

もくせん〔木栓〕
〈名〉A wooden stopper; a cork

もくせん〔木船〕
〈名〉A wooden ship

content:
もくぜん〔目前〕
〈副〉Under one's eyes; before one's eyes; in one's sight; in one's presence:(=の) immediate

content.content: 目前で起こった出来事だ
The event happened under my eyes.
目前の出来事を知らずにおった(足下から鳥)
I did not know what was passing under my eyes.
その光景は目前にみるようだ
(I fancy)I see the scene before my eyes.
彼は僕の目前で女房を打った
He beat his wife in my sight―in my presence.
証人の目前で実験を行った
The experiment was made in fall view of the witnesses.
目前に迫っている
to be imminent―directly ahead―close at hand―in sight―to stare one in the face
危険が目前にせまっている
The danger is imminent.
時期が目前に迫って来た
The time is directly ahead.
試験が目前に迫っている
The examination is close at hand.
議会の解散は今や目前に迫れり
The dissolution of the Diet is now in sight.
死が目前に迫った
Death stared me in the face.
餓死が籠城者の目前に迫った
Starvation stared the besieged in the face.
目前の利
immediate advantage―immediate gain
目前の利を図る
to look to immediate advantage―take a short-sighted policy
目前の利に走る
to seek for immediate gain
目前の利に迷って遠大の利益を見のがす
to be tempted by the prospect of immediate gain to overlook future interest

もくそう〔黙想〕
〈名〉Meditation; contemplation:(=する) to meditate; to contemplate

content:
もくそう〔目送〕
〈名〉Following with the eye:(=する) to follow with the eye

content.content: 目迎目送する
to greet and follow one with the eye

content:
もくぞう〔木像〕
〈名〉
1. A wooden image; a graven image

content.content: 木像のように落着いている
He is as calm as a statue.

content: 2. (=でくの坊)a figurehead

content.content: 社長は木像だ
Our president is a mere figurehead.

content:
もくぞう〔木造〕
〈形〉Made of wood; built of wood; wooden

content.content: 日本家は木造だ
Japanese houses are built of wood.
木造の家は火災の憂いがある
Wooden houses are liable to fire.

content:

〈名〉Eye-measurement:(=する) to measure (anything) with the eye

content.content: 距離を目測する
to measure the distance with the eye

content:

〈名〉Charcoal

content.content: 木炭画
charcoal-drawing

content:
もくてき〔目的〕
〈名〉
1. An object; a purpose; an aim; an end; an intention; a view

content.content: 僕は経世家になる目的だ
I intend to be a statesman.
君は何になる目的か
What are you going to be?
本会の目的は英語を実習するにあり
The society has for its object the practising of the English language.
人生の目的は何か
What is the end and aim of existence?
報酬は我輩の目的にあらず
Emolument is no object with me.
当初の目的を忘れるな
Do not lose sight of the original object!
当初の目的を忘れたことが無い
I have ever kept my object in view.
(あの人は時々来るが)何目的があって来るのかしら
I wonder what he is after.
君の来る目的は知っている
I know what you are after.
君は秘密を探るのが目的だろう
You are after secrets, are you not?
一定の目的
a definite purpose
あれまでは決まった目的無く勉強しておった
Up to that time, I had been studying without any definite purpose.
彼は目的無く徘徊している
He wanders about aimlessly.
それは目的外だ
That is beside the purpose―aside from the purpose.
高尚な目的
a noble aim―a high purpose―a lofty purpose
遠大な目的
far-reaching aims
彼は遠大な目的をもって働く
He works with an eye to the future.
彼は目的が高い
He aims high―looks high.
目的を立てる
to propose an object to oneself―set an object before one
人はいったん目的を立てた以上はあくまでこれを貫徹する決心を持たなければならぬ
Once you set an object before you, you must be determined to carry it through to the end.
何を目的とする
to aim at anything―have something for one's object
青年は栄達を目的とすべし
Young men should aim at distinction.
教師と生徒は目的とするところを異にする
The teacher and student aim at different things―They are at cross purposes.
本校の目的とするところは実用英語を教えるにあり
The school has for its object the instruction of Practical English.
目的を達する
(終局の目的なら)to attain one's object―(その場の目的なら)―gain one's end―secure one's ends―(意見を通すの意味なら)―carry one's point―(軽く言えば)―get there
修業に来る者はたんさんあるが目的を達する者は少ない
Many students come in pursuit of knowledge, but few attain their objects.
まあ目的を達したからよい
We have gained our end―carried our point―and so far so good.
彼は内々目的があって人を賞めるのだ
He praises people to gain some private ends―with some end in view.
大望の目的を達する
to reach the goal of one's ambition
出世の目的を達する
to win a prize of life
出世の目的
the prizes of life
目的を達する手段
a means to the end
目的と手段とを誤る
to mistake the means for the end
金そのものを愛するは目的と手段を誤ったものである
To love money for itself is to confound the means with the end.
目的は手段を神聖にす(嘘も方便)
The end sanctifies the means―the end justifies the means.
遊戯は娯楽と運動の二重の目的を達するものである
Games and sports serve the double purpose of amusement and exercise.
目的を遂げる
to accomplish one's purpose―effect one's purpose―realize one's purpose
どんなことをしても(万難を排して)目的を遂げる決心だ
I will accomplish my purpose at any cost―Nothing shall hinder me from accomplishing my purpose.
彼は必ず目的を遂げる
He is sure to accomplish his purpose―He never fails to accomplish his purpose―He never fails of his purpose.
目的に叶う
to answer the purpose
これだけ金があれば目的に叶う(間に合う)
The sum will answer the purpose―serve my turn―do (the business)
目的をはずす
to miss one's aim―miss one's object
何々の目的をもって

for the purpose of doing something―(はすたれかかった言い方、今は)―(in order) to do something―with the object of doing something―with the intention of doing something―with the idea of doing something―with the view of doing something―with a view to(doing) something―with an eye to something―(法律では)―with intent to do something
彼はどういう目的で洋行したのか
For what purpose has he gone abroad?―(は古い形、今は)―What has he gone abroad for?
僕は英語研究の目的をもって上京したのだ
I have come to town(in order) to study English―with the object of studying English―with the intention of studying English―with the view of studying English―with the idea of studying English.
彼は泰西の文物を研究する目的で洋行した
He went abroad with the view of studying things Western―with a view to studying things Western.
彼は特待生になる目的で勉強している
He is working hard with a view to scholarship―with an eye to scholarship.
(僕は洋行しようと思って)その目的で金をためている
I am saving money for the purpose―to that end.
彼は家族に楽をさせるのが目的で働くのだ
He works hard (in order) that his family may live in comfort―(to the end) that his family may live in comfort.
彼は金を詐取せんとする目的で借りたものだ
He borrowed the money with intent to defraud his creditor.

もくてきかく〔目的格〕
〈名〉［文法］The objective case :(英語以外の文法にては)the accusative case

もくてきご〔目的語〕
〈名〉［文法］An object

もくてきこう〔目的港〕
〈名〉The port of destination

content.content: 松林を目標に射撃した

the goal of one's ambition

coarse-grained wood

もくもく〔黙々〕
〈形〉Silent; mute; dumb; tacit; implied

content.content: 黙々の約束
tacit understanding―implied agreement
黙々の許可
tacit permission
黙々に許可の意を示す
to imply permission
事を黙々に付す
to pass over a matter in silence

両者は黙々のうちに互いの胸中を察した

content:
もぐもぐ
〈副〉Mumblingly

content.content: 口をもぐもぐする
to mumble
彼は何か言いたそうに口をもぐもぐそせた
He mumbled as if he wanted to say something.
口をもぐもぐそせながら何か言う
to mumble out something
老人は歯の無い口で何かもぐもぐ噛んでおつた
The old man was mumbling something with toothless gums.

content:
もくやく〔黙約〕
〈名〉A tacit agreement; a tacit understanding; an implied contract:(=する) to make a tacit agreement; to agree tacitly; to agree by implication

content.content: 君が協力するという黙約で承諾したのだ
I consented on the understanding that you would cooperate with me.
いずれも干渉しないという黙約があったらいし
There seems to have been a tacit agreement―It seems to have been tacitly agreed―that neither side would interfere.

content:

〈名〉Bathing; ablution:(=する)to bathe; to take a bath; to perform ablutions

content.content: 斎戒沐浴{さいかいもくよく}する
to perform ablutions

He is the man to worm himself anywhere if he sees any prospect of gain.

潜った
