もくろく〔目録〕
〈名〉A catalogue; a list; an inventory

content.content: 書籍目録
a catalogue of books
物品目録
a list of articles―an inventory of goods
物品の目録を作る
to make a list of articles―inventory goods
進物目録
a list of presents
結納の目録
a list of betrothal presents
(俳優や一座の)演芸目録
a repertoire
目録で金を贈る
to present one with money in writing

content:
もくろみ〔目論見〕
〈名〉A design; a scheme; a project; a plan; an end in view; an axe to grind

content.content: 面前で賞める人は何かもくろみがあるから後が怖い
A man who praises you to your face, has some end in view―an axe to grind.
彼は何か深いもくろみがありそうだ
He must harbour some deep design.
それは面白いもくろみだ
That is an interesting scheme―an interesting project.
事がもくろみ通りうまくいった
The matter went as it was planned.
もくろみがはずれた
My scheme has gone wrong―My plans are upset.

content:
もくろむ〔目論む〕
〈他動〉To design (an undertaking); to scheme (the conquest of a country); to project (a new work); to plan (an expedition); to meditate (revenge); to contemplate (the establishment of a school); to have (a new work) in contemplation; to have (some end) in view

content.content: 一大著述をもくろんでいる
I have a large work in contemplation.
彼は何か事業をもくろんでいる
He is designing some undertaking―scheming some enterprise.
彼はいつも何かしらもくろんでいる
He always has some project or other on the brain.

content:
もけい〔模型〕
〈名〉A model:(機械のは)a pattern

content.content: 軍艦の模型
the model of a warship
模型飛行機
a model aeroplane
運転模型
a working model
模型工場
a pattern-shop

content:
もげる
〈自動〉To be wrenched off ; to come off

content.content: 人形の首がもげた
The doll's head has come off.

content:
もこ〔模糊〕
〈形〉Dim; hazy; misty; vague; obscure; indistinct

content.content: 遠山霞を帯びて模糊たり
The distant mountains loom dimly through the mist.
意味が曖昧模糊としている
The meaning is vague obscure.
事実は曖昧模糊のうちに葬られた
The facts were smothered up.

content:
もし〔若し〕
〈接続詞〉If; in case; suppose; supposing; provided:(前置詞に訳せば)in case of; in the event of

content.content: もし彼が死んだら誰が後を取るか
Who will succeed to the property if he dies?―in case he dies?―in case of his death?―in the event of his death?
もし水が無かったらなにも生きておれぬ
If there were no water―Suppose there were no water―Supposing there were no water―Without water―nothing could live.
もし怠けなかったら好い先生だ
If he were not idle―Were it not for hid idleness―But for his idleness―he would be a good teacher.
もし謝るなら許してやる
I will pardon him, provided he acknowledge his fault.
もしそうだとすればどうすればよいか
If so―In that case―On that supposition―what ought I to do?
もし天気が好ければ明日立つ
I start tomorrow, weather permitting.

content: 〈呼び掛け〉(I) say; please; pray:(男に向かってなら) sir:(婦人に向かってなら)madam

content.content: もし貴方
Please, sir―Pray, sir.
返事はどうか、もし
What is your answer, pray?
もし貴方、お忘れもの
Sir (or Madam), you have forgotten something.
もし貴方は高杉さんではありませんか
Mr. Takasugi, I believe?
もし、ちょっと物をお尋ね申します
Please, sir, I want to ask you something.→『もしもし』

content:
もじ〔文字〕
〈名〉(ABCやいろはの如きは)a letter:(漢字の如きは)a character

content.content: 本の表紙に文字が入っている
The cover of a book is lettered.
文字上の、文字通りの
literal
文字通りの意味
literal meaning―grammatical sense
文字通りの解釈
literal interpretation
文字通りに解釈する
to interpret a passage according to the letter―interpret a passage literally―take a metaphor in literal sense―literalize a metaphor
彼は貧乏ということは文字上の意味を知っているにとどまる
He only knows poverty in the abstract.
(Egypt の)象形文字
a hieroglyph―hieroglyphics
(Assyria の)楔形文字
cuneiform characters―sphenograms
(漢字の如き)表意文字
an ideogram―an ideograph

もしかすると〔若しかすると〕
〈副〉Possibly; perhaps

content:
もしくは〔若しくは〕
〈接続詞〉Or; either... or...

content.content: 語学は英語のほかにフランス語もしくはドイツ語を知るを要す
In languages, one must know either French or German, besides English.

content:
もしも〔若しも〕
〈接続詞〉→『

content.content: もし〔若し〕

content:
もしもし
〈呼び掛け〉Hello!; Are you there?

content.content: もしもし、本局五百四十三番
Hello! Give me five four three Central.
もしもし、あなたは田中さんですか
Are you there, Mr. Tanaka?
もしもし、こちらは伊藤です
Hello, this is Ito speaking.

content:
もじもじする
〈自動〉To fidget; to be restless; to hesitate(to do something)

content.content: 彼は始終もじもじしている
He is constantly fidgeting―in a fidget.
気を揉んでもじもじしている
He is fretful and restless.
僕は言い出しかねてもじもじしておった
I was hesitating to speak about it.
彼はおかしさをこらえて顔をもじもじしておった
In his effort to contain himself, his features were working strangely.

content:
もしものこと〔若しもの事〕
〈名〉A possibility; an emergency; a contingency; an eventuality; an accident; the worst; death

content.content: もしもの事があったら
if the worst should happen―in case of emergency―in case of need―in time of need
もしもの事があっても覚悟を決めている
I am prepared for the worst.
もしもの事があったら僕でもお役に立つだろう
I may be of service in case of emergency―in time of need.
君の身にもしもの事があったら(君が万一死んだら)家族はどうするか
If anything should happen to you, what would become of your family?
彼の身にもしもの事がありはせぬかと気遣っている
I fear for his life―tremble for his life.
もしもの事のある場合に備える
to provide against accidents―provide against emergencies
もしもの事の備えに貯蓄すべしだ
You ought to provide against possible needs―lay by against a rainy day.
(医者が病人の家族に向かって)もしもの事が無いとも限らないから覚悟をなさい
You must be prepared for the worst.

content:
もしゃ〔模写〕
〈名〉A copy; a transcription; a reproduction; a facsimile; an autotype:(絵画の模写)a replica:(=する) to copy; to transcribe; to reproduce; to facsimile

content.content: これは原物を寸分違わず模写したものである
This is an exact copy―a facsimile―a reproduction in facsimile―of the original.

content:
もしや〔若しや〕
〈副〉(Should) by any chance; (may) possibly, by some possibility

content.content: もしや失敗したらどうしようか
If, by any chance, I should fail, what should I do?
もしや山がはずれたら元の商売に帰る
If, by any chance, my speculation should fail, I can fall back on my old business.
もしやそうでないとも限らぬ
It may possibly be so―It may by some possibility be so.
もしや君でないかと思った
I thought it might possibly be you.
戦争のことだからもしや日本が負けぬとも限らぬ
As it is the fortune of war, Japan may by some possibility be defeated.
もしや知れはすまいか
May it not possibly become known?
もしや知れてはたいへんだ
What if it should, by any chance, become known?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君はもしや Brown という英国人をご存じないか
Don't you happen to know an Englishman, Brown by name?

content: 〈接続詞〉In case; for fear; lest

content.content: もしや失敗した時の予備があるか
Have you anything to fall back upon in case you fail?―in case of failure?
もしや雨が降るといけないから傘をお持ちなさい
Take an umbrella with you lest it should rain―for fear it may rain―for fear of its raining.
もしや知れてはたいへんだから気をつけなければならぬ
We must be careful lest it should become known.

もしゅ〔喪主〕
〈名〉The chief mourner

content:
もしょう〔喪章〕
〈名〉A mourning badge; a mourning band; mourning drapery; a crape

content.content: 腕に喪章を付ける
to wear a crape on one's sleeve
胸に喪章を付ける
to wear a mourning badge on one's breast
旗に喪章が付いている
The flags are draped (in mourning).

もじり〔捩り〕
〈名〉(詩歌のは)a burlesque; a parody; a travesty:(言葉のは)a variation

content:
もじる〔捩る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=ねじる)to twist; to distort; to contort

content.content: 顔をもじる
(苦しんでなら)to distort one's features―(芸としてなら)―contort one's face

content:
2. (=詩歌をもじる)to burlesque, parody, travesty (a poem)
3. (=言葉をもじる)to vary (an expression)

もす〔燃す〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: もやす〔燃やす〕

content:
もす〔模す〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: もほう〔模倣〕

もすそ〔裳裾〕
〈名〉The skirt (of a garment)

content:
もぞう〔模造〕
〈名〉(事)imitation:(物)an imitation; a counterfeit:(=の) imitation:(=する) to imitate (the genuine article); to counterfeit (Japanese goods); to copy (a work); to model after or upon (some pattern); to pattern after (some model)

content.content: ドイツでは巧みに日本品を模造する
Germany skilfully imitates―counterfeits―Japanese goods.
日本品を模造したドイツ品
German goods in imitation of Japanese.
金閣を模造した建物だ
The edifice is modelled upon the Kinkaku.
模造品
an imitation―a counterfeit
模造革
imitation leather―leatherette
模造ダイヤ
imitation diamond―false diamond
模造金
imitation gold―artificial gold

content:
もそっと
〈副〉→『

content.content: もうすこし〔もう少し〕

content:
もだえ〔悶え〕
〈名〉Writing; struggle; agony; anguish:(=る) to writhe; to struggle; to wriggle; to squirm; to be in agonies

content.content: 身を悶える
to writhe
悶え苦しむ
to writhe in agony―to be in agonies
彼は病苦に悶えている
He is in pain.
心の悶え
mental anguish

content:
もたげる〔擡げる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: もちあげる〔持上げる〕

content:
もだしがたい〔黙し難い〕
〈形〉Unable to neglect

content.content: 君命黙し難し彼は任に赴いた
In obedience to his lord's commands, he proceeded to his new post.
知事の懇請黙し難く一場の演説を試みた
I made a speech at the request of the governor.

content:
もたせかける〔凭せ掛ける〕
〈他動〉To lean, rest, place, set, stand, prop up (one thing) against (another)

content.content: 傘を壁にもたせかけた
I stood my umbrella against the wall.

content:
もたせる〔持たせる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=持たしめる)to let (one) have; to place (anything) in one's hand

content.content: 子どもにこんな本を持たせるものでない
You should not place such books in the hands of boys.
彼に持たせると鈍刀も正宗
A dull blade becomes a Masamune in his hands.
狂人に刃物を持たせるな
Do not place an edge-tool in the hands of a madman.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 女房を持たせる
to get one a wife
家を持たせる
to set one up in a house
世帯を持たせる
to set one up in housekeeping
店を持たせる
to set one up in business
息子にタバコ屋の店を持たせた
He set up his son as a tobacconist.
花を持たせる
to yield the palm to another

content: 2. (=運ばせる)to give (one something) to carry; to have (one) carry or take (something somewhere); to send (something by some one)

content.content: 男に荷物を持たせた
I gave the man my luggage to carry―I had the man carry my luggage.
誰かにこの荷物をステーションへ持たして下さい
Have some one carry my luggage to the station―(人を言わなければ)―Have my luggage carried to the station.
お手紙をどこへ持たしてやるのですか
Where shall he take your letter?
学校へ持たしてやって下さい
Have him take it to the school―(人を言わなければ)―Have it taken to the school.
手紙を誰に持たしてやろうか
By whom shall I send the letter?
小使に持たしておやりなさい
Send it by the servant.

content: 3. (=保たせる)to preserve; to keep

content.content: 魚は塩で持たしてある
The fish is preserved with salt.
遠くから来る魚は氷で持たして来る
Fish brought a long way is kept in ice.
この木を暑中水をやり続けて持たした
I kept the tree alive by watering it through the summer.

content: 4. (=負担させる)to make (one) bear

content.content: 費用を持たせる
to make one bear the expenses
誰に費用を持たせるか
Who shall bear the expenses?
勘定を持たせる
to make one pay the bill
誰に勘定を持たせるか
Who shall pay the bill?

content:
もたせる〔凭せる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: もたせかける〔凭せ掛ける〕

content:
もたらす〔齎す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=持って来る)to bring; to bear

content.content: 敵の情報をもたらす
to bring intelligence of the enemy
彼は吉報をもたらした
He bears good news―He is the bearer of good news.

content: 2. (=持って行く)to take; to carry

もたれる
〈他動〉(=腹にもたれる)To sit heavy on (the stomach); to be stodgy

content.content: 米飯は腹にもたれる
Rice sits heavy on the stomach.
麦飯は腹にもたれない
Barley-rice sits light on the stomach.
腹にもたれる食物は食わぬがよい
Abstain from stodgy food.

content:
もたれる〔凭れる〕
〈他動〉To lean on (a desk); to lean against (the wall); to lean back in (a chair); to recline on (a couch); to throw one's weight on (a stair, etc.)

content.content: 机にもたれる
to lean on one's desk
机にもたれて居眠りをしておった
He was leaning on his desk and dozing―dozing on his desk.
壁にもたれる
to lean against the wall
壁にもたれて日向ぼっこ
He is basking in the sun with his back against the wall.
欄干にもたれる
to lean on the balustrade
杖にもたれる
to lean on one's staff
柱にもたれる
to lean against a post
柱にもたれて思案投げ首
She was leaning against a post, pondering over the difficulty.
長椅子にもたれる
to recline on a couch
椅子にもたれて思案
He leaned back in his chair, lost in thoughts.
人の肩にもたれる
to lean on one's arm

content:
もち〔持ち〕
〈名〉
1. (=持久力)durability; wear

content.content: 持ちが好い
to last long―(衣類なら)―wear well―(飲食物なら)―keep long
西洋造りは日本造りより持ちが好い
A foreign house lasts long―lasts longer than a Japanese.
木船は持ちが好い
A wooden ship lasts long―A wooden ship is durable.
この羅紗は見栄えが無いが持ちが好い
This cloth does not make a good show, but wears well.
日本出来の靴は持ちが悪い
Shoes made in Japan do not wear well.
この酒は持ちが好い
This wine will keep long.
夏の魚は持ちが悪い
Fish do not keep in summer.

content: 2. (=所有)ownership

content.content: この子は衣装持ちです
She has a good wardrobe.
彼は子持ちだ
He is a father―a family man.
彼女は子持ちだ
She is a mother―the mother of many children.
あの人は癇癪持ちだ
He is subject to epileptic fits.
癇癪持ちだ
He is subject to fits of passion―a passionate man.
あの女は癪持ちだ
She is subject to fits of spasm.

content: 3. (=受持ち、担任、負担)charge

content.content: この組は誰の持ちですか
Who is in charge of this class?―In whose charge is this class?
この組は僕の持ちです
The class is in my charge―I am in charge of this class.
自分持ち
at one's own charge―at one's own expense
家の修繕は自分持ちです
I repair the house at my own expense.
汽車賃は自分持ちだ
Each must pay his own railway fare.
費用は先方持ちです
The other party bears the expenses―pays the expenses.
給料は五十円で衣食はこちら持ち
(雇主が言えば)I pay him 50 yen a month and find him in food and clothes―(雇人が言えば)―I get 50 yen a month and find myself (in food and clothes).
給料は五十円で衣食は先方持ち
I get 50 yen a month and found (in food and clothes)
衣食はこちら持ちで彼を雇っておく
We keep him back and belly.

content: 4. (=誰使用)The Possessive Case

content.content: 婦人持ちの日傘
a lady's parasol
男子持ちの時計
a gentleman's watch

content:
もち〔餅〕
〈名〉Rice-cake

content.content: 餅をつく
to pound rice-cake
彼は身代を餅についている
He is unable to manage his property.
餅は餅屋
“Every man to his trade.”

content:
もち〔黐〕
〈名〉Bird-lime

content.content: モチで鳥を刺す
to catch a bird with a lime-stick―lime a bird

content:
もちあい〔持ち合い〕
〈叙述形容詞〉(To be) steady

content.content: 相場は持ち合い
The price is steady.

content:
もちあう〔持ち合う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=釣合を保つ)to maintain the equilibrium

content.content: 相場は持ち合っている
The price is steady.
六十円で持ち合っている
The price holds at 60 yen.

content: 2. (=助け合う)to help each other

content.content: 世の中は持ち合い持たれ合い
Men must depend on each other―“Hand washes hand.”

content:
もちあがる〔持上がる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=持上げられる)to be raised; to be lifted

content.content: この石は重くて持上がらない
The stone is too heavy to be raised.

content: 2. (=起こる)to arise; to come up; to turn up; to happen

content.content: 一つの問題が持ち上がる
A question arise―A question comes up―A question faces us―A question confronts us.
問題が持ち上がっている
A question is up.
今一つ問題が持ち上がった
Another question faces us―We are confronted with another question.
困難な事件が持ち上がった
A difficult matter has arisen.
困った事が持ち上がった
Here's a go―Here's a run go.
何事が持ち上がったらしい
Something seems to have happened.
学校設立の計画が持ち上がっている
A project is on foot for starting a new school.
支那ではまた排日運動が持ち上がっている
Another anti-Japanese movements is on foot in China.
一騒動持ち上がりそうだ
A trouble seems imminent.

content:
もちあぐむ〔持ちあぐむ〕
〈他動〉To be tired of holding

content.content: あの会社の株をもちあぐんでいる者がある
Some people are sick of holding the shares of that company.
この品は皆持ちあぐんでいる
The goods lie heavy on their hands.

content:
もちあげる〔持上げる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=擡げる)to raise; to lift; to heave; to hold up

content.content: 重いものを持ち上げる
to raise a load―life a load―heave a load
頭を持ち上げる
to hold up one's head―(頭角を現すの意味なら)―make a figure―cut a figure―cut a conspicuous figure―make a prominent figure.

content: 2. (=おだてる)to flatter; to extol (one) to the skies

content.content: うんと持上げてやれ
You must extol him to the skies.
そう持上げちゃいやよ
You are too flattering.

content:
もちあつかう〔持扱う〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: もてあます〔持て余す〕

content:
もちあわせ〔持合せ〕
〈名〉Anything in hand; anything on hand; goods in stock:(=る) to have (anything) in hand; to have (anything) on hand; to have (anything) with one; to have (anything) about one:(店になら)to have (goods) in stock

content.content: 御注文の書籍持合せ御座無く候
We do not happen to have on hand the book you order.
君金の持ち合わせがあるか
Have you any money with you?―Have you any money about you?
持ち合わせの金
money in hand―money on hand
品はたくさん持ち合わせがあります
We have a large supply of the goods in stock.
持ち合わせの品
goods in stock―a stock of goods
品の持ち合わせがありません
We are out of the goods―The goods are out stock.

content:
もちいかた〔用い方〕
〈名〉Use; the way to use; how to use

content.content: 前置詞の用い方
the uses of prepositions―how to use prepositions
前置詞の用い方はむずかしい
It is difficult to use prepositions correctly.

content:
もちいる〔用いる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=使う)to use (paper); to employ (money); to put (money) to some use; to make use of (money); to resort to (some means); to have recourse to (some means)

content.content: 日本紙は種々なことに用いる
Japanese paper is used for various purposes―Japanese paper has many uses.
ラクダは乗用に用いる
The camel is used for riding.
犬は猟に用いる
The dog is used in hunting.
いま英語の教科書はどんなのを用いていますか
What are the English text-books now in use?
この教科書はいま一般に用いられいる
This text-book is now in general use.
どこでもこれを用いている
It is in universal use.
この字書は日々用いられている
The dictionary is in daily use.
この本はいま用いられない、用いられなくなった
The book is out of use―It has gone out of use.
僕は便秘して下剤を用いなければならぬ
I am so constipated that I must use cathartics―take purgatives.
金を善く用いる
to make good use of money―put money to a good use
金を悪く用いる
to make bad use of money―put money to a bad use
言葉を用いて誤る
to misuse words
手段を用いる
to resort to some means―have recourse to some means
勧めて聞かなければ他の手段を用いなければならぬ
If persuasion fails, we must resort to some other means―some other means must be resorted to―we must have recourse to some other means―recourse must be had to some other means.
腕力を用いる
to resort to force
どんな物でもそれぞれ用いどころがある
Everything is useful in its place.
人は皆それぞれ用いようがある
Every man is useful in his way.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 南米では何語を用いるか
What language do they speak in South America?
答案にはペンとインキを用いるべし
Write your answers with pen and ink.
兵を用いる
to handle troops
意を用いる
to take care of―be careful of―give attention to―anything
衛生に意を用いる
to be careful of one's health
彼は身なりには意を用いない
He is careless about his appearance.
詳細の点に意を用いなければならぬ
We must give attention to details.

content: 2. (=相応する)to apply (a rule to a case)

content.content: この規則はどんな場合にも用いられる
We can apply the rule to every case―The rule applies to every case―The rule holds true in every case.
この規則の用いられない場合がある
There are cases where this rule does not apply―hold true.

content: 3. (=採用する)to adopt (a method); to follow (one's advice)

content.content: たいがいの先生が新教授法を用いている
Most teachers have adopted the new method.
彼は僕の言を用いた
He followed my advice―acted on my advice.
あの人は人の言を用いない
He gives no heed to advice or warning.

content: 4. (=登用する)to employ (a man)

content.content: 政府では外国人を用いなくなった
The government has ceased to employ foreigners.
人材を用いる
to open offices to talent
彼は英語を知っているから用いられる
His knowledge of English makes him useful.
英語を知っている者が用いられる世の中だ
Those who know English are in great demand―at a premium.
英語を知らぬ者は用いられない
Those who do not know English are not demand―at a discount.
彼の天才は世に用いられなかった
His genius was not appreciated by his contemporaries.
人を重く用いる
to trust a man―give one an important position
彼は社長に重く用いられた
He was trusted by his chief―given a position of trust.

もちおくり〔持送り〕
〈名〉A bracket (of a shelf); a truss (of a roof or a bridge); a corbel, a console (of stone or timber)

もちかえる〔持ち換える〕
〈他動〉To shift (anything) from one hand to the other

content:
もちかえる〔持ち帰る〕
〈他動〉To bring or take (anything) back or home

content.content: 彼はその本を日本へ持ち帰ってこれを広めた
He brought the book home to Japan and caused it to be widely used.

content:
もちかける〔持ち掛ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=接近する)to approach (a man with a proposal); to make advances to (one); to make up to (one)

content.content: 彼は大臣にうまく話を持ちかけた
He approached the Minister adroitly with his proposal.
彼は僕が否と言えないように持ちかけて来た
He made up to me in such a way that I could not refuse him.
哀れっぽく持ちかけて来た
He approached me with an appeal to my heart.

content: 2. (=女が男に持ちかける)to make advances to (a man); to set her cap at (a man); to throw herself at his head

content.content: 女の方から持ちかけた
It was she who made advances to him.
猛烈に持ちかけた
She made fierce love to him―flung herself at his head.
あの女は君に持ちかけているから用心し給え
Have a care! she is setting her cap at you.

content:
もちかた〔持方〕
〈名〉The way to hold; how to hold

content.content: ペンの持ち方が違う
That is not the way to hold your pen.
ペンの持ち方を知らないのか
Don't you know how to hold your pen?
箸の持ち方を教えてお上げ
show him how to hold his chopsticks!
その本の持ち方は逆さまだ
You are holding your book upside down.

content:
もちきたす〔持ち来す〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: もちきたる〔持ち来る〕

もちきたる〔持ち来る〕
〈自動〉To bring; to fetch

content:
もちきる〔持ち切る〕
〈自動〉To do nothing else; to talk of nothing else

content.content: 学校中その話で持ち切っている
They talk of nothing else in the whole school.
全市疑獄の話で持ち切っている
The whole town talks of nothing but the scandal―The scandal is the sole topic in the whole town.
集まると酒で持ち切っている
They do nothing but drink when they come together.
彼の演説は反対党攻撃で持ち切っていた
His speech was a diatribe against the opposite party from beginning to end.
話しは芝居で持ち切っている
The conversation runs upon the play.

もちぐさ〔餅草〕
〈名〉A kind of sage

content:
もちぐされ〔持ち腐れ〕
〈叙述形容詞〉(To be) of no use (to one)

content.content: この正宗は僕には宝の持ち腐れだ
The Masamune blade is of no earthly use to me.
あんな人に金を持たせるのは宝の持ち腐れだ
For such man to possess wealth is being “a dog in the manger”

content:
もちくずす〔持ち崩す〕
〈他動〉(=身を持ち崩す)To ruin oneself; to go to the bad

content.content: 彼は放蕩に身を持ち崩した
He ruined himself by riotous living―He went to the bad.

content:
もちこす〔持ち越す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=越す)to keep over (the winter)

content.content: この梨は冬を持ち越せるか
Will those pears keep over the winter?

content: 2. (=持ち続ける)to hold (anything) over

content.content: その値段で売れなければ相場の上がるまで持ち越そう
If the goods will not sell at the price, I will hold them over for a rise.
品は持ち越して後に売る
The goods will be held over for future disposal.

content: 3. (=繰越す)to bring over (a sum from last year's account); to carry over (a sum to next year's account)

content.content: これは前年より持ち越しの仕事だ
The work is brought over from last year.
仕事の大部分は来年へ持ち越しになりそうだ
The greater part of the work is likely to be carried over to next year.
借金は持ち越す
to let a debt stand over
これは久しく持ち越した借金だ
This is a debt of long standing.
三年来持ち越しの問題だ
It is a question of three years' standing.

content:
もちこたえる〔持ち堪える〕
〈自動〉To hold out; to stand out; to stick out

content.content: 旅順は半年持ちこたえた
Port Arthur held out for six months.
あの銀行もう持ちこたえきれぬ
The bank can not hold out―stand out―any longer.
病人は暑中持ちこたえまい
The invalid can not hold out―last―through the summer.
もつと好い値に売れるまで売らずに持ちこたえておった方がよい
We had better stick out for a better price―stick out for better terms.

content: 〈他動〉To hold out, stand out (a crisis); to hold (a post); to hold on to(goods); to keep up (a falling house); to keep (a dying business) going; to sustain, support, maintain (a difficult part, etc.)

content.content: この危機を持ちこたえれば安心
It we hold out this crisis,―stand out the crisis,―we are sate.
相場の上がるまで品物を持ちこたえよう
I will hold the goods for a rise.
その株はいま暫く売らずに持ちこたえておった方がよい
You had better hold on to the shares a little longer.
店を持ちこたえかねた
They could not keep up their business―keep their business going.
この陣地を持ちこたえるのは困難だ
It is difficult to hold the position.
彼は今の地位が持ちこたえられたらどんな任にも堪えられる
If he can hold his present post,―sustain his present office,―he will be equal to any task.

content:
もちこみ〔持ち込み〕
〈名〉(=持込賃)Portage; porterage; cartage

content.content: 持ち込みを入れて百円になる
It comes to 100 yen, inclusive of cartage.

content:
もちこむ〔持ち込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=入れる)to bring in; to introduce (anything into a place)

content.content: とんでもない教科書を持ち込んだものだ
A pretty text-book they have introduced into the school!

content: 2. (=接近する)to approach (one with a proposal)

content.content: とんだ相談を持ち込まれた
He approached one with a strange proposal.
困ったことを持ち込んできたね
What a nice proposal he makes!
苦情を持ち込む
to lodge a complaint with one

content:
もちだす〔持ち出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=内のものを外へ出す)to take out

content.content: 息子がうちの物を持ち出して売ってしまう
The son sells the household goods.
番頭が店の金を持ち出す
The manager peculates the receipts of the shop.
家は焼いても道具ばかり持ち出せばよかったに
If you could not save the house, you might, at least, have brought away the furniture.

content: 2. (=自腹を切る)to pay out of one's own pocket

content.content: 幹事が会費の不足を持ち出している
The secretary makes up the deficit of the expenses by paying it out of his own pocket.
利益どころかかえって持ち出しだ
So far from being the gainer, I am positively out of pocket.

content: 3. (=分担して出す)to pay each his share

content.content: 資本は会員の持ち出しだ
Each member contributes his share towards the capital.

content: 4. (=言い出す)to broach (a matter); to introduce (a subject); to bring forward (a question)

content.content: とうとうその話を持ち出しかねた
I have been unable to broach the mater―break the ice.
今はそんな問題を持ち出す場合じゃない
This is no time for introducing such a subject.
いったいこの問題を持ち出した人は誰だ
Who an earth is the man who brought forward the question?
このことは会に持ち出すにはまだ早い
It is not yet time to bring the matter before the meeting.

content: 5. (=訴え出る)to bring (a matter) before the court

content.content: この事件は裁判に持ち出さないですましたいものだ
I wish to settle the matter without bringing it before the court―out of court.

もちづき〔望月〕
〈名〉The full moon

content:
もちなおす〔持ち直す〕
〈自動〉To rally; to improve; to recover itself; to recover ground; to be restored; to change for the better; to take a turn for the better; to take a favourable turn

content.content: 病人は持ち直した
The invalid has rallied―His illness has taken a favourable turn―taken a turn for the better.
市場の景気が持ち直した
The market has improved―changed for the better.
人気が持ち直した
The tone of the market has recovered itself.
天気が持ち直した
Fine weather is restored.
土俵際で持ち直す
to recover ground at the last moment

content:
もちにげする〔持ち逃げする〕
〈他動〉To run away with, make off with, abscond with (money, etc.)

content.content: 彼は主人の金を持ち逃げした
He made off with his master's money.

content:
もちぬし〔持主〕
〈名〉The owner (of a house or land); the possessor (of a virtue or a vice); the proprietor (of a hotel or a theatre); the master (of a dog or a cat)

content.content: 遺失品を持ち主へ返す
Lost property is restored to its owner.
彼女は好い声の持ち主だ
She is the possessor of a good voice.
あの旅館の持ち主は誰か
Who is the proprietor of that hotel?
あの旅館は持ち主が変わった
The hotel has changed hands.
あの別荘の持ち主は誰か
To whom does that villa belong?

content:
もちば〔持場〕
〈名〉
1. (=部署)One's post; one's quarters

content.content: 持ち場につく
to go to quarters
持ち場を守る
to hold one's post―stand to one's post
めいめい持ち場を守っている
Each man is at his post.
死を決して持ち場を守れ
Hold your post to the last man!
彼は最後まで持ち場を守った
He stood to his post to the last.
持ち場を守りつつ死ぬ(職に殉す)
to die at one's post

content: 2. (=巡回区)one's beat; one's round:(新聞や牛乳配達などの持ち場)one's walk

content.content: 巡査の持ち場
a policeman's beat―a policeman's round
巡査が持ち場を巡回する
A policeman makes his rounds―goes his rounds.
巡査が持ち場を回っている
The policeman is on his beat.
持ち場の巡査
a policeman on his beat
その問題は持ち場違いだ
The question is out of my beat.

content:
もちはこび〔持ち運び〕
〈名〉Carrying; conveyance; portage

content.content: 持ち運びのできる機械
a portable machine
持ち運びに便利な本
a handy volume
この本は重くて持ち運びに不便だ
The book is unhandy―too heavy to carry about with one.

もちはこぶ〔持ち運ぶ〕
〈他動〉To carry; to convey; to transport

もちぶん〔持分〕
〈名〉
1. (=共同事業の出資の持分)One's share, one's interest (in a joint enterprise)
2. (=出兵などの各国または各地方の持分)a quota; a contingent

content:
もちまえ〔持前〕
〈名〉
1. (=人の天性)(a man's) nature:(=の) natural (love of truth); inherent (nobility of mind); inborn (genius); innate (humour, etc.)

content.content: 気の大きいのはあの人の持ち前だ
Generosity is inherent in his nature.
持ち前だからしかたがない
He can not help his nature.

content: 2. (=物質の性質)a property (of some matter)

content.content: 光るのは金の持ち前だ
Brightness is a property of gold―Brightness inheres in gold.

content: 3. (=特性)a characteristic:(=の) characteristic (of some person or things); peculiar (to some person or thing)

content.content: めいめい持ち前の能を発揮する
Each exhibits a talent characteristic of himself―peculiar to himself.

content: 4. (=持分)one's share; one's holdings

もちまわる〔持ち廻る〕
〈他動〉To take (anything) round; to carry (anything) about

content.content: 彼は原稿を方々持ち回ったけれども売れなかった
He carried his manuscript round everywhere, but no one would buy it.
その地位を方々へ持ち回ったけれども誰も受ける者が無い
The position was offered to many persons in turn, but no one would accept it.

content:
もちもの〔持物〕
〈名〉
1. (=所有物)(one's) property, possessions, belongings, effects, goods, things

content.content: 人の持ち物を自由にすることはできぬ
You can not make free with a man's property.
旅人は持ち物をまきあげられた
The traveller was shorn of his possessions.
死者の持ち物は競売になった
The dead man's effects were sold by auction.

content: 2. (=妾)(some one's) concubine, kept mistress

content.content: あの女優は某富豪の持ち物だ
The actress is a certain millionaire's mistress.

content:
もちゃがる〔持上がる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: もちあがる〔持上がる〕

content:
もちゃげる〔持上げる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: もちあげる〔持上げる〕

content:
もちゅう〔喪中〕
〈形〉(To be) in mourning

content.content: 彼は親の喪中だ
He is in mourning for his father.

content:
もちよう〔持様〕
〈名〉(=気の持様)One's way of thinking; the temper of one's mind

content.content: 人の幸不幸は貧富よりも気の持ちようだ
A man's happiness depends, not so much on his circumstances, as on his way of thinking.
心は持ちよう
Everything depends on the temper of one's mind―“The mind can make a Heaven of Hell, a Hell of Heaven.”
人生は心の持ちようで地獄極楽
Life is what you make it.

content:
もちよる〔持寄る〕
〈自動〉To contribute each his own share

content.content: 宴会は持寄りにしよう
Let each contribute his share of good cheer to the banquet.
二人は持寄世帯で世帯をもった
They began housekeeping, each party contributing his or her share of the furniture.

もちりょう〔持料〕
〈名、形〉(A thing) for one's own use

content:
もちろん〔勿論〕
〈副〉Of course; certainly; to be sure; naturally; no wonder; undoubtedly, no doubt, without doubt, beyond doubt, past all doubt; unquestionably, beyond question, past all question; beyond dispute, past all dispute

content.content: もちろんさ
Of course―There is no doubt about it―That goes without saying.
それはもちろんのことだ
It is a matter of course.
人は権力と富貴があれば他のことはもちろんこれに伴う
It a man possesses power and wealth, the rest will follow as a matter of course.
これはもちろんの事実だ
The fact is beyond doubt―past all doubt―beyond question―past all question―beyond dispute―past all dispute.
あのような人の成功するのはもちろんのことだ
It is quite natural that such a man should succeed―It is no wonder that such a man should succeed.
行くかって、もちろん行くさ
Will I go? To be sure, I will.
私が承諾したのはもちろんのこととおぼしめせ
You may be sure that I consented.
もちろんのことと思う
to take anything for granted
君はもちろんご承諾のことと思って(改めてご相談はしなかった)
I took it for granted that you would consent.
彼は洋行したというからもちろん英語ができることと思った
As he had been abroad, I took it for granted that he knew English.
彼は英語はもちろん仏独もできる
He knows French and German, as well as English―to say nothing of his English―not to speak of his English―not to mention his English―let alone his English.

content:
もつ〔持つ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=所有する)to have:(有形物を持つ)to own (a house, a horse, etc.):(無形物を持つ)to possess, be possessed of (virtue, wealth, etc.):(土地や株を持つ)to hold (land or shares):(いくらの財産を持つ)to be worth (so much):(持つ物により)to be supplied with (money); to be furnished with (capital); to be provided with (needful things); to be blessed with (a good constitution); to be cursed with (a bad temper); to be armed with (repeating rifles); to be equipped with (requisites)

content.content: あの人は金を持っている
He has money―He possesses wealth―He is possessed of wealth.
家作を持っている
He owns houses.
市内に地所を持っている
He owns lands―holds lands―in the city.
百万の財産を持っている
He is worth a million.
会社の株を持っている
He holds shares in the company―He is a shareholder in the company―he has an interest in the company.
彼は好い息子を持っている
He has a good son―He is blessed with a good son―He is happy in his son.
好い細君を持っている
He has a good wife―He is fortunate in his wife.
持つべきものは女房なり
What a blessing a wife is!
親不孝息子を持っている
He has a had son―He is cursed with a bad son―He is unhappy in his son.
悪い細君を持って災難だ
He has a bad wife―He is unfortunate in his wife.
彼は資本をたくさん持っている
He has a large capital―He is furnished with a large capital.
歩兵は連発銃を持っている
The infantry are armed with repeating rifles.
牛は角を持っている
A cow has horns―A cow is armed with horns.
猫は爪を持っている
A cat has nails―A cat in equipped with nails.
あの先生は好い弟子を持った
He has an apt pupil.
あの子は着物を持っている
She has a good wardrobe―She is the owner of a good wardrobe.
彼は一文も持たない
He has not a penny to bless himself with.
あのような人をご亭主に持ちたくないか
Wouldn't you like to have such a man for a husband?
彼は華族を舅に持っている
He has a peer for a father-in-law.
あのような人を友人に持ちたい
I should like to have such a man for a friend.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この本は誰でも持っている、この本を持たぬ者は無い
This book is in everybody's hands.
あなたの無くなした品は私が持っております
The article you have lost is in my possession.
持った病は治らぬ
“The leopard can not change his spots.”
借金は彼の持った病で治らぬ
Running into debt is his besetting sin.
酒は持った病で止められぬ
He is an inveterate drunkard.
タバコは持った病で止められぬ
He is an inveterate smoker.
嘘をつくのは持った病で止められぬ
He is an inveterate liar.

content: 2. (=手に持つ)to have (anything) in one's hand; to hold (anything) in one's hand

content.content: 本を手に持ってお読みなさい
Hold the book in your hand!
ペンの持ち方が違う
That is not the way to hold your pen.
道具は柄を持つものだ
You should hold a tool by the handle.
手には何を持っているか
What have you in your hand?
お荷物を持って上げましょう
I will hold your luggage for you.
この傘を持って下さい
Please hold my umbrella for me!

content: 3. (=持ち運ぶ、持って来る、持って行く)to carry; to bring; to take

content.content: お荷物を持ちましょう
I will carry your luggage for you.
その本をここへ持て
Bring me that book!
この手紙を役所へ持て
Take this letter to the office!

content: 4. (=携帯する)to carry (anything) with one; to bring (anything) with one; to take (anything) with one; to have (anything) with one; to have (anything) on one's person; to have (anything) in one's possession; to wear

content.content: あの人はいつも傘を持って歩く
He always carries an umbrella with him.
僕はそんな大金を持って歩きはしない
I do not carry about such big sums of money with me―carry such big sums on my person.
今日は時計を持って来ません
I have not brought my watch with me today.
僕は金時計を持ったことが無い
I never wore a gold watch.
雨が降るといけないから傘をお持ちなさい
Take an umbrella with you, for fear it may rain.
君はここに金を持っているか、金を持ち合わしているか
Have you any money with you?―Have you any money about you?
旅人は大金を持っておった
The traveller had a large sum of money on his person―had a lager sum of money in his possession.

content: 5. (=店などを張る)to keep

content.content: 店を持つ
to keep shop―(は英、米は)―keep store
彼は銀座に店を持っている
He keeps a shop on the Ginza.
家を持つ、世帯を持つ
to keep house―begin housekeeping―set up a house
早く世帯を持ちたい
I wish to begin housekeeping.
下宿住いに飽きたから家を持とうかと思う
I am tired of lodging-house life, and think of keeping house.
あの人は学校を持っている
He has a school―He keeps a school.
あの医者は自分の病院を持っている
He has a hospital of his own.

content: 6. (=馬車などを抱える)to keep

content.content: お父さんは馬車をお持ちですか
Does your father keep a carriage?
自動車を持っております
He keeps a motor-car.

content: 7. (=持ちこたえる)to hold (a post); to hold on to (goods); to keep up (a falling house); to keep (a dying business) going; to support; sustain, maintain (a part or a character)

content.content: 相場の上がるまで品物を持っていよう
I will hold the goods for a rise.
その株はいま暫く売らずに持っていた方がよい
You had better hold on to the shares for a little longer.
彼は店を持ちかねている
He can not keep up his business―keep his business going.
彼は今の地位が持てればどんな職にも堪える
If he can hold his present post―sustain his present office―he will be equal to any task.

content: 8. (=懐く)to hold (an opinion); to bear (one a grudge); to entertain (hopes or fears); to harbour (doubts); to cherish (a desire); to nourish (an ambition); to nurse (ill-feeling, etc.)

content.content: 意見を持つ
to hold an opinion
確信を持つ
to hold a conviction
僕は成功の希望を持っている
I entertain hopes of success.
失敗の懸念を持っている
I entertain fears of failure―entertain apprehensions of failure.
疑いを持っている
I harbour doubts―I have my doubts.
悪感を持つ
to harbour ill-feeling―nurse ill-feeling
僕は不満を持たない
I do not harbour a vexed mood.
大望を持つ
to cherish an ambition―nourish an ambition
人に対して恨みを持つ
to bear one a grudge
君に対して悪意を持たぬ
I bear you no malice―bear you no ill-will.

content: 9. (=受け持つ)to take charge of (a class); to take (a class) under one's charge

content.content: この組は僕が持とう
I will take charge of this class.
あの組は誰が持っているか
Who has charge of that class?―Who is in charge of that class?
五年級は誰が持っているか
In whose charge―Under whose charge―is the Fifth Year Class?
僕が五年級を持っている
I have charge of the Fifth Year Class―I am in charge of the Fifth Year Class.
五年級は僕が持っている
The Fifth Year Class is in my charge―under my charge.
四年の英語は誰が持っているか
Who is in charge of the Fourth Year English?―Who teaches English to the Fourth Year students?
君は五年の英語が持てるか
Can you teach the Fifth Year English?
あの人なら上級を持たせてもよい
You may place him in charge of the higher classes―He can take charge of the higher classes.
物理は誰が持っているか
Who lectures on physics?

content: 10. (=負担する)to bear, stand, pay (the expenses); to pay, foot (the bill)

content.content: 入費は誰が持つか
Who will bear the expenses?
勘定は誰が持つか
Who will pay the bill?―foot the bill?
費用は先方で持つ
The other party will bear the expenses―stand the expenses―pay the expenses.
給料は五十円で衣食はこちらで持つ
I pay him 50 yen a month, and find him in food and clothes.
給料は五十円で衣食は自分で持つ
He gets 50 yen a month, and finds himself (in food and clothes).
給料は五十円で衣食は主人が持つ
50 yen and found.
衣食はこちらで持って雇っておく
We keep him back and belly.
汽車賃はめいめいで持つ
Each must pay his own railway-fare.
入費を半分ずつ持とう
Let us go halves―go shares―in the expenses.

content: 11. (=身を持つ)to conduct oneself (how?)

content.content: あんな色男は身が持てない
It is hard for such an Adonis to keep straight.
女に可愛がられる男は身が持てない
A favourite with the girls can not keep straight.

content:
〈自動〉
1. (=保つ)(建物などなら)to last (long); to endure; to be durable:(着物なら)to wear (well):(食物なら)to keep (long):(貯えなら)to last; to hold:(縄や釘などなら)to hold:(天気なら)to hold

content.content: 西洋造りは日本造りよりよく持つ
A foreign house lasts long―lasts longer than a Japanese.
この家はもう十年は持つ
This house will last another ten years.
木船はよく持つものだ
a wooden ship lasts long―A wooden ship is durable
病人は長くは持つまい
The invalid will not last long―He has not long to live.
この夏中持つまい
He will not last through the summer―live out the summer―survive the summer.
任期間は持つだろう
He will last out his term―live out his term.
油は今夜持つか
Will the oil last through the night?―hold through the night?
薪は冬中持つか
Will the fuel last through the winter?―hold through the winter?
石炭は航海中持つか
Will the coal last through the voyage?
この酒はよく持つ
This wine will keep long.
夏の魚は持たぬ
Fish do not keep in summer.
木で熟した蜜柑は持たぬ
Oranges ripened on the tree do not keep.
この魚は明日まで持つか
Will this fish keep till tomorrow?―keep overnight?
このリンゴは来年まで持つ
These apples will keep over the winter.
この羅紗はよく持つ
This cloth wears well―There is much wear in this stuff.
ここでできた靴はよく持たぬ
Shoes made here do not wear well.
あのような先生は長く持たぬ
Such teachers do not wear well.
この上衣は三年持った
This coat has lasted me three years.
一生持つだろう
It will last me all my life.
この天気が持てばよいが
I wish the weather would hold.
この天気が持てば工事はじきにすむ
If the weather holds, the works will soon be completed.
この風が持てばじきに着く
If the breeze holds, we shall soon be there.
この針は持つか
Will the nail hold?
この縄は持つまい
The rope will not hold.
この綱がよく持った
The rope has held well.

content: 2. (=持ちこたえる)to hold out; to stand out

content.content: 旅順はほとんど一カ年持った
Port Arthur held out for nearly a year.
あの会社はもう持たぬ
The firm can not hold out―stand out―any longer.
病人は夏中持つまい
The invalid can not hold out through the summer―last through the summer―live out the summer―survive the summer.

content: 〈その他〉

content.content: あんなばかがあるからこんな商売も持ったもんだ
Such fools keep the business going.
あの木は柱でやっと持っている
The tree is barely kept standing by a support.
尾張名古屋は城で持つ
The castle makes Nagoya what she is.
世の中は持ちつ持たれつだ
Men must depend on one another―“Hand washes hand.”
女房を持つ
to marry a wife―take a wife―get married
亭主を持つ
to get married―marry a man―be married to a man
味噌汁は腹に持つ
Bean-soup stays the stomach.
米飯は胃に持つ
Rice sits heavy on the stomach.
人の肩を持つ
to side with―take part with―stand up for―take up the cudgel for―espouse the cause of―espouse the quarrel of―support―back up―a man
気を確かに持て
Be of good heart!―Keep a good heart!
根に持つ
to resent an insult
彼は僕に断られたのを根に持っている
He resents my refusal.

content:
もっか〔黙過〕
〈名〉Connivance:(=する) to pass over (anything) in silence; to pass by (a matter) unnoticed; to overlook (a fault); to wink at (a fault); to connive at (an offence, etc.)

content.content: このことは黙過することはできぬ
I can not pass over the matter in silence.
過失を黙過する
to overlook a fault―wink at a fault

content:
もっか〔目下〕
〈副〉Now; at present:(=の) present; existing; of the day; of the hour; of the moment

content.content: 問題は目下詮議中
The matter is (now) under discussion.
彼は目下英語教授に従事している
He is at present engaged in teaching English.
目下の急務である
It is the pressing need of the day―the urgent need of the hour.
目下の状態にてはいかんともすべからず
In the existing state of things,―As matters stand,―nothing can be done.
目下のところではどうとも言えぬ
As matters stand,―As things are,―there is no saying what may happen.［注意］英語にては Tense または熟語にてこれを表わす場合多し。例えば
家は目下修繕中
The house is under repairs.
犯人は目下厳探中
A strict search is being made for the culprit.
船は目下建造中
The ship is under construction.
病人は目下治療中
The invalid is under treatment.
校舎は目下建築中
The school-house is under construction.

content:
もっきょ〔黙許〕
〈名〉Tacit permission; connivance:(=する) to give (one) tacit permission; to allow (one to do something); to connive at (an offence); to wink at (a fault)

content.content: 当局者は犯罪を黙許している
The authorities connive at the offence.
校長が黙許してさしておく
The thing is done by connivance of the principal.
ここを通るのは警察で黙許している
People pass through here by tacit permission of the police.
邸内に入るのは許可はしないが黙許している
I have not permitted them to enter the grounds; I only allow them to do so.
慣れた役人ならこれぐらいの犯則は黙許するところだ
An experienced official would wink at such an offence.

content:
もっけい〔黙契〕
〈名〉A tacit understanding; a tacit agreement; an implied contract:(=する) to make a tacit agreement; to agree by implication

content.content: 僕は君が助力するという黙契で承諾したのだ
I consented on the understanding that you would assist me.
両国間に黙契が成り立ったらしい
A tacit agreement seems to have been arrived at between the two powers.

content:
もっけのさいわい〔勿怪の幸〕
〈名〉An unexpected piece of good luck; a godsend; a windfall

content.content: 君の来たのはもっけの幸いだ
Your coming is a godsend.
この金の入ったのはもっけの幸いだ
The money is a windfall.
僕が行かなかったのはもっけの幸いだ
It is a mercy that I did not go.
助かったのはもっけの幸いだ
I congratulate myself on my escape.

content:
もっこ〔畚〕
〈名〉A straw-basket(for carrying earth)

content.content: 二人でもっこを担ぐ
Two men carry a straw-basket between them.
罪人は病気なのでもっこで担がれて白州へ出た
As the prisoner was ill, he was carried in a straw-basket to the court.
まんまともっこに乗せられた
I was nicely taken in.

content:
もっこう〔木工〕
〈名〉A wood-worker; a carpenter

content.content: 木工術
carpentry

content:
もっこう〔黙考〕
〈名〉Meditation:(=する) to meditate; to commune with oneself

content.content: 沈思黙考している
He is sunk in meditation.

もっこん〔目今〕
〈副〉Now; at present

もっしょくし〔没食子〕
〈名〉A gall-nut

content:
もったい〔勿体〕
〈名〉Importance; consequence

content.content: もったいをつける
to attach importance to―give consequence to―make much of―anything
彼はもったいをつけて容易に言わない
He gives great consequence to the matter, and will not tell it―He disdains to say it.

content:
もったいない〔勿体ない〕
〈形〉
1. (=不敬な)profane (words or actions); blasphemous (words); sacrilegious (action); impious, sinful, wicked, irreverent (conduct)

content.content: そんなことをしてはもったいない
It is a profanation―a sacrilege―to do such a thing.
そんなことを言ってはもったいない
It is a profanity―a blasphemy―to say such a thing.
もったいないことを言うな
What a profanity!―What a blasphemy!
もったいないことをするな
What a profanation!―What a sacrilege!
これほどの幸せをありがたく思わないでは天道様にもったいない
It would be a sin against Heaven―sinful―impious―not to be thankful for so many blessings.
先生のことを悪く言ってはもったいないが
It would be irreverent to speak ill of my teacher, but...
親を使ってはもったいない
It would be sinful―wicked―to order about one's parents.

content: 2. (=善過ぎる、惜しい)(to be) too good for (one); (to be) undeserved; (to be) more than one deserves; (to be) worthy of a better cause

content.content: こんな家に住むのはもったいない
The house is too good for me―It is not for me to live in such a house.
私共があなたと同席するのはもったいない
It is not for us to sit at the same table with you.
彼ら如き者に日本の土を踏ませるのはもったいない
It is not for them to set foot on Japan's sacred soil.
彼にはもったいないような細君だ
She is too good for him―She deserves a better husband―He does not deserve her.
そうお賞めに与ってはもったいない
Such praise is more than I deserve―I do not deserve such praise―I am unworthy of such praise―It is undeserved praise.
彼にはもったいないような地位だ
The position is too good for him.
彼の熱心はあんなことにはもったいないようだ
His zeal is worthy of a better cause.
この口へ茶を入れるはもったいない
“My thirst is worthy of a better cause.”
彼の学識はこんな学校にはもったいない
His attainments are worthy of a better place.
彼を英語の先生にしておくのはもったいない
He deserves a better place than that of a teacher of English.
この芥臭い俗界にはもったいないような潔白な人だ
He is too pure for this dusty world.
あんな社会にはもったいないほど上品な人だ
He is too refined for such vulgar society.

content: 3. (=あたら惜しい)wasteful

content.content: (それを捨てるのですか)まあもったいない
What a waste!
捨てるのはもったいない
It is a waste to throw it away.
人間はもったいない殺生をする
Man is wasteful of life.
君はもったいない金の使い方をする
You have a wasteful way of spending money.
米で酒を造るのはもったいない
It is a sinful waste to make rice into sake.
あんな奴に金をやるのはもったいない
It is a sheer waste of money to give it him―The money is as good as thrown away.

content:
もったいなくも〔勿体なくも〕
〈副〉Graciously:(形容詞に訳せば)august (personage)

content.content: 天はもったいなくも我が祈願を叶わせ給えり
Heaven was graciously pleased to hear my prayer.
もったいなくもこの御方は宮家に渡らせ給う
The august personage you behold his an Imperial prince.

content:
もったいぶる〔勿体振る〕
〈自動〉To assume an air of importance; to assume a pompous air; to assume a consequential air; to give oneself consequence

content.content: 彼はもったいぶっている
He has an air of importance―a consequential air―a pompous air.
もったいぶった人だ
He is a self-important man―a consequential man.
もったいぶって物を言う
He speaks with an air of importance―with a consequential air―with a pompous air.
そんなにもったいぶるなよ
Do not give yourself such consequence!
彼は少しももったいぶらない
He gives himself no consequence―He is quite condescending.
いま一人の方はもったいぶって僕らに物も言わぬ
The other man disdains to speak to us―He will not deign to speak to us―He will not vouchsafe to speak to us.

もったいらしい〔勿体らしい〕
〈形〉Consequential; pompous

content:
もって〔以て〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=道具をもって)with

content.content: 拳銃をもって人を撃つ
to shoot a man with a pistol
牛刀をもって鶏を割く
to cut up a fowl with a cleaver―“crack a nut with a steam-hammer”―“break a butterfly upon the wheel.”

content: 2. (=手段をもって)by; by means of; through (the instrumentality of)

content.content: 書面をもって通知する
to notify by letter
口上をもって知らせる
to inform one by word of mouth
計をもって城を落とす
to reduce a castle by stratagem
代人をもって出席する
to attend a meeting by proxy
思想は言葉をもって言い表わす
Thoughts are expressed by means of words.
新聞をもって意見を発表する
to publish one's views through (the instrumentality of) the press
死者は千をもって数う
The killed were counted by thousands―They were killed by thousands.
恩をもって仇に報いる
to return good for evil
毒をもって毒を制す
“Like-cures like.”

content: 3. (=何の故をもって)because of; on account of; on the ground of; in view of; in consideration of:(接続詞に訳せば)because; as; since; seeing that; now that; in view of the fact that

content.content: 彼は病気の故をもって辞職した
He resigned his post on account of illness―on the ground of failing health.
彼は病気という口実をもって面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me under pretence of illness―on the plea of illness.
彼は外国人なるをもって投票権無し
He has no voice in the matter, since he is a foreigner―seeing that he is a foreigner.
彼は年少のかどをもって無罪になった
He was pardoned in view of his youth―in consideration of his youth.
供給充分なるをもって輸入の必要無し
There is no necessity for importation, in view of the fact that the supply is adequate.
是を以て之を観れば、普天の下、我が国に勝る国無し
In view of this fact,―In this view,―Japan is the first land under the sun.
人をもって言を排せず
“If the counsel be good, it matters not who gives it.”

content: 4. (=何をもって名あり)to be noted, famed, famous, renowned, celebrated (for something)

content.content: 松島は風景をもって名あり
Matsushima is celebrated for its scenery.
彼は博学をもって名あり
He is renowned for his erudition.

content:
5. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 彼は利口でもって決して失錯せぬ
He is prudent, and never commits blunders.
彼は学者でもって経験が有る
He is learned, and experienced as well.
この事実をもって見ても彼の無罪なことは明らかだ
This fact shows that he is innocent.
いかなる手段をもってしても彼は留任を肯せず
Nothing can induce him to stay.
もって珍とすべし
It is quite a curiosity.
書はもって姓名を記すに足る
Cultivate penmanship enough to sign your name.

content:
もってあるく〔持って歩く〕
〈他動〉To carry (anything) with one; to carry about (a book) with one

content.content: 彼はいつも傘を持って歩く
He always carries an umbrella with him.
この本は持って歩くに便利だ
This book is handy to carry about with one.

content:
もってうまれた〔持って生れた〕
〈形〉Inborn; innate

content.content: 彼には持って生まれた詩の才がある
He has an inborn genius for poetry.
持って生まれた読書好きだ
He has an innate taste for reading.
持って生まれた運
one's lot in life
持って生まれた運と諦めろ
You must be contented with your lot.
持って生まれた性分
one's nature
持って生まれた性分だからしかたがない
I can not help my nature.
持って生まれた性分は直らぬ
One can not change one's nature―“The leopard can not change his spots.”
彼の怠けるのは持って生まれた性分だ
His idleness is bred in the bone.

content:
もってくる〔持って来る〕
〈他動〉To bring (one anything); to fetch (one anything); to get (one anything):(携帯の意味なら)to bring (anything) with one

content.content: 帽子を持って来てくれ
Bring me my hat!―Get me my hat!―Fetch me my hat!
今度来る時は馬に一駄もお土産を持って来てやる
The next time I come, I will bring you a horse-load of presents.
今日は時計を持って来ない
I have not brought my watch with me.
水を一杯持って来てくれとおっしゃった
He called for a glass of water―asked for a glass of water.
君は妙な相談を持って来たもんだ
You come to me with a strange proposal.
持って来どころが違う
You come to the wrong shop.

content:
もってこい〔持って来い〕
〈形〉Ideal; the very (man for me); the right (man for the place); just the (thing for me); cut out for (the work); favourable for (the enterprise)

content.content: あのひとならこの仕事にもってこいだ
He is the very man for the work―just the man for the work―cut out for the work.
彼ならこの地位にもってこいだ
He is the very man for the position―the right man for the position―the right man in the right place.
君の細君にはもってこいという婦人だ
She is (just) the wife for you.
あれは教師にはもってこいという人だ
He is cut out for a teacher.
遠足にはもってこいという天気だ
It is just the weather for an excursion―an ideal weather for an excursion.
真暗で夜襲にはもってこいという晩であった
The night was dark and favourable for a night-attack.

content:
もってのほか〔以ての外〕
〈形〉Not to be thought of; out of the question; inconceivable; unreasonable; absurd; preposterous; outrageous; atrocious; outr?

content.content: 辞職などとはもってのほかだ
You must not think of resigning―Resignation is not to be thought of―out of the question―inconceivable.
今時分(この深更に)立つなどとはもってのほかだ
You must not think of starting at this time of night.
僕に謝れなどとはもってのほかだ
I can not think of apologizing―An apology on my part is not to be thought of―out of the question.
百円くれとはもってのほかだ
It is unreasonable of him to demand so much.
あの男が校長とはもってのほかだ
He principal? It is absurd―Just think of his being principal!―The idea of his being principal!
もってのほかの仕打ちだ
His conduct is outrageous―His conduct is outr?.
もってのほかの処置だ
It is an atrocious measure.

content:
もってまわった〔持って廻った〕
〈形〉Roundabout (expression); far-fetched (explanation, etc.)

content.content: ずいぶん持って廻った説明だ
It is rather a far-fetched explanation.
ずいぶん持って廻った言い方だ
It is rather a roundabout way of saying it.

content:
もってゆく〔持って行く〕
〈他動〉To take (anything to some place):(重いものなら)to carry (anything to any place):(携帯の意味なら)to take (anything) with one

content.content: お手紙をどこへ持って行くのですか
Where shall I take you letter?
学校へ持って行け
Take it to the school.
この荷物を Station へ持って行ってくれ
Carry my luggage to the station.
誰か僕の字書を持って行ったね
Somebody has taken my dictionary.
雨が降るといけないから傘を持って行き給え
Take an umbrella with you, for fear it may rain!
苦情の持って行きどころが無い
There is no one to complain to.
彼はいつも話を得意な方へ持って行く
He always leads up to his favourite topic―He always flies off at a tangent to his favourite topic.

content:
もっと
〈形、副〉More:(打ち消しに伴えば)less

content.content: もっと欲しいか
Do you want any more?
もっと下さい
Give me some more!
彼はもっとくれと言って手を出した
He held out his hand for more.
今度の方がもっと好い
The new one is better―much better―still better―It is a change for the better.
今度の方がもっと悪い
The new one is worse―It is a change for the worse.
その人と知ったらもっと注意して見るのだった
If I had known that it was he, I would have looked at him with more attention.
もっと勉強しろ
Work harder!
もっと遊んで行き給え
Can't you stay longer?
もっと行こうじゃないか
Let us go farther!
まだもっと悪いことがある
Worse remains―I have worse to tell.
もっと金のかからない仕方は無いか
Isn't there a less expensive way?―a cheaper way?
もっと骨の折れない仕事があるだろう
There must be less difficult work―easier work.
もっと金になる仕事がある
I can turn my time to better account.

content:
もっとも〔最も〕
〈副〉Most; utmost:(打消に伴えば)least

content.content: この事実が最も大事だ
This fact is most important―of the utmost importance―of the first importance―of the last importance.
最も善い物、最も悪い物
the best thing―the worst thing
正直にするのが最も得策だ
“Honesty is the best policy.”
敵は最も勇敢に戦った
The enemy fought most bravely―with the utmost bravery.
これが最も金のかからない方法だ
This is the least expensive way―the cheapest way.
最も骨の折れない方法を取ろう
Let us adopt the least difficult method―the easiest method.
彼は今が最も得意な時代だ
He is seeing his brightest days.
Victoria 女皇の治世には英国は最も繁栄を極めた
In the reign of Queen Victoria, England was at the summit of her prosperity―at the zenith of her prosperity.
農業は彼の最も好むところである
Farming is his delight.
風月は僕の最も愛するところである
Nature is my joy―a joy to me.

content:
もっとも〔尤も〕
〈形〉
1. (=道理ある)reasonable (demands); just (remark); justifiable (conduct); right (action); true (saying); convincing (argument, etc.)

content.content: これはもっともな要求だ
These are reasonable demands.
それはごもっともなお言葉です
That is a just remark.
もっともな申し分だ
It is a just complaint.
もっともな議論だ
It is a convincing argument.
もっともな仕打だ
Your conduct is justifiable―You are right in doing so―That's right.
仰せごもっとも
You are right―What you say, is true―I admit the truth of your statement―I admit the fact.
仰せごもっともだが
That is all very well, but... (

content: 〈副詞〉を見よ)

content.content: それももっともだ
There is some reason in what you say―There is some truth in that―There is something in that.
日本を東洋の英国というのはもっともだ
Japan is justly called “the English of the East.”
人は境遇の子だと言ったのはもっともだ
It has been well said―truly said―that man is the creature of circumstances.
ご無理ごもっとも
You are always in the right―Yes, it is “very like a whale.”

content: 2. (=何々するのも道理である)may well (do so); to have good reason to (do so); to be justified in (doing so)

content.content: 君がそう言うのももっともだ
You may well say that―You have good reason to say so―You are justified in saying so.
彼が学問を誇るのももっともだ
He may well be proud of his attainments―He has good reason to be proud―It is not without reason that he is proud.
彼は子どもが自慢だが、それももっともだ
He is proud of his boy, and well he may―and with reason.
お腹立ちはごもっとも
You may well be angry―You have good reason to take offence.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=なるほどそうだがしかし)indeed, certainly, to be sure, it is true, it is all very well (but)

content.content: もっとも年はとっているがしかしまだ丈夫だ
Indeed he is old, but he is still strong.
もっとも仕事は安いがしかし楽だから
It is true the work is cheap, but it is light.
もっとも彼は学問はできるが教師には向かない
He is certainly a good scholar, but he is not made for a teacher.
もっとも好い方法に違い無いが実行し難い
It is a good method, to be sure, but it is hard to practise.
もっとも例外はある
There are, indeed, exceptions.
もっとも大したことじゃない
It is, indeed, a trifle.
君の言うこともいちおうもっともだが僕は僕だけの意見がある
What you say, is all very well, but I have my own views on the subject.
仰せ至極御もっともですがそうすると僕はどうなるのですか
That is all very fine, but where do I come in?
あやしまるるのもごもっともだが身に覚えはありません
Appearances are against me, but I am innocent.

content: 2. (=また実際)(and) in fact; (and so) indeed; (as) indeed

content.content: 彼は英語が好きだと言っている、もっともよくできもする
He says he likes English best; and, in fact, he is a good English scholar.
彼はその話は本当だと言った、またもっとも本当だ
He said the story was true; as indeed, it is―and so, indeed, it is.

content: 3. (=但し)only:(接続詞に訳せば)though; however

content.content: 彼は約束はする、もっとも履行はしないが
He will make promises, only he never keeps them―He makes promises, though he never keeps them.
彼は学問もできる、もっとも教師じゃないが
He is a good scholar, only he is not a good teacher―He is a good scholar, though he is not a good teacher.
彼は善い人だ、もっとも人は善過ぎるが
He is a good man, only he is too good-natured.
もっとも例外はあるが
There are exceptions, however―There are exceptions, though.

content:
もっともらしい〔尤もらしい〕
〈形〉Plausible (excuse); specious (tale); glossy (pretence); serious (look); grave (face, etc.)

content.content: もっともらしい言い訳だ
It is plausible excuse.
もっともらしい議論だ
It is a plausible argument―a specious argument.
もっともらしい話だ
It is a plausible story―a specious tale.
彼はもっともらしい口実を設けて断わった
He refused on some plausible pretence―on some specious pretext―on soma glossy plea.
彼の言うことにはもっともらしいところがある
His statement has a show of reason in it.
彼はもっともらしい顔をしている
He looks serious―He has a serious look.
彼はもっともらしい顔をしてそう言った
He seriously said so―He gravely said so.
彼は神が無いということをもっともらしく論じている
He argues with great plausibility that there is no God.

content:
もっぱら〔専ら〕
〈副〉
1. (=専心)devotedly

content.content: 職を辞して専ら著述に従事している
He has resigned his post, and devotes himself to literary work.
専ら英語研究に日を暮らしている
He devotes his time to the study of English.
専ら教育事業に一生を送った
He devoted his life to educational work.
専ら蚕業に従事している村がある
Some villages are devoted to sericulture.

content: 2. (=専門に)as a specialty

content.content: 彼は洋行中専ら英語を研究した
While abroad, he made a specialty of English.

content: 3. (=全く)wholly; entirely; exclusively

content.content: 彼は専ら読書に日を暮らしている
Reading is his exclusive occupation―He devotes his time to reading.

content: 4. (=主として)chiefly; principally

content.content: 材料の供給は専ら米国に仰いでいる
We chiefly depend on America for supply of the material.
彼は専ら局に当たっている
He has charge of the affair.

content: 5. (=恣に)arbitrarily; despotically

content.content: 政{まつりごと}を専らにする
to rule arbitrarily―rule despotically―to be arbitrary―despotic

content:
もつれ〔縺れ〕
〈名〉
1. Tangle; entanglement:(=る) to get entangled; to get ravelled; to ravel

content.content: 釣糸がもつれて解けない
The fishing-line has got entangled and can not be unravelled.
縄がもつれている
The ropes are entangled―in a tangle.
もつれた髪
matted hair
もつれを解く
to disentangle―unravel

content: 2. (=紛紜{ふんうん})a complication; an imbroglio; troubles:(=る) to be complicated

content.content: もつれが生じた
Complications have arisen―Troubles have arisen.
関係がもつれている
The relation is complicated.
事件がもつれている
The affair is in a tangle.

content:
もてあそびもの〔弄び物〕
〈名〉A plaything; a toy

content.content: 女をもてあそびものにする人がある
Some people make a plaything of woman―treat woman as a toy.
僕は女をもてあそびものとは思わぬ
I do not regard woman as a toy.

content:
もてあそぶ〔弄ぶ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=玩弄する)to play with (a toy); to toy with (anything)

content.content: 刃物をもてあそんではいかん
It is ill playing with edged tools.
女をもてあそぶ
to toy with a girl―dally with a woman―handle a girl

content: 2. (=翻弄する)to trifle with, play with, sport with, play fast and loose with (a girl's feelings); to flirt with, coquette with, make a fool of, fool (a man); to play on (one's feelings); to trifle with, palter with, fribble with (sacred things); to flirt with (a party); to toss about (a ship)

content.content: 人の感情をもてあそぶ
to play on one's feelings
(男が)女の感情をもてあそぶ
to trifle with a girl's feelings―trifle with a female heart
私はあの方にもてあそばれました
He has trifled with my feelings.
(女が)男をもてあそぶ
to make a fool of a man―flirt with a man―coquette with a man
男をもてあそびほうだいもてあそぶ
to fool a man to the top of his bent
僕は女にもてあそばれた
I have been made a fool of.
女を弄ぶ男
a libertine
男をもてあそぶ女
a coquette―a flirt
婦人の貞操をもてあそぶ
to trifle with a woman's virtue
法律をもてあそぶ
to palter with the law
運命にもてあそばれる
to be the sport of fortune
船が波にもてあそばれる
A ship is tossed about by the sea.
人にもてあそばれるな
Do not suffer yourself to be played with!

content: 3. (=玩愛する)to practise (art) as a recreation

content.content: 音楽をもてあそぶ
to practise music as a recreation
文筆をもてあそぶ
to write for pleasure―scribble for pleasure
兵をもてあそぶ
to wage war for war's sake
学問をもてあそぶ
to love learning for learning's sake
色をもてあそぶ
to indulge in sensual pleasures

もてあましもの〔持て余し者〕
〈名〉A scapegrace; a scamp

content:
もてあます〔持て余す〕
〈他動〉Not to know what to do with (anything); to have (too many) on one's hands

content.content: 彼は(用が無くて)身体を持て余している
He does not know what to do with himself.
僕は相手を持て余した
I don't know what to do with my man―I can do nothing with my man―I can not deal with my man.
僕は仕事が多くて持て余している
I have many tasks on my hands.
彼は品物が売れなくて持て余している
The goods lie heavily on his hands.
品物が売れ残って持て余している
He has the goods left (unsold) on his hands.
この仕事を持て余している
I can not manage this work.
彼は大きな舟を一人で持て余していた
He could not manage the large boat by himself.
皆問題を持て余している
No one can tackle the problem.
彼は金が使いきれなくて持て余している
He has more money than he can spend.
牝鶏の生む卵が食いきれなくて持て余している
The hens lay more eggs than we can consume.
彼は子どもが多くて持て余している
He has more children than he can care for.
子どもが手におえないので持て余している
He finds his children getting out of hand.
あの男は持て余した
He is too much for me―one too many for me.

content:
もてかた〔持て方〕
〈名〉Reception; popularity

content.content: 彼は学生間にたいそうなもて方だ
He is very popular with the students.
顔役はもて方が違う
His position as leader makes a difference in his reception.

content:
もてなし〔持て成し〕
〈名〉
1. (=取扱い)treatment; reception:(旅館などのもてなし)service; accommodation

content.content: 彼はもてなしが悪いと怒ってしまう
He will take it in dudgeon if he is not properly treated―slightly treated―coldly received.
人の地位相応のもてなしをする
to do one the honour due to one's rank―do one due honour
あの旅館はもてなしが好い
You are well served at that hotel―The hotel provides good accommodation.

content: 2. (=款待、饗応)attentions; welcome; hospitality; entertainment; f?te

content.content: あそこの主人はもてなしが好い
He is a hospitable host―a good host―He keeps a good table―keeps a good house.
僕らは手厚いもてなしを受けた
We were accorded a hearty welcome―a cordial reception―a warm hospitality.
たいそうなもてなしであった
It was a royal entertainment―a grand f?te―a capital dinner.
家人は珍客に対して心尽しのもてなしをした
The family were assiduous in their attentions to their honoured guest.
下へも置かぬもてなしぶり
They were assiduous in their attentions to him―They paid him sedulous attentions.

content:
もてなす〔持て成す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=取扱う)to treat (one properly or improperly); to receive (one warmly or coldly)

content.content: 彼は粗末にもてなされたと思うと怒ってしまう
He will take it in dudgeon if he fancies himself to be slightly treated―coldly received.
地位相応に人をもてなす
to do one the honour due to one's rank―do one due honour

content: 2. (=款待する、饗応する)to welcome (one); to make (one); welcome; to show (one) hospitality; to show (one) attentions; to f?te (one); to entertain (one at dinner―one with music); to regale (one with wine); to treat (one to good things); to make much of (one); to make a lion of, lionize (one)

content.content: あの人は客を好くもてなす
He is a hospitable host―a good host―He keeps a good table―keeps a good house.
酒肴をととのえてもてなしてくれた
He regaled us with wine―treated us to a repast.
音楽やら踊りやらでもてなされた
We were entertained with music and dancing.
一行は到るところで厚くもてなされた
The party was welcomed―f?ted―lionized―made lions of―made much of―wherever they went.
篤くもてなす
to give one a cordial reception―accord one a hearty welcome―accord one a warm hospitality
村長の家に泊められて手厚くもてなされた
I stayed with the headman of the village, who was very hospitable to me―who accorded me a warm hospitality.
家人は心を尽して珍客をもてなした
The family were assiduous in their attentions to their honoured guest―The family paid sedulous attentions to their honoured guest.

content:
もてはやす〔持て囃す〕
〈他動〉To make much of, think much of (a man); to make a lion of, lionize (a man); to make a hero of, heroify (a man); to make an idol of, idolize (a man); to welcome, hail (anything as something); to praise; to esteem; to value

content.content: 先生は田舎へ行ってももてやはされている
He is made much of in the provinces.
あの先生はどこが好いとてあのようにもてはやされるのか
What is there in him, that he should be made so much of?
大将はロンドンでたいそうもてはやされた
The general was made a lion of―lionized―in London.
世間では彼をやんやともてはやしている
People sing his praises―They are loud in his praises―warm in his praises.
彼女は交際界でもてはやされている
She is much run after―much sought after―in society.
彼は文壇の驍将{ぎょうしょう}としてもてはやされている
He is much esteemed as a lion of the literary world.
この発明は人類への賜物として大いにもてはやされている
The invention is welcomed as―hailed as―a boon to humanity.
彼は音楽の天才として世界中にもてはやされた
He was universally lionized as―hailed as―a musical genius.

content:
もてる〔持てる〕
〈自他動〉To be welcomed; to be made much of; to be made a lion of; to be lionized; to get on well with (the ladies); to succeed with (women); to be popular with (students); to be a favourite with (the ladies)

content.content: あれでも田舎へ行けばもてる
He will be made much of in the provinces.
彼は到るところで大もてだ
He is welcomed―lionized―wherever he goes.
君は女にもてるか
How do you get on with the ladies?―How do you succeed with women?
あれは女にもてる男だ
He is a favourite with the ladies―a lady's man.
僕は女にもてない
I am no favourite with the ladies.
あの先生は生徒にもてるか
How does he get on with the boys?
生徒に大もてだ
He is a great favourite with the boys―very popular with the students―very much liked by the boys.
生徒にあまりもてない
He is no great favourite with the boys―not very popular with the student―not much liked by the boys.
もてる客
a welcome guest―a man welcome as the flower in May
もてない客
an unwelcome guest―a man welcome as the snow in harvest
今夜はばかにもてる
Fortune smiles on me―Venus shines on me―tonight.
おう八や、昨夜の女はもてたかい
Well, Hachi, how did you get on with your partner last night?
大持てよ
Oh, famously!―I should rather think so―Yes, rather.
たいそう話しがもてますね
You are getting on very well together―getting on famously together.
話しがもてなくなる
The talk flags―The talk begins to flag.

content:
もと〔下、許〕
〈前置詞相当〉→『

content.content: もとに〔下に〕
もとに〔許に〕

content:
もと〔下、許〕
〈前置詞相当〉→『

content.content: もとに〔下に〕
もとに〔許に〕

content:
もと〔旧〕
〈名〉Old times; former times:(=の) old; former; original:(=は) in former times; formerly; once:(動詞に訳せば)used to (do so)

content.content: もとはこうでなかった
It was formerly not so―It used to be otherwise.
僕はもとは本郷に居たが今は神田に居る
I used to live in Hongo, but I now live in Kanda.
もとはこの新聞をとったが今は取らぬ
I used to take this paper, but not now.
彼はもとの東京府知事だ
He is the former governor of Tokyo―the ex-governor of Tokyo.
あれは僕のもとの主人だ
He is my old master―my former master.
あの人はもとの校長だ
He is our former principal.
僕はもとの校長の時に入学したのだ
I entered the school in the former principal's time.
もとに帰る
to return to the former state―(旧にかえって悪くなれば)―relapse into the former state
もとに復す、もとの通りになる
to be restored to its original state―restored to its former condition
僕も追々もとの身体に復すだろうと思う
I hope I shall be restored to health in time.
花は培養しないともとの雑草に返る
Flowers, if left uncultivated, degenerate into weeds.
もとの通りにする
to restore anything to its former condition
もとの通りにして返せ
You must restore it to its former condition―(女なら)―restore her to her former purity.
もとの通りだ
It is what it was―as it was―as of old.
彼はもとの通りだ
He is what he was―as he was―as of old.
もとの通り丈夫だ
He is as strong as he used to be―as strong as of old―as strong as ever.
もとの通り親切だ
He is as kind as of old―as kind as ever.
この船は直せばもとの通りになりますか
If the ship is repaired, will she be what she was?―as good as ever?
もとよりも好くなる
She will be better than ever.
今の日本はもとの日本じゃない
Japan is not what she was.
親父も老いた、もとの親父でない
My father has grown old. He is not what he used to be.
もとのままにしておけ
Leave it as it was―Leave it as you found it.
もとあった所へ置け
Leave it where it was―Leave it where you found it.
本をもとの所へ置け
Put the book back (in its place)―Replace the book in its place.
もとの位置に置け
Put it in place―Place it in position.
もとの位置に返る
to get into place―get into position
手を放すともとの位置に跳ね返る
If you let it go, it will spring back into place.
もとの席に就く
to resume one's seat
もとの職に復す
to resume one's office
もとへ引返す
to retrace one's steps―retrace one's way―double on one's tracks
彼はもとのおもかげが無い
He is the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was―the shadow of his former self.
家は新しくなってもとのおもかげが無い
You do not recognize the old house.
もとから
always
宅ではもとから東京です
We have always lived in Tokyo.
あの人はもとから知っている
I have always know him.
あの人はもとから貧乏だ
He has always been poor.
僕はもとから酒を飲みません
I have always abstained from wine―I never drank wine.

content:
もと〔故〕
〈形〉The deceased; the late

content.content: もとの主人
the deceased master―the late master
もとの夫
my late lamented

content:
もと〔本、元、原、基〕
〈名〉
1. (=起原)the beginning; the rise; the origin; the source; the cause; the root; the bottom; the author (of one's being)

content.content: 彼の病気は酒がもと
Wine is the cause of his illness―Wine is at the bottom of his illness―Wine is at the root of his illness.
この習慣のもとは仏教
The custom originated in Buddhism.
紛議のもとは人種的偏見
The troubles arose from racial prejudice.
けんかのもとは冗談
The quarrel began in a joke―The joke ended in a quarrel.
失敗のもとは不注意
His failure is due to carelessness―attributable to carelessness―Carelessness is the cause of his failure―responsible for his failure.
失敗は成功のもと
Failure is the way to success.
父母は我が身のもと
Our parents are the authors of our being.
人間はもとは動物
Man is originally an animal.
上野公園はもとは寺院の境内であった
Ueno Park was originally temple precincts.
家はもとの通り、もとのままになっている
The house remains standing―as it was.
親父はもとの親父でない
He is not what he was―not what he used to be.
もとほど丈夫でない
He is not so strong as he was―not so strong as he used to be.
拾った財布をもとの所へ置け
Leave the purse where you found it.
用がすんだら本をもとの所へ置く
Put the book back when you have done with it.
日光はもとのとおりになった
Nikko has been restored to its original state.
生兵法は大傷のもと
“A little learning is a dangerous thing.”
痩せても枯れてももとがもと
“It is not in gold to be oxydized.”
釣合わぬは不縁のもと
“Unequal marriages are seldom happy.”
もとをただす
to inquire into the origin―go to the root of the matter
もとをただせば(嘘も人情)
When you go to the root of the matter, falsehood is but a part of human nature.
人間はもとをただせば動物
Man is originally an animal.
この習慣はもとをただせば仏教
The custom originated in Buddhism―takes its rise in Buddhism―derives its origin from Buddhism―The custom is derived from Buddhism―to be traced to Buddhism.
もとをただせば深い仲
They were lovers once.
もとの鞘に納める
to reinstate a divorced wife―take her back to one's bosom
もとの鞘に納まる
A divorced wife is reinstated―She is taken back to his bosom.
［号令］元へ(!)
Begin again!―As you were!

content: 2. (=もとい)the basis; the foundation

content.content: 家は国の基
The family is the basis of the state.
農は国家の基
Agriculture is the foundation of the state.
知識の基は経験
Knowledge rests on experience.

content: 3. (=元手)capital

content.content: 元無しじゃなにもできない
One can do nothing without capital.
元を掛ける、元を下ろす
to invest capital in some enterprise―sink capital in some business―put money in some business
この商売は元がかかっている
The business is a heavy investment.
君の身体は元がかかっている
You have cost your father much.

content: 4. (=原価)the cost-price

content.content: 品物は元がかかる
The goods cost much.
元で売る
to sell at cost
それでは元が切れます
That would not cover the cost―That would be below the cost-price.
元が取れりゃよい
I shall be content to recover the cost.
それじゃ元が取れない
Then I shall be unable to recover the cost.

content: 5. (=元金)the principal

content.content: そうなると元も子も取れなくなる
Then all is lost.
金利が高いと元も子も無くなす憂いがある
If the interest is too high, you run the risk of losing both principal and interest.

content: 6. (=原料)raw materials

content.content: もとが好いから品物が高い
The goods are expensive for they are made from good materials.
この薬はもとは何だ
What is this medicine made from?―prepared from?
味の素
a seasoning powder

content: 7. (=素性)one's origin; one's birth

content.content: あれはもとをただせば賤しい人間だ
He is a man of low origin.
彼はもとはドイツ人で米国へ帰化したのだ
He is a German by birth, and has been naturalized in the United States.
夫人はもとは泥水を飲んだ奴だ
His wife once lived a life of shame.
彼の身代はもとを洗えば只取った金だ(泥棒の身代)
His fortune originally cost him no labour.

content:
8. 
〈草木の助数詞〉

content.content: ひと本の菊
a chrysanthemum

content: 〈副〉(=原来)originally; formerly; once:(動詞に訳して)used to (do something)

content.content: 学校はもとは微々たるものであった
The school was originally a petty affair.
彼はもと旗本であった
He was formerly a banneret.
もと町奉行を勤めた人だ
He once held the office of magistrate.
僕はもとここに居た
I used to live here.

content:
もと〔本、元、原、基〕
〈名〉
1. (=起原)the beginning; the rise; the origin; the source; the cause; the root; the bottom; the author (of one's being)

content.content: 彼の病気は酒がもと
Wine is the cause of his illness―Wine is at the bottom of his illness―Wine is at the root of his illness.
この習慣のもとは仏教
The custom originated in Buddhism.
紛議のもとは人種的偏見
The troubles arose from racial prejudice.
けんかのもとは冗談
The quarrel began in a joke―The joke ended in a quarrel.
失敗のもとは不注意
His failure is due to carelessness―attributable to carelessness―Carelessness is the cause of his failure―responsible for his failure.
失敗は成功のもと
Failure is the way to success.
父母は我が身のもと
Our parents are the authors of our being.
人間はもとは動物
Man is originally an animal.
上野公園はもとは寺院の境内であった
Ueno Park was originally temple precincts.
家はもとの通り、もとのままになっている
The house remains standing―as it was.
親父はもとの親父でない
He is not what he was―not what he used to be.
もとほど丈夫でない
He is not so strong as he was―not so strong as he used to be.
拾った財布をもとの所へ置け
Leave the purse where you found it.
用がすんだら本をもとの所へ置く
Put the book back when you have done with it.
日光はもとのとおりになった
Nikko has been restored to its original state.
生兵法は大傷のもと
“A little learning is a dangerous thing.”
痩せても枯れてももとがもと
“It is not in gold to be oxydized.”
釣合わぬは不縁のもと
“Unequal marriages are seldom happy.”
もとをただす
to inquire into the origin―go to the root of the matter
もとをただせば(嘘も人情)
When you go to the root of the matter, falsehood is but a part of human nature.
人間はもとをただせば動物
Man is originally an animal.
この習慣はもとをただせば仏教
The custom originated in Buddhism―takes its rise in Buddhism―derives its origin from Buddhism―The custom is derived from Buddhism―to be traced to Buddhism.
もとをただせば深い仲
They were lovers once.
もとの鞘に納める
to reinstate a divorced wife―take her back to one's bosom
もとの鞘に納まる
A divorced wife is reinstated―She is taken back to his bosom.
［号令］元へ(!)
Begin again!―As you were!

content: 2. (=もとい)the basis; the foundation

content.content: 家は国の基
The family is the basis of the state.
農は国家の基
Agriculture is the foundation of the state.
知識の基は経験
Knowledge rests on experience.

content: 3. (=元手)capital

content.content: 元無しじゃなにもできない
One can do nothing without capital.
元を掛ける、元を下ろす
to invest capital in some enterprise―sink capital in some business―put money in some business
この商売は元がかかっている
The business is a heavy investment.
君の身体は元がかかっている
You have cost your father much.

content: 4. (=原価)the cost-price

content.content: 品物は元がかかる
The goods cost much.
元で売る
to sell at cost
それでは元が切れます
That would not cover the cost―That would be below the cost-price.
元が取れりゃよい
I shall be content to recover the cost.
それじゃ元が取れない
Then I shall be unable to recover the cost.

content: 5. (=元金)the principal

content.content: そうなると元も子も取れなくなる
Then all is lost.
金利が高いと元も子も無くなす憂いがある
If the interest is too high, you run the risk of losing both principal and interest.

content: 6. (=原料)raw materials

content.content: もとが好いから品物が高い
The goods are expensive for they are made from good materials.
この薬はもとは何だ
What is this medicine made from?―prepared from?
味の素
a seasoning powder

content: 7. (=素性)one's origin; one's birth

content.content: あれはもとをただせば賤しい人間だ
He is a man of low origin.
彼はもとはドイツ人で米国へ帰化したのだ
He is a German by birth, and has been naturalized in the United States.
夫人はもとは泥水を飲んだ奴だ
His wife once lived a life of shame.
彼の身代はもとを洗えば只取った金だ(泥棒の身代)
His fortune originally cost him no labour.

content:
8. 
〈草木の助数詞〉

content.content: ひと本の菊
a chrysanthemum

content: 〈副〉(=原来)originally; formerly; once:(動詞に訳して)used to (do something)

content.content: 学校はもとは微々たるものであった
The school was originally a petty affair.
彼はもと旗本であった
He was formerly a banneret.
もと町奉行を勤めた人だ
He once held the office of magistrate.
僕はもとここに居た
I used to live here.

content:
もと〔本、元、原、基〕
〈名〉
1. (=起原)the beginning; the rise; the origin; the source; the cause; the root; the bottom; the author (of one's being)

content.content: 彼の病気は酒がもと
Wine is the cause of his illness―Wine is at the bottom of his illness―Wine is at the root of his illness.
この習慣のもとは仏教
The custom originated in Buddhism.
紛議のもとは人種的偏見
The troubles arose from racial prejudice.
けんかのもとは冗談
The quarrel began in a joke―The joke ended in a quarrel.
失敗のもとは不注意
His failure is due to carelessness―attributable to carelessness―Carelessness is the cause of his failure―responsible for his failure.
失敗は成功のもと
Failure is the way to success.
父母は我が身のもと
Our parents are the authors of our being.
人間はもとは動物
Man is originally an animal.
上野公園はもとは寺院の境内であった
Ueno Park was originally temple precincts.
家はもとの通り、もとのままになっている
The house remains standing―as it was.
親父はもとの親父でない
He is not what he was―not what he used to be.
もとほど丈夫でない
He is not so strong as he was―not so strong as he used to be.
拾った財布をもとの所へ置け
Leave the purse where you found it.
用がすんだら本をもとの所へ置く
Put the book back when you have done with it.
日光はもとのとおりになった
Nikko has been restored to its original state.
生兵法は大傷のもと
“A little learning is a dangerous thing.”
痩せても枯れてももとがもと
“It is not in gold to be oxydized.”
釣合わぬは不縁のもと
“Unequal marriages are seldom happy.”
もとをただす
to inquire into the origin―go to the root of the matter
もとをただせば(嘘も人情)
When you go to the root of the matter, falsehood is but a part of human nature.
人間はもとをただせば動物
Man is originally an animal.
この習慣はもとをただせば仏教
The custom originated in Buddhism―takes its rise in Buddhism―derives its origin from Buddhism―The custom is derived from Buddhism―to be traced to Buddhism.
もとをただせば深い仲
They were lovers once.
もとの鞘に納める
to reinstate a divorced wife―take her back to one's bosom
もとの鞘に納まる
A divorced wife is reinstated―She is taken back to his bosom.
［号令］元へ(!)
Begin again!―As you were!

content: 2. (=もとい)the basis; the foundation

content.content: 家は国の基
The family is the basis of the state.
農は国家の基
Agriculture is the foundation of the state.
知識の基は経験
Knowledge rests on experience.

content: 3. (=元手)capital

content.content: 元無しじゃなにもできない
One can do nothing without capital.

to invest capital in some enterprise―sink capital in some business―put money in some business
この商売は元がかかっている

You have cost your father much.

content: 4. (=原価)the cost-price

content.content: 品物は元がかかる
The goods cost much.
元で売る
to sell at cost
それでは元が切れます
That would not cover the cost―That would be below the cost-price.
元が取れりゃよい
I shall be content to recover the cost.
それじゃ元が取れない
Then I shall be unable to recover the cost.

content: 5. (=元金)the principal

content.content: そうなると元も子も取れなくなる
Then all is lost.
金利が高いと元も子も無くなす憂いがある
If the interest is too high, you run the risk of losing both principal and interest.

味の素
a seasoning powder

もとの鞘に納まる

Begin again!―As you were!

content.content: 家は国の基
The family is the basis of the state.
農は国家の基
Agriculture is the foundation of the state.

Knowledge rests on experience.

content.content: 元無しじゃなにもできない

to invest capital in some enterprise―sink capital in some business―put money in some business

content.content: 品物は元がかかる

to sell at cost

content.content: そうなると元も子も取れなくなる
Then all is lost.
