content.content: もとが好いから品物が高い
The goods are expensive for they are made from good materials.
この薬はもとは何だ
What is this medicine made from?―prepared from?
味の素
a seasoning powder

content: 7. (=素性)one's origin; one's birth

content.content: あれはもとをただせば賤しい人間だ
He is a man of low origin.
彼はもとはドイツ人で米国へ帰化したのだ
He is a German by birth, and has been naturalized in the United States.
夫人はもとは泥水を飲んだ奴だ
His wife once lived a life of shame.
彼の身代はもとを洗えば只取った金だ(泥棒の身代)
His fortune originally cost him no labour.

content:
8. 
〈草木の助数詞〉

content.content: ひと本の菊
a chrysanthemum

content: 〈副〉(=原来)originally; formerly; once:(動詞に訳して)used to (do something)

content.content: 学校はもとは微々たるものであった
The school was originally a petty affair.
彼はもと旗本であった
He was formerly a banneret.
もと町奉行を勤めた人だ
He once held the office of magistrate.
僕はもとここに居た
I used to live here.

content:
もとい〔基〕
〈名〉The basis (of one's argument); the foundation (of a state); the ground (of belief); the root (of evil); the origin; the source; the cause:(=する) to be based on (premises); to be founded on (fact); to be grounded on (conviction); to rest on (experience); to originate in (some cause); to arise from (some cause); to result from (some cause); to be due to owing to, attributable to (some cause)

content.content: 孝は百行の基い
Filial piety is the foundation of all virtues―(に相当するは)―“The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom.”
利慾は諸悪の基い
“The love of money is the root of all evil.”
およそ知識は経験に基いす
All knowledge rests on experience.
彼の多読は大成の基いとなった
His extensive reading was the foundation of his greatness.
彼の大成は博覧に基いす
His greatness is founded on extensive reading.
排日運動は人種的偏見に基いする
The anti-Japanese movement originates in―arises from―results from―racial prejudice.
彼の成功は勉強に基す(彼の勉強は成功の基い)
His success is all owing to―due to―attributable to―his industry.
失敗は成功の基い
Failure is the way to success.

content:
もどかしい
〈形〉
1. ［主観的］(I am)impatient at (the slowness)

content.content: 成績発表がもどかしい
I am impatient at the late publication of the results―I am impatient to know the result of my examination.
あの時は時間の経つのがもどかしかった
I was impatient for the time to pass.

content: 2. ［客観的］Slow; tardy

content.content: 忙しい用があると汽車が走るのがもどかしいようだ
When one has urgent business, the train seems to go too slow.
年をとると子どもの成長がもどかしくなる
When one grows old, the growth of the children seems tardy.

content:
もどかしがる
〈自他動〉To lose one's patience; to be impatient at (one's slowness)

content.content: 彼はもどかしがってはたから口を出した
He lost his patience, and interposed.
皆成績発表をもどかしがっている
They are impatient at the late publication of the results―impatient to know the result of examination.
そうもどかしがるな
Be patient!―Have patience!
人をもどかしがらせる
to keep one in suspense

もとかた〔元方〕
〈名〉
1. (=製造元)the manufacture; the producer; the maker
2. (=問屋)a wholesale merchant; a wholesale dealer

content:
もとから〔旧から〕
〈副〉Always (with the Perfect Tense of Continuance)

content.content: 宅ではもとから東京です
We have always lived in Tokyo.
あの人はもとから貧乏だ
He has always been poor.
あの人はもとから知っている
I have always known him.
僕はもとから酒を飲まない
I have always abstained from wine―I never drank wine.

content:
もとき〔本木〕
〈名〉
1. The original stock
2. (=初恋)one's first love

content.content: 本木に勝るうら木無し
One will return to one's first love.

もときん〔元金〕
〈名〉
1. (=元手)Capital
2. (=利子に対する元金)the principal

content:
もとごめ〔元込め〕
〈形〉Breech-loading

content.content: 元込め銃
a breech-loading gun―a breech-loader

content:
もどす〔戻す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=返す)to return, give back, send back (anything to a person); to restore (lost property to its owner); to refund (money)

content.content: 拾い物を落とし主へ戻した
I restored the lost property to its owner.
女房を親もとへ戻す
to send back one's wife to her parents
仕事を戻された
I had my work returned on my hands.
品物がお気に入らなけりゃ代金をお戻し致します
If you are not pleased with the article, I shall refund your money.

content: 2. (=元へ戻す)to restore (anything to its former state)

content.content: こわれ物を元に戻す
to restore a broken article
もとあった所へ戻しておけ
Leave it where it was!
縒りを戻す
to untwist a rope
舵を戻せ
Ease the helm!

content: 3. (=後へ戻す)to put back; to turn back

content.content: 時計を十分戻せ
Put back the watch―Turn back the clock―ten minutes.

content: 4. (=却下する)to reject

content.content: 願書を戻された
The application was rejected.

content: 5. (=食った物を吐く)to vomit, spew, spue, puke, throw up, cast up, fetch up (what one's has eaten or drunk)

content.content: 胸が悪くてもどしたくなる
to feel nausea―feel queasy―feel sick―turn sick―cast the gorge―heave the gorge
あれを見るともどしたくなる
I turn sick―heave the gorge―at the sight―My gorge rises at the sight―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight turns me sick―raises my gorge.
その臭いを嗅いでもどした
I threw up at the smell―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The smell turned me up.
もどしそうにげいげいする
to retch―keck

もとちょう〔元帳〕
〈名〉A ledger

content:
もとづく〔基く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=何を基礎とする)to be based on (premises); to be founded on (fact); to be grounded on (conviction); to rest on (experience)

content.content: この議論は誤れる論拠に基づいている
The argument is based on false data.
この小説は事実に基づいて作ったものだ
The story is founded upon fact.
宗教は確信に基づいて信ずべきものだ
One's religion should be grounded on conviction.
およそ知識の基づく処は経験である
All knowledge rests on experience.

content: 2. (=何に起因する)to originate in (some cause); to arise from (some cause); to be owing to (some cause); to be due to (some cause); to be attributable to (some cause)

content.content: 排日運動は人種的偏見に基づいている
The anti-Japanese movement originates in―arises from―racial prejudice.
彼の成功は勉強に基づいている
His success is all owing to―due to―attributable to―his diligence.

content: 3. (=何に準拠する)to act on (some principle); to conform to (some rule)

content.content: 教育はこの原則に基づいて施行すべきものである
Education should be conducted on this principle.
凡人は世の習慣に基づいて行動する
Ordinary men act in conformity to custom.

content:
もとで〔元手〕
〈名〉Capital; fund; stock

content.content: 元手を下ろす、元手をかける
to invest capital in an enterprise―sink capital in a business―lay out capital in an enterprise―put money in the business
この商売は元手がかかっている
I have invested much capital in the business―The business is a heavy investment.
伯(叔)父が元手を出してくれます
My uncle will furnish me with capital―finance my business.
元手が無くてはなにもできぬ
One can do nothing without capital.
元手無しの商売をする
to do business without capital―“make bricks without straw”―“live by one's wits”
彼は経験が元手だ
He can draw upon his experience―He has a large experience to draw upon.
貧乏人は身体が元手だ
A poor man can only draw upon his bodily strength.

content:
もとどおり〔旧通り〕
〈副〉What it was; as it was; as of old

content.content: もと通りになる
to be restored
直せばもと通りになる
If it is repaired, it will be what it was―as good as ever.
もと通りにする
to restore anything to its original condition
もと通りにして返せ
You must restore it to its former state―(女なら)―restore her to her former pority.

もとどり〔髻〕
〈名〉The hair bound on the top of the head; the root of a queue

content:
もとに〔下に〕
〈前置詞相当〉Under

content.content: 彼は師の指導の下に身を立てた
He advanced in life under the guidance of his mentor.
家は技師の監督の下に建てられた
The house was built under the supervision of an expert―under the superintendence of an expert.
学生を規律の下に置く
to place the students under discipline
軍を大将の指揮の下に置く
to place an army under the command of a general
勇将の下に弱卒無し
“A good officer will make good men.”
艦隊は一撃の下に全滅した
The fleet was annihilated at a blow.
軍隊は号令の下に動く
The troops move at the word of command.
艦隊は一令の下に出動した
The squadron sailed at a moment's notice.
一言の下に排斥する
to condemn at a word―condemn in the gross―condemn in the lump―make a sweeping condemnation
一言に下に拒絶する
to refuse flatly―refuse point-blank

content:
もとに〔許に〕
〈前置詞相当〉With (some one)

content.content: 友人のもとに滞在している
I am staying with a friend―staying at a friend's.
彼は伯(叔)父のもとに起臥している
He lives with his uncle.

content:
もとね〔元値〕
〈名〉The cost-price; the prime cost

content.content: 元値で売る
to sell at cost
それでは元値が切れます
That would not cover the cost―That would be below the cost-price.

content:
もとのとおり〔元の通り〕
〈副〉What it was; as it was; as of old

content.content: 彼はもとの通りだ
He is what he used to be―as of old.
もとの通りでない
He is not what he used to be.
もとの通り親切だ
He is as kind as of old―as kind as ever.
もとの通りになる
to be restored (to its original condition)
二人の仲はもとの通りになった
The relations between the two have been restored―They have become reconciled (with each other).
この船は直せばもとの通りになるか
If the ship is repaired, will she be what she was?
もとの通りになる
She will be as good as ever.
もとの通りにする
to restore anything to its former state
もとの通りにして返せ
You must restore it to its former state―(女なら)―restore her to her former purity.

content:
もとのもくあみ〔元の木阿弥〕
〈名〉Return to one's former destitute condition

content.content: その金を使い果たして元の木阿弥
He has spent all the money, and is as poor as ever.
儲けただけ損をしたから元の木阿弥
I have lost what I gained, and am no richer than I was.

content:
もとめ〔求め、需め〕
〈名〉A demand; a request

content.content: 需めに応ずる
to comply with one's request
遺憾ながらお需めに応じかねます
I regret to say that I am not in a position to comply with your request―I am sorry I can not oblige you.
お需めに応じて参上致しました
I have come at your request.
揮毫の需めに応ず
Requests for painting complied with.

content:
もとめ〔求め、需め〕
〈名〉A demand; a request

content.content: 需めに応ずる
to comply with one's request
遺憾ながらお需めに応じかねます
I regret to say that I am not in a position to comply with your request―I am sorry I can not oblige you.
お需めに応じて参上致しました
I have come at your request.
揮毫の需めに応ず
Requests for painting complied with.

content:
もとめて〔求めて〕
〈副〉Of one's own choice; on purpose; without provocation

content.content: 彼は求めてあんな者を貰ったのかしら
I wonder if he has married such a woman of his own choice.
彼は求めて事を破ったのだ
He has spoiled the game on purpose.
求めてけんかをするものでない
You should not quarrel with people without provocation―without sufficient cause.
君は求めて苦労をしている
You run to meet your trouble.

content:
もとめる〔求める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=要求する、請求する)to demand (a reply); to claim (payment); to require (one to do something―something of one); to call upon (one to do something); to request (one's attendance); to solicit (a favour); to ask (one's assistance); to ask for (information); to call for (an explanation); to apply for (employment, etc.)

content.content: 本員は大臣の答弁を求めます
I demand the reply of the Minister.
説明を求める
to demand an explanation―call for an explanation―request an explanation―ask one to explain
彼に面会を求めた
I asked to see him―solicited an interview.
出席を求める
to request one's attendance―ask one to attend
助力を求めた
I requested his assistance―asked his assistance―turned to him for assistance.
再考を求めた
I requested his reconsideration―asked him to think better of his resolution.
君の力に余ることは求めない
I shall not require you to do anything beyond your power―require too much of you.
彼に一場の演説を求めた
I called upon him to make a speech.
専問家の意見を求める
to consult a lawyer or physician―take advice
同意を求める
to ask another's concurrence in one's views
賛成を求める
to interest one in a project―enlist one in a cause
僕は君に強いて賛成を求めはせぬ
I do not want to force my views upon you―impose my opinion upon you.
同情を求める
to enlist one's sympathy
求めよさらば与えられん
“Ask, and ye shall receive”―“Seek, and ye shall find.”

content: 2. (=得んと努める)to seek for (happiness); to seek (a lady's hand); to look out for (a job); to pursue (pleasure)

content.content: 人は幸福を求む
Man seeks for happiness.
知識を求める
to seek for knowledge―pursue knowledge
学生は熱心に知識を求める
The students are eager for knowledge.
快楽を求める
to pursue pleasure―gather life's roses
職を求める
to seek for employment―(人になら)―apply (to one) for employment
彼は職を求めている
He seeks for employment―He is looking out for a job.
彼は職を求めに上京したのだ
He has come in quest of employment.
(婦人に)結婚を求める
to seek a lady's hand in marriage―sue for a lady's hand in marriage―pay one's addresses to a lady
交際を求める
to seek one's society―seek one's acquaintance―cultivate one's friendship―cultivate one's society―go after a man
彼は学者の交際を求める
He cultivates the society of scholars.
あの人は人に交際を求められる
He is much sought after―much run after.
人に物を求める
to go to one for something―come to one for something―look to one for something
時々彼に教えを求める
I often go to him for advice―go to him for explanation.
(僕にそんなことを尋ねるのは)木に縁って魚を求めるようなものである
You might as well go to a tree for fish.
［広告］英語教員の地位を求む
Wanted a position as teacher of English.
同気相求む
Like seeks like―Like draws to like―They are congenial spirits.

content: 3. (=買い求める)to buy; to purchase; to get; to have

content.content: その本はどこでお求めになりましたか
Where did you buy that book?―get the book?
この本は東京で求められますか
Is the book to be had in Tokyo?
これは日本では求められません
It is not to be had in all Japan.

content: 4. (=答を求める)to find (an answer)

content.content: 次の答を求む
Find answers to the following;―
次の和を求む
Find the sum of the following:―

content:
もともと〔元々〕
〈名〉One's original position

content.content: たとい失敗しても元々だ
Even if I fail, (I shall be in my original position―の意味にて)I shall be just where I was.
うまくいかなくとも元々だ
Even if it does not go well, I shall be where I was―I shall lose nothing.
温泉へ行って病気が治らなくとも元々だ
If the hot springs do not set me up, I shall lose nothing―they will do me no harm.
千円儲かってもやっと元々だ
If I make 1,000 yen, I shall barely recover the cost.
いったんなしたことを元々にする
to undo anything
いったんなしたことは元々にならぬ
What is done, can not be undone.

content: 〈副〉Originally

content.content: 人間は元々動物だ
Man is originally an animal.

もとゆい〔元詰〕
〈名〉A paper-string (for binding the hair)

content:
もとより〔固より〕
〈副〉
1. (=原来)Originally; naturally; by nature; from the first

content.content: 人はもとより動物だ
Man is originally an animal.
彼はもとより質の悪い奴だ
He is, by nature, a man of evil disposition.
僕はもとより知っておったのだ
I knew it from the first―all along.

content: 2. (=勿論)of course; certainly

content.content: 僕はもとより賛成だ
I am, of course, in its favour.
学問はもとより好いものだがしかし学問以上のものがある
Learning is certainly a good thing, but there is something above learning.
彼は英語はもとより独語仏語もできる
He knows German and French, to say nothing of his English.

content:
もどり〔戻り〕
〈名〉Return

content.content: 代は見てのお戻りでござい
“The proof of pudding is in the eating”

もどりに〔戻り荷〕
〈名〉Returned goods; returns

もどりひん〔戻り品〕
〈名〉Returned goods; returns

content:
もどりみち〔戻り路〕
〈名〉One's way back or home

content.content: 戻り路に立ち寄ろう
I will look in on my way home.

content:
もとる〔悖る〕
〈他動〉To be contrary to (reason); to be against (reason); to go against (one's principles); to sin against (morality); to run counter to (one's interests); to depart from (one's plan); to deviate from (a course)

content.content: 道理にもとる
to be contrary to reason―against reason
そのような処置は正義にもとる
Such a measure would be contrary to justice.
この金を取っては主義にもとる
It would go against my principles to take this money.
道徳にもとる
to sin against morality
復讐は人倫にもとる
Revenge is contrary to morality.
人道にもとる
to sin against humanity
礼にもとる
to sin against propriety
これより進んでは命令にもとる
To advance farther would be against orders.
立法の精神にもとる
to run counter to the spirit of legislation
自然は法にもとらず
Nature never deviates from her course.
これを中外に施してもとらず
This is true of all cases.

content:
もどる〔戻る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=帰る)to return; to go back; to come home

content.content: 宅が戻りましたらそう申します
I will say so when he comes home.
じきに戻る
I shall not be long.

content: 2. (=後戻りする)to go backward; to back; to turn back:(進歩なら)to retrograde; to retrogress:(病人なら)to have a relapse

content.content: もと来た道へ戻る
to turn back―retrace one's way―retrace one's steps―double on one's tracks
汽車が後へ戻った
The train backed.

content: 3. (=縒り{より}などが戻る)to become undone:(発条などが戻る)to spring back; to run down

content.content: 時計が戻った
The clock has run down.
縄の縒りが戻る
A rope gets untwisted.
鍛えた身体の縒りが戻る
to lose one's form
焼きが戻る
(刀剣なら)A sword loses its temper―(老人なら)―A man grows decrepit
お爺さんそろそろ焼きが戻って来た
He shows signs of decrepitude―His powers are falling him―Age is telling on him.

content:
もなか〔最中〕
〈名〉
1. The middle

content.content: 夏のもなかに
in the middle of summer
冬のもなかに
in the dead of winter
夜のもなかに
in the dead of night―at dead of night
もなかの月
the harvest moon

content: 2. ［菓子］A kind of Japanese confectionery (a wafer-case stuffed with an)

もぬけ〔蛻け〕
〈名〉
1. A cast skin; a cast shell; a slough (of a snake):(=る) to cast its skin; to shed its shell; to slough

content.content: 行ってみると寝床はもぬけの殻であった
We found the bed empty―“The bird was flown.”
玉はもぬけの殻
“The bird is flown.”

content: 2. (=る)(=秀でる) to surpass (others); to tower above (one's contemporaries)

もの〔者〕
〈名〉One; one (who); those (who); some; somebody; a person; a man; a fellow; people

content.content: 私は田中一郎と申す者です
I am one Ichiro Tanaka.
その会に出席した者から聞いた
One who was present at the meeting, told me.
外国語を知らぬ者は自国語をも知らぬ
One who does not know a foreign language does not know his own―(古文体にては)―He who knows not a foreign language, knows not his own.
忍耐する者は成功する
Those who persevere, will succeed―Such as persevere, will succeed―(古文体にては)―They who persevere, shall succeed.
神が有ると言う者もあり無いと言う者もある
Some say there is a god, and some say there is none.
去る者も留まる者もある
Some go, and the others stay.
僕の部屋へ入った者がある
Somebody has been in my room.
彼はここの者か
Is he a native of this place?―Does he belong here?
名古屋者だ
He is from Nagoya―a Nagoya man.
彼は怠け者だ
He is an idle fellow.
お前は果報者だ
You are a made man―a lucky dog.
無用の者入るべからず
No admittance except on business.

content:
もの〔物〕
〈名〉
1. A thing (something, anything, nothing, everything):(目の前の物)an object:(品物)an article; a ware; goods:(商売物)one's wares:(持ち物)one's possessions, belongings, effects:(物質)a substance; matter:(材料)material; stuff:(関係代名詞に訳せば)what

content.content: 物にすたり無し
“Everything is good in its place.”
うまい物
good things (of this life)―titbits―delicacies
なにかうまい物があるか
Have you anything nice?
なにかうまい物をこしらえて上げよう
I will get you something nice.
なにか食う物があるか
Have you anything to eat?
なにか飲む物が欲しい
I want something to drink.
食う物も飲む物も無い
There is nothing to eat or drink.
買うも買わぬも物によりけりだ
Whether I shall buy or not, depends on the quality of the article.
甲板へ出ると妙な物が目に触れた
When I went on deck, my eyes fell on a curious object.
彼は近眼だから遠い物は見えない
He is near-sighted, and can not see distant objects.
金目の物
articles of value
腐りやすい物
perishable goods
店の物
goods in stock
珍なる物
a rare article
読み物
reading matter
印刷物
printed matter
郵便物
postal matter
物が好いから高い
The price is high, for the material is good―for it is good stuff.
この品はやくざ物だ
These goods are sorry stuff―wretched stuff.
僕の物、君の物
mine―yours
あなたの物はわたしの物、わたしの物はわたしの物
What is yours, is mine; what is mine, is mine.
この家は僕の物だ
This house is mine―The house belongs to me.
地所は誰の物か
Whose is the land?―To whom does the land belong?
この本は学校の物だ
The book belongs to the school.
人の物を勝手に使ってはいかん
You must not make free with other's possessions.
彼は自分の物を気前好く人にやる
He is generous with his possessions.
君はいつ僕の物になることか
When shall I call you mine?
勝利はこちらのものだ
The day is ours.
君の欲しい物を当ててみようか
Shall I guess what you want?
どうかして病人をこちらの物にしたいものだ
I wish we could save the invalid.
やっとこちらのものになった
At last he is saved.
ものの哀れを知る
to be susceptible of beauty―tender of heart
ものの哀れを知る心
a susceptible heart―a tender heat
もののわかった人だ
He is a sensible man―a man of sense.
もののできる人だ
He is an able man―a man of ability.
物は試しだ
There is nothing like trying.
物は相談だ
Let us talk the matter over and see if we can come to an understanding.
物の見事に成功した
He has succeeded to admiration.
物の見事に失敗した
He has managed to fail.
目にもの見せん
You shall smart for it.
シェークスピアはお手のものだ
He has Shakespeare at his fingers' ends.
金そのものを愛する
to love money for itself
彼は勉強そのものを愛するのだ
He loves labour for itself―loves labour for its own sake―loves labour for labour's sake.
戦争そのものが好きで戦争する(いわゆる戦争道楽)
to wage war for war's sake
徳そのものを愛して行う徳でなければ本当の徳ではない
One should practise virtue for virtue's sake.
物を言う
to speak
君にはこれから決して物を言わない(絶交する)
I will never speak to you again.
書いた物がものを言う
It is down in black and white.
あきれて物が言えぬ
I am dumfounded―I am struck dumb with astonishment―astonishment deprives me of my power of speech.
物も言いようで角が立つ
“Smooth words make smooth ways.”
物になる、物にならぬ
to be a success―a failure
この詩はものになっている
The poem is a success―It is something like a poem.
絵はどれもこれもものになっておらぬ
Every one of these pictures is a failure―a daub.
こりゃどうやらものになって来たわい
This is something like, I declare.
語学は晩学では物にならぬ
Languages begun late in life never come to much.
僕の英語はものになりますか
Will my English come to anything?
事件がものにならなかった
The affair came to nothing―The affair ended in smoke.
この計画はものになりそうだ
The project is likely to materialize.
物にする
to make something of a person or thing
あの少年をどうかものにしようと思う
I am going to make something out of the boy.
この原稿を物にして下さるか
Can you make anything of this manuscript?
曰くをつけてものにする
He will make it a pretext to extort money.
物ともせぬ
to make nothing of―make light of―think nothing of―care nothing for―defy―difficulties or dangers
彼は艱難辛苦をものとともせぬ
He makes nothing of hardships―makes light of hardships.
ものともせすに終日働く
He makes nothing of working all day.
危険などはものともせぬ
He cares nothing for dangers.
けがなどはものともせずに過激な運動をする
He takes violent exercise, caring nothing for dangers.
どんな困難があってもものともせずに押し進む
He pushes on in spite of any difficulties.
輿論の反対をものともせずに自分の思うところを行う
He defies public opinion, and goes his own way―He sets public opinion at defiance, and goes his own way―He goes his own way in defiance of public opinion.
暴風雨をものともせずに舟を出した
We put off in defiance of the storm.
我が兵は弾雨をものともせずに前進した
The Japanese advanced in defiance of the hail of bullets.
物の数に入らぬ
to count for nothing
我々はものの数に入らぬ
We count for nothing in the world―we are negligible quantities.
彼はものの数に入らぬ奴だ
He is a nobody―a nullity―a nonetity―a cipher.
そうは言うものの
Though he says so,...
買ってはみたもののどうすることもできずに持てあましている
Though I have bought it, I don't know what to do with it.
老人とはいうもののまだなかなか大丈夫だ
Indeed he is old, but he is still strong.
とは言うものの心には言うに言われぬ別れの辛さ
At heart, however, he finds it inexpressibly hard to part.
ものの一時間も待ったかと思う頃に彼がやって来た
When I had waited a matter of an hour, he made his appearance.
ものの二マイルも行った頃に降り出した
When I had gone a matter of two miles, it began to rain.
あそこにはものの十日も居ったかね
I must have stayed there a matter of ten days―some ten days.
人の言うことは聴くものだ
You should listen to what others say.
借りたものは返すものだ
You should pay what you owe.
兄弟はけんかするものではない
Brothers should not quarrel―It is wrong that brothers should quarrel.
あまり無駄使いするものではない
You should not waste money―It is wrong to waste money.
行って見たいものだ
I should like to go.
その人に会ってみたいものだ
I should like to see the man―I am curious to see the man.
その話を聞いてみたいものだ
I should like to hear the story―I am curious to hear the story.
僕は若い時は飲んだものだ
I used to drink a great deal when I was young.
あの婦人は若い時は鳴らしたものだ
She used to be famous in her day.
(何だ紳士だと)紳士もないものだ(聞いてあきれる)
A gentleman, indeed!―(古文体にては)―A gentleman, forsooth!
文学もないものだ
Literature, indeed!―Literature, forsooth!
善意もないものだ
Charity, indeed!―Charity, forsooth!
そんなことがあるものか、そんなことがあってたまるものか
How can that be?―Impossible!
そんなことを誰がするものか
Who will do such a thing?―Not I!―I'm damned if I do.
行くかって、行くものか
Will I go? Not I!―I'm damned if I go.
彼は学者かって、学者なものか
He a scholar? Not he!―A scholar, indeed!
金を貸せって、誰が貸すものか
Lend you money? Not I!―Catch me!
そんなことをする奴がどこの世界にあるものか
Who ever heard of a man doing such a thing?
あの男は何ができるものか
What can he do?―He can do nothing―He is good for nothing.
質問なんかするものか
I scorn to ask questions.
嘘なんかつくものか
I scorn to tell a lie.
酸素療法の効果は驚くべきものあり
Oxypathy does wonders.
最近の航空術の進歩驚くべきものあり
Aviation has made wonderful progress of late.
女だもの
She is only a woman.
子どもだものしかたがないさ
We must make allowances, for he is only a child.

ものあげば〔物揚場〕
〈名〉A landing; a wharf

ものあたり〔物当たり〕
〈名〉Disagreement(with one's constitution); poisoning

ものあらそい〔物争い〕
〈名〉A dispute

content:
ものあんじ〔物案じ〕
〈名〉Anxiety; pensiveness:(=する) to be anxious; to be in a pensive mood

content.content: 彼女は物案じながら庭を眺めておった
She was gazing at the garden in a pensive mood.

content:
ものいい〔物言い〕
〈名〉
1. (=物の言い様)a manner of speaking

content.content: 彼は物言いがていねいだ
He speaks politely.
物言いが乱暴だ
He speaks roughly.

content: 2. (=抗議)a protest; an objection

content.content: 物言いをつける
(相撲なら)to protest against―object to―take exception to―the decision of the umpire―(競技なら)―claim a foul
相撲に物言いがついた
Exception is taken to the decision of the umpire.

content:
ものいう〔物言う〕
〈自動〉To speak:(形容詞に用いれば)speaking

content.content: 物言う花
a living flower―a beauty
物言う目
eloquent eyes

ものいみ〔物忌み〕
〈名〉Fasting:(=する) to fast (for so many days)

content:
ものいり〔物入り〕
〈名〉Expenses; outlay; claims on one's purse; demands on one's purse; a drain on one's purse

content.content: 公人は物入りが多い
A public man has many claims on his purse―many demands on his purse.
今月はなんやかやで物入りが多かった
I have had a large drain on my purse one way or another this month.
近頃の物入りで身代に大穴が明いた
Late outlays have left a gap in my finances.
物入り続きで難儀している
A constant drain on my purse has left me in great distress.
不時の物入り
unlooked-for expenses
不時の物入りがあった
I have incurred unlooked-for expenses.

content:
ものうい〔物憂い〕
〈形〉
1. (=気が晴れない)dull; gloomy; melancholy

content.content: 雨が降るともの憂い
The rainy weather makes me feel dull and gloomy.

content: 2. (=気が進まない)languid; lazy; indolent; weary

content.content: 夏の暑さはもの憂い
The heat of summer makes me languid and lazy.
なにをするのももの憂い
I am too lazy―too indolent―to do anything.
世の中がもの憂くなって来た
I am weary of the world―sick of life.

ものおき〔物置〕
〈名〉A lumber-room:(農家の物置) a barn:(屋根だけの物置) a shed:(天井裏の物置) a loft; an attic

content:
ものおしみ〔物惜み〕
〈名〉Miserliness; stinginess:(=する) to be a miser; to be stingy; to be niggardly; to be close-handed; to be close-fisted; to be close; to be tight; to pinch; to skimp

content.content: あんな物惜しみする奴は無い
There never was such a miser.
物惜しみせぬ
to be free with one's possessions―generous―liberal―open-handed

content:
ものおと〔物音〕
〈名〉The sound (of something done); the noise (of people clamouring); the din (of a multitude); the crash (of a falling house); the clash, the clang (of arms); the hubbub, the uproar (of many voices, etc.)

content.content: 丁丁発止の物音
the clash of arms―the clang of arms
すざまじい物音がして家が倒れた
The house fell with a terrible crash.

content:
ものおぼえ〔物覚え〕
〈名〉Memory

content.content: この子はもの覚えが好い
The boy has a good memory.
僕はもの覚えが悪い
I have a bad memory―a poor memory.

content:
ものおもい〔物思い〕
〈名〉Serious thoughts:(=する) to be sunk in thoughts; to be in a pensive mood

content.content: 彼女はもの思いに沈んでいる
She is sunk in thoughts―in a pensive mood.
もの思わしげなふうをして廊下に立っている
She stands on the verandah with a pensive air―with a lackadaisical air.

content:
ものかげ〔物蔭〕
〈名〉Cover

content.content: 物蔭に隠れる
to take cover

content:
ものがたい〔物堅い〕
〈形〉Honest, upright; strict; scrupulous; conscientious

content.content: あれは物堅い人だ
He is a man of strict honesty―a scrupulous man―a conscientious man.

content:
ものがたり〔物語〕
〈名〉A story; a tale; a narrative; a legend; a yarn; a fable; an account; a talk

content.content: 物語りをする
to tell a story―tell a tale
長物語りをする
to tell a long story―spin a yarn
彼は見て来た戦争の物語をした
He gave an account of the war.
殿下には陛下に御対面種々御物語り有りたり
His Highness had a long talk with His Majesty.
イソップ物語
Aesop's Fables
浦島物語
the Legend of Urashima
源氏物語
the Tale of Genji

content:
ものがたる〔物語る〕
〈他動〉To tell(how one did something); to relate (one's adventures); to narrate (events); to recount (one's deeds); to give an account of (what one has seen)

content.content: 彼は一部始終を物語った、仔細を物語った
He told me all about it―related the whole circumstances―gave full particulars.
しからば委細を物語らん
Then I will tell you everything about the matter.
彼は旅行中の奇談を物語った
He related his adventures on his journey.

ものがなしい〔物悲しい〕
〈形〉Sad; melancholy; pensive

content:
ものぐさい〔物臭い〕
〈形〉Lazy; slothful; sluggish; indolent

content.content: 麦萌
barley malt

content: 2. (=野菜のもやし)a hot-house vegetable

もやす〔燃やす〕
〈他動〉To burn (wood); to light (a fire); to kindle (a flame); to inflame (the passions); to enkindle (the heart)

content.content: 薪を燃やす
to burn wood
火を燃やす
to light a fire―kindle a fire
心を燃やす
to set one's heart in a blaze―set one's heart ablaze
情を燃やす
to inflame one's passion―set one's passion aflame
情火を燃やしている
One burns with passion―One is inflamed with lustful desire.
女を見て情を燃やす
to lust after a woman

content:
もゆる〔燃ゆる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: もえる〔燃える〕

content:
もゆる〔萌ゆる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: もえる〔萌える〕

content:
もよう〔模様〕
〈名〉
1. (=彩紋)design; figure; pattern:(動物の毛や鳥の羽根の模様は)marking

content.content: 紺地に金の模様
good design on blue ground
模様を付ける
to figure cloth―pattern cloth―embellish cloth with design
模様のある織物
a figured fabric―a fabric with a pattern―a fabric embellished with design
模様を織り出す
to inweave design in a fabric―inweave a fabric with design
模様を織り出した織物
a fabric inwoven with design―a fabric inwrought with a pattern
こった模様
fanciful design
ふざけた模様
grotesque design
裾模様
design on the skirt (of a lady's dress)
裾模様のある着物
a kimono embellished with design on the skirt

content: 2. (=様子)air; appearance

content.content: 店は繁昌している模様だ
The business has a prosperous air―It appears to be a flourishing concern.
事が成功しそうな模様だ
The matter appears likely to be a success―seems likely to be a success.
長くかかりそうな模様だ
It seems likely to take long.
この議には反対がありそうな模様だ
The bill seems likely to be opposed in the House.

content: 3. (=事情)circumstances

content.content: 模様によっては行かないものでもない
I may be there according to circumstances.
行くも行かぬも模様次第だ
Whether I go or not, will depend on circumstances.

content: 4. (=形勢)(the state of) things; the state of matters; the state of affairs; the aspect of affairs; the complexion of affairs; the phase of affairs; the position of affairs; the situation of affairs

content.content: 模様を見る
to observe the state of things―watch the aspect of affairs―see how the land lies
模様が好い
Things look bright.
模様が悪い
Things look dark―Things look gloomy.
模様が好くなって来た
The state of things are mending―The state of affairs are improving―Things are taking a turn for the better―Things are taking a favourable turn.
模様が悪くなって来た
Things are taking a turn for the worse―Things are taking an unfavourable turn.
この模様では事件がいつ片づくかわからぬ
In the present state of things,―As matters now stand,―there is no saying when the matter will come to a termination.
軍の模様を見物しよう
I will see how the war goes.

content: 5. (=兆候)signs; indications; appearances; prognostics ［注意］打消のほかは複数。

content.content: 空模様
the signs of the weather
朝早く起きて空模様を見た
I was up betimes to mark the signs of the weather.
空模様(天気模様)はどうか
How is the weather?
空模様が変わってきた
A change has come over the sky.
雨模様
signs of rain
雨模様がある
There are signs of rain―The sky shows signs of rain―It looks like rain―It threatens to rain.
雨模様が無い
There is no sign of rain.
雪模様だ
There are signs of snow―It looks like snow.
暴風雨の来そうな模様がある
There are signs of a coming storm―indications of a coming storm―appearances of a coming storm―prognostics of a coming storm.
暴風雨の模様は無い
There is no sign of a storm―no indication of a storm.
彼の来そうな模様が無い
There is no sign of his coming.
米が下がりそうな模様だ
There are signs that rice will fall―indications of rice falling.
病気の模様はどうか
How is his illness?
病気の模様は好い方だ
His illness shows favourable signs.
病気の模様が好くなった
His illness has taken a favourable turn―taken a turn for the better.
病気の模様が悪い
His illness shows unfavourable signs.
病気の模様が悪くなった
His illness has taken an unfavourable turn―taken a turn for the worse.

content:
もようがえ〔模様換え〕
〈名〉A change of plan; rearrangement

content.content: 新築の内部は模様換えになった
The interior of the new building has been rearranged.

content:
もよおし〔催し〕
〈名〉
1. (=開会)holding (a meeting, a party, a banquet, a festival, etc.):(hence) a meeting; a function; an event; doings; proceedings

content.content: 日比谷公園に国民大会の催しがあった
A mass meeting was held at Hibiya Park.
次の日曜に大臣邸に園遊会の催しがある
A garden-party will he held at the Minister's residence next Sunday.
二階になにか催しがあるのですか
Is anything going forward upstairs?
子どもらはその催しを指折り数えて待っている
The children look forward to the event.
祭礼についていろいろの催しがある
There are to be various functions―various doings―in connection with the festival.
降雨のため催しが中止になった
Owing to the rain, the proceedings were broken off.

content: 2. (=主催)auspices

content.content: 都下各新聞の催しで歓迎会が開かれた
A welcome meeting was held under the auspices of the town papers.
その会はどこの催しか
Under whose auspices is the meeting to be held?

もよおしもの〔催し物〕
〈名〉A show; a pageant

content:
もよおす〔催す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=開く)to hold (a meeting); to give (a dinner)

content.content: その会はいつ催すのか
When is the meeting to be held?―take place?
宴会を催す
to hold a banquet―give a dinner
当日は例年の通り運動会を催す
The annual athletic meet is held on the day.
学校では来週遠足会を催すそうだ
The school is said to be planning an excursion-party for next week.

content: 2. (=感ずる)to feel

content.content: 眠気を催す
to feel sleepy―feel drowsy
うとうと眠気を催してきた
A drowsy feeling stole over me.
吐き気を催す
to feel nausea―feel queasy―feel sick―heave the gorge
嘔吐を催す
to be nauseated―be disgusted
見ると嘔吐を催す
The sight is nauseating―disgusting―sickening―My gorge rises at the sight―My stomach turns at the sight.
哀れを催す
to be moved with pity―be touched with compassion
涙を催す
to be moved to tears
便通を催す
to have necessity of nature
にわかに便通を催す
to be taken short

content: 3. (=降りそう)to look like (rain)

content.content: 雨を催してきた
It looks like rain―It threatens to rain.

content: 〈自動〉(=兆す)to show signs of (a storm); to develop the symptoms of (a disease)

content.content: 嵐が催している
There is a storm brewing.
暴風雨が三日前から催している
The sky has been showing signs of a storm for three days―The storm has been brewing for three days.
この病は一年前から催している
I have had symptoms of this disease for a year.
陽気の悪いために持病のリウマチが催してきた
The bad weather has brought on an attack of rheumatism.
寒気が催してきた
It is getting colder.

content:
もより〔最寄〕
〈名〉The neighbourhood; the vicinity:(=の) neighbouring; nearest

content.content: この最寄りに学校は無いか
Is there no school in this neighbourhood?
泥棒が入ったから最寄りの交番へ届けた
I reported the burglary to the nearest police box.
最寄りの茶屋へ入って待っていた
I waited at a neighbouring tea-house.
けが人を最寄りの病院へ担ぎ込んだ
The injured were carried to the nearest hospital.

content:
もらい〔貰い〕
〈名〉
1. (=貰い物)a present; a gift:(女中なのどの貰いは)a tip; a perquisite

content.content: 宿屋の女中は貰いが多い
A hotel-maid gets many tips―gets large tips.

content: 2. (=芸者の貰い)permission to leave for an after-engagement

content.content: 貰いをかける
to offer one an after-engagement
貰いがかかる
to be offered an after-engagement―be called to another house

もらいご〔貰い子〕
〈名〉An adopted child

もらいだめ〔貰い溜め〕
〈名〉Savings of tips received

content:
もらいぢち〔貰い乳〕
〈名〉Asking another to suckle a child:(=する) to ask another to suckle a child

content.content: 女房が死んでから貰い乳をしております
Since my wife died, the child has been suckled by others.

content:
もらいて〔貰い手〕
〈名〉A recipient:(嫁の貰い手)a suitor

content.content: 娘は不器量で貰い手が無い
She is so plain that no one will marry her.
博士号をあまり安売りすると今に貰い手が無くなる
If the doctorate is sold too cheap, it will soon have to go a-begging.

content:
もらいなき〔貰い泣き〕
〈名〉Crying for company:(=する) to cry for company

content.content: 哀れな身の上話を聞いて貰い泣きをした
Her story was so touching that I cried for company.

content:
もらいび〔貰い火〕
〈名〉Destruction by a spreading fire

content.content: 家は貰い火で焼けた
The house was destroyed by a spreading fire.

content:
もらいみず〔貰い水〕
〈名〉Going to a neighbour for water:(=する) to go to a neighbour for water

content.content: 朝顔に
The morning-glory, lo!
つるべ取られて
Hath robbed me of my bucket, O!
貰い水
And I a-begging water go.

もらいむすめ〔貰い娘〕
〈名〉An adopted daughter

content:
もらう〔貰う〕
〈他動〉
1. To receive (an answer); to get (a salary); to obtain (a prize); to take (a degree); to have (an answer); to have (anything) given (one)

content.content: 僕はこの時計を貰った
I had this watch given me.
その時計を誰に貰ったか
Who gave you that watch?
伯(叔)父に貰った
My uncle gave it me.
人から金を貰う
to receive money from one―take money from one
貰って食う(乞食をする)
to subsist on charrity
その人の金と知ったら貰うのじゃなかった
If I had known that the money was his, I would not have taken it.
貰う身よりくれる身
“It is more blessed to give than to receive.”
そんな物は只で貰える
You may have it for nothing.
くれと言いさえすれば只で貰える
It may be had for the asking.
(浜へ行くと)魚は只で貰える
Fish may be had for the asking.
(蜜柑山へ行くと)蜜柑が只で貰える
Oranges may be had for the picking.
鉋屑は只で貰える
Shavings may be had for the gathering.
昔はこんな物は只で貰えたものだ
Such things used to be had for nothing―be had for the taking.
見本は只で貰える
The samples are free.
これは只貰った
I received it as a present―I had it as a gift―It was a free gift―It came to me by free gift.
こんな物は只貰っても要らない
I would not have it as a present―have it at a gift.
(価が安いから)只貰ったも同然だ
The price is nominal.
この品はいくら貰っても手放すことができない
I can not part with the article at any price.
何を貰っても(天下を貰っても)そんなことをするのはいやだ
I would not do such a thing for the world―Nothing shall induce me to do such a thing.
こればかりの物を貰って返礼をするに及ぶまい
I need not give anything in return for such a trifling present.
それでは遠慮なくお貰い申します
Then I will take it as freely as it is given.
彼から手紙を貰った
I received a letter from him―had a letter from him.
返事を貰う
to receive an answer―have an answer
いつお返事が貰えますか
When shall I have your answer?
(お手紙を持って行って)お返事を貰って参るのですか
Shall I bring back an answer?―wait for an answer?
褒美を貰う
to receive a reward―be rewarded
彼は人を助けて褒美を貰った
He was rewarded for saving a man's life.
当てにした褒美を貰い損なった
He was disappointed of his reward.
当てにしてた財産を貰い損った
He was disappointed of his expectations.
年金を貰う
to receive a pension―be granted a pension
彼は褒美として年金を貰った
He was granted a pension in reward for his services―He was rewarded with a pension.
月給を貰う
to receive a salary―draw a salary―get a salary―(月給日になら)―get paid
彼はいくら貰っているか
What salary does he draw?―What does he get?
一年分の給料を一まとめにして貰った
I received a year's pay in a lump.
学位を貰う
to obtain a degree―take a degree
免状を貰う
to receive a diploma―obtain a diploma―get a diploma
旅行免状を貰う
to obtain a passport―get a passport
暇を貰う
to ask leave―have leave
主人に暇を貰おう
I will ask leave of my master.
一週間の暇を貰った
I have a week's leave.
分け前を貰う
to receive one's share―come in for a share
財産分配のあった時僕はこの家を貰った
When the property was divided, I came in for this house―this house fell to my share.
この紙を一帖貰おう
I will take a quire of this paper.
女房を貰う、嫁を貰う
to marry a wife―take a wife―get oneself a wife
女房に貰う、嫁に貰う
to take a woman to wife
彼はどうしてあんな者を貰ったかしら
I wonder how he can have married such a woman.
君はあの婦人を貰う気かどうか
What are your intentions respecting the lady?
養子を貰う
to adopt a son
養子に貰う
to adopt a child (into one's family)
藁の上から貰われた
He was adopted as soon as he was born.

content: 4. (=何々してもらう)to get (some one to do something)(は英):(米は)to have (some one do something):(人を省けば)to get (something done); to have (something done)

content.content: 誰かに案内しておもらい
Get some one to show you the way!―Have some one show you the way!
誰かにいっしょに行ってもらいましょう
I will get some one to go with me―have some one go with me―ask some one to go with me.
郵便を出してもらった
I had my letter posted.
髪を刈ってもらった
I had my hair cut.
この歯を抜いてもらおう
I will have this tooth pulled out.
この本を友人に貸してもらった
I had this book lent me by a friend―A friend lent me the book.
この本を米国から送ってもらった
I had this book sent me from America.
明日来てもらいたい
I wish you to come―want you to come―tomorrow.
座敷を掃除してもらいたい
I wish to have the room cleaned―I wish you to clean the room.
君に留ってもらいたい
I wish you to stay.
彼に留ってもらいたいと言った
I desired him to stay.
髪を切ってもらいたい
I want (to have) my hair cut.
顔を剃ってもらいたい
I want to get shaved.
どうしても言うことを聴いてもらえぬ
I can not get obeyed.
医者に見てもらう
to consult a doctor―see the doctor
医者に見てもらったか
Have you seen your doctor?―had a doctor?

content:
もらす〔漏らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=水などを漏らす)to let escape, let out (water); to give exit (to steam, etc.)

content.content: 小便を漏らす
to pass water incontinently
溜息を漏らす
to let escape a sigh
溜息を漏らした
A sigh escaped me.
帆から風を漏らす
to spill the belly of sail
二人は水も漏らさぬ仲だ
They are bound up in each other―a pair of kid-gloves.
天網恢々疎にして漏らさず{てんもうかいかいそにしてもらさず}
“Heaven's vengeance is slow but sure”―“The mills of God grind slowly.”
感情を漏らす
to vent―give vent to―give mouth to―give speech to―give utterance to―one's feelings
彼女は泣いて感情を漏らした
She vented her feelings in sobs and tears.
怒りを漏らす
to vent one's anger on some one―wreak one's wrath on some one―pour out the vials of one's wrath
不平なら一つ漏らさぬ
Not a complaint ever escapes his lips―passes his lips.
脾肉の嘆を漏らす
to strain at the leash―fret and fume in inaction―to be eager for the fray
秘密を漏らす
to divulge a secret―disclose a secret―reveal a secret―betray a secret―blab a secret―let out a secret―let the cat out of the bag
うっかり秘密を漏らしてしまった
I blabbed the secret―blurted out the secret―in an unguarded moment.
秘密を漏らすな
Don't let out the secret!―Don't let the cat out of the bag!―Keep the secret!―(自分の秘密なら)―Keep your own counsel!
この秘密は一生漏らさぬ
I will carry the secret to the grave―The matter shall remain a secret for ever.
天機漏らすべからず
The matter must be kept a secret.
口吻{こうふん}を漏らす
to hint―intimate
彼は辞職したいような口吻を漏らした
He hinted at resignation―He intimated an intention to resign.
やってみたいような口吻を漏らした
He intimated an inclination to make a trial.
なんでもそんな口吻を漏らした
He hinted something to that effect.
内意を漏らす
to intimate one's intention to some one―confide one's private opinion to any one
彼は僕にその婦人について内意を漏らした
He intimated to me his intentions regarding the lady.
今回の改革についてご内意をお漏らし下さい
Please tell me your opinion on the late reform.
彼は何用があって来たのか少しも漏らさぬ
He does not hint at the nature of his business.

content: 6. (=脱漏する)to omit; to miss; to miss out; to leave out

content.content: 一字書き漏らした
I have omitted a word―left out a word.
一字聞き漏らした
I have missed a word―missed out a word.
彼はひと言も聞き漏らさない
He never misses a single word.
彼はひと言も漏らさないで物語った
He related the affair without omitting a single circumstance.
細大漏らさず物語った
He gave a full account of the affair―gave a minute account of the affair.
細大漏らさず述べた
He stated everything in detail.
細大漏らさず説明した
He explained everything to the minutest details.

content:
もり〔守り〕
〈名〉
1. (=保母)a dry-nurse

content.content: 子どもの守りをする
to dry-nurse a child―take care of a child―look after a child―mind a child
守りと子ども
a nurse and her charge
守りが子どもにかまわずに遊んでいる
The nurse is playing without minding her charge.
病人の守りをする
to humour an invalid in his wishes
私が行くまで旦那のお守りをして下さい
Keep him in humour till I come!

content: 2. (=番人)a keeper

content.content: 灯台守り
a lighthouse keeper

content:
もり〔森〕
〈名〉A wood(通例―the woods); a grove; a thicket

content.content: 森の中に神社がある
There is a shrine in the woods.
森の中をぶらつく
to ramble about the woods
鎮守の森
the sacred grove of the village shrine
庭園は鎮守の森を背景にして作ってある
The garden is laid out in the setting of a sacred grove.

content:
もり〔盛り〕
〈名〉Quantity of food served (at a restaurant, etc.)

content.content: あの家は盛りが好い
They serve you plentifully―give you good measure―at that house.
盛りが悪い
They serve you scantily―give you short measure.

content:
もり〔漏り〕
〈名〉A leak; leakage

content.content: 漏りがある
There is a leak.
漏りを止める、漏りをふさぐ
to stop a leak

content:
もり〔銛〕
〈名〉A fishing-spear; a harpoon

content.content: 鯨に銛を打つ
to harpoon a whale
今は大砲で銛を打つ
They now fire a harpoon from a gun.
銛を打つ大砲
a harpoon-gun

もりあがる〔盛り上がる〕
〈自動〉To rise; to swell

もりあげる〔盛り上げる〕
〈他動〉To heap up; to pile up

content:
もりうた〔守唄〕
〈名〉A nursery-song; a lullaby

content.content: 守り唄を歌って子どもを寝かす
to sing a child to sleep―lullaby a child

content:
もりかえす〔盛り返す〕
〈自他動〉To rally (the troops); to retrieve (one's fortunes); to recover oneself; to pull oneself together

content.content: 敗軍が盛り返す
A defeated army rallies.
軍勢を盛り返す
to rally the troops
身代を盛り返す、家運を盛り返す
to retrieve one's fortunes
頽勢を盛り返す
to check the downward tendency
急所を突かれたがたちまち盛り返した
He was hit between wind and water, but soon recovered himself.
始め敗けたけれどもしまいに盛り返した
Though defeated at first, he rallied―recovered himself―pulled himself together―in the end.

content:
もりくち〔漏り口〕
〈名〉A leak

content.content: 船が漏り口を生じた
The ship sprang a leak.
漏り口を止める、漏り口をふさぐ
to stop a leak

もりころす〔盛り殺す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=医者が患者を)to dose (a patient) to death
2. (=毒害する)to poison (a person)

content:
もりたてる〔守り立てる〕
〈他動〉To nurse up (one's young lord, etc.)

content.content: 時政は頼朝を守り立てて源家を再興させた
Tokimasa nursed up Yoritomo, and helped him restore the Minamoto family.

content:
モール
〈名〉(Gold or silver) lace

content.content: 金モール
gold lace

content:
もる〔盛る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=食物を盛る)to serve (food in a dish); to dish (food); to fill (a bowl with rice)

content.content: 食物を皿に盛る
to serve food in a dish―serve food on a plate―dish food―dish up
飯を盛る
to serve rice in a bowl―fill a bowl with rice

content: 2. (=薬を盛る)to administer (medicine); to prescribe (medicine for or to a patient); to dose out (pills or powders)

content.content: 薬を盛る
to administer medicine―dose a patient
毒を盛る、一服盛る
to administer poison
一服盛って人を殺す
to poison a man

content: 3. (=目を盛る、度を盛る)to graduate

content.content: 物差の目を盛る
to graduate a rule
碁盤の目を盛る
to cut a chequer-board into squares

content: 4. (=盛り上げる)to heap up; to pile up

content.content: 土を盛る
to heap up earth
木の根に土を盛る
to hill up a tree

content:
もる〔漏る〕
〈副〉(桶などが漏る)to leak:(水などが漏る)to leak out; to escape

content.content: この桶は漏る
The tub leaks.
屋根が漏る
The roof leaks.
船が漏り出した
The ship sprang a leak.
鉄管に漏る所がある
There is a leak in the pipe.
桶の底から水が漏る
The water leaks out through the bottom.
上手の手から水が漏る
“A good marksman may miss.”
ガスが漏る
The gas escapes.
木の間漏る月影
The moonlight filters through the leaves.
水の漏らぬ隔室
a watertight compartment
空気の漏らぬ接ぎ目
an air-tight joint
ガスの漏らぬ管
a gas-tight pipe

content:
モルヒネ
〈名〉Morphia; morphine

content.content: モルヒネ中毒
morphinism
モルヒネ注射
a morphine injection

content:
もるもんしゅう〔モルモン宗〕
〈名〉Mormonism

content.content: モルモン宗徒
a Mormon

content:
もれきく〔漏れ聞く〕
〈他動〉To hear casually; to overhear

content.content: 二人の話しを漏れ聞いた
I overheard their talk.

content:
もれくち〔漏れ口〕
〈名〉(=船底の漏れ口)A leak

content.content: 船が漏れ口を生ずる
A ship springs a leak.
漏れ口をふさぐ
to stop a leak

content:
もれなく〔漏れ無く〕
〈副〉Without omission; exhaustively

content.content: 彼は漏れ無く物語った
He related the affair without omitting a single circumstance.
漏れ無く研究した
He made an exhaustive study of the subject.
漏れ無く通知した
I have notified every one of them.

content:
もれる〔漏れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=水などが漏れる)to leak out; to escape; to find vent

content.content: 桶の底から水が漏れる
The water leaks out through the bottom.
ガスが漏れるとみえて臭い
The gas must be escaping, for there is a smell.
日光が雲間を漏れる
The sun breaks through the clouds.
戸の隙間から明かりが漏れる
The light shines through―shows through―the chinks in the door.
話し声が窓から漏れる
Their voices are heard through the door.
笑い声が家の中から漏れる
Laughter is heard from within.
地の底の蒸気が噴火口から漏れる
The steam in the bowels of the earth find vent in the craters.

content: 2. (=秘密などが漏れる)to leak out; to get out; to slip out; to ooze out; to transpire; to get wind; to take wind; to be disclosed; to be divulged; to escape

content.content: 秘密が漏れるおそれがある
There are fears lest the secret should transpire―leak out―get out―slip out―ooze out.
秘密が漏れた
The secret is out―The murder is out.
秘密が共謀者の一人から漏れた
The secret escaped from one of the accomplices.
事件が漏れて世間の評判になっている
The affair has got wind, and is the talk of the town.
好奇心が色に漏れている
He can not conceal his curiosity.
怒りが色に漏れている
He can not contain his anger.
試験問題が漏れて大騒ぎになった
Examination-papers were divulged, and that gave rise to great trouble―(一文にすれば)―The divulgence of examination-papers gave rise to serious trouble.

content: 3. (=脱漏する)to be omitted; to be left out

content.content: 大事な名前が漏れている
Some important names have been omitted―There are some important omissions.
彼は内閣組織に漏れた(仲間はずれになった)
When the Ministry was formed, he was left out in the cold―He was left out of the Ministry.
彼は昇級に漏れた
He was left out in the promotion.
招待に漏れた
He was left out of the invitation.
選に漏れた
He was left out of the selection―left out of choice.
その点が僕の注意に漏れた
The point escaped my attention―slipped my notice.
僕もご多分に漏れず失敗した
I have failed among the rest.

content:
もろい〔脆い〕
〈形〉
1. (=こわれやすい)brittle; fragile

content.content: 鋼はもろい
Steel is brittle.

content: 2. (=脆弱)fragile; frail

content.content: 人はもろいものだ
Man is a frail vessel.
人の命は露よりももろし
“Life is a bubble.”

content: 3. (=容易な)easy

content.content: (人を殺しておいて)もろい奴(!)
What easy game!
敵はもろく負けた
The enemy was easily defeated.
城はもろく落ちた
The castle fell easily.
彼はもろく悪計にかかった
He fell an easy victim to the design.

content: 4. (=情にもろい)sentimental; open to pity; susceptible (to beauty, etc.)

content.content: 女の子は涙もろい
Girls are sentimental―easily moved to tears.
勇士は情にもろし
A brave man is open to pity―(は憐愍の情、恋愛の情なら)―susceptible to female charms

もろこし〔唐土〕
〈固名〉(The ancient Japanese name for) China

もろこし〔蜀黍〕
〈名〉The Indian millet

〈名〉
1. (=両手)both hands

to raise both hands

content: 2. (=諸方)every side

content.content: 諸手の囲みを受ける
to be surrounded on every side

content:
もろとも〔諸共〕
〈副〉Together

content.content: 死なばもろとも
Let us die together!
人馬もろとも真っさかさま
Horse and rider rolled over the precipice.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉With

content.content: 船は乗組総員もろとも海底の藻屑となった
The ship went to the bottom with all hands on board.

content:
もろは〔諸刃〕

content.content: 諸刃の剣
a double-edged sword

content:
もろはだ〔諸肌〕
〈名〉Both shoulders

content.content: 諸肌脱ぐ
to bare both shoulders―strip oneself to the waist
皆諸肌脱いでいる
They are all stript to the waist.

もろみ〔諸味〕
〈名〉Unclarified sake; unrefined soy

content:
もろもろ〔諸〕
〈形〉All; various

content.content: 庶務課はもろもろの事務を扱う所
The Shomu Section concerns itself with all sorts of affairs.
大学はもろもろの学科を研究する学校
The university is an institution for the study of various branches of knowledge.

content:
もん〔文〕
〈名〉A hundredth of a sen; a piece (of money)

content.content: 一文ずつ数える
to count money piece by piece
一文惜しみの百知らず
Penny-wise and pound-foolish.
ひと山百文
(to be bought and sold at) sixpence a lot
三文の価値も無い
It is not worth a farthing―It is worthless.
三文文士
a back writer―a penny-a-liner

content:
もん〔問〕
〈名〉A question; a problem

content.content: 第二問
the second question

content:
もん〔紋〕
〈名〉
1. A crest; a family crest; a coat of arms; armorial bearings

content.content: 着物に紋を付ける
to put a crest on a gown
羽織に紋が付いている
The coat bears a crest.
紋付きの羽織
a crested haori
紋を散らす
to splash the ground with various crests
櫛に紋が散らされてある
The comb is splashed with various crests.

content: 2. (=織物の紋)figures

content.content: 紋絹
figured silk

content:
もん〔門〕
〈名〉
1. A gate; a door

content.content: 門を開く
to open the gate
門を開いて人を入れる
to open the door to people
門を閉じる
to shut the gate
門を閉じて人をいれぬ
to shut the door to people
門から入る、門から出る
to enter at the gate―go out at the gate
門を潜る
to pass through the gate
英学者であの学校の門を潜らない者はほとんど無い
Nearly every English scholar has once attended that school.
門を叩く
to knock at the door
門を打てども叩けども応ずる者のあらばこそ
I might knock and knock at the door, but never a soul answered my knock.
門の番をする
to keep the door
門の番をせぬ
to leave the door to keep itself
門の前を通る
to pass one's door
馬車が門の内に(門の外に)待っている
The carriage is waiting inside the gate―outside the gate.
門に表札が掲げてある
There is a name-plate on the door.
門に看板がかかっている
There is a signboard over the door.
門に日の丸がひるがっている
The sun-flag waves over the gate.
門を出でずして天下を知る
He remains at home and knows the world.
好事門を出でず
“Good news goes on crutches.”
忠臣は孝子の門に出る
A good son will make a good citizen.
男子門を出れば七人の敵あり
Once outside the gate, a man has seven enemies.

content: 2. (=誰の門)(whose) school

content.content: 天下の秀才ことごとく氏の門に集まる
All the genius and talent of the land flocked to his school―His school attracted all the genius and talent of the land.
江戸に出でて佐久間象山の門に遊ぶ
He went to Edo and studied under Sakuma Shozan.
緒方氏の門に入りて医学を学ぶ
He studied medicine under Dr. Ogata.

content:
3. (=動植物の門科族属種の門)class (order, family, genus, species)
4. 
〈助数詞〉

content.content: 砲一門、二門、山門
one gun―two guns―three guns

a porter's lodge

content.content: 誰の門下生
one's pupil―disciple―follower
彼は吉田松陰の門下生であった
He was a student under Yoshida Shoin―He studied under Yoshida Shoin.
松陰門下の秀才であった
He was an apt pupil of Shoin.

content: 〈名〉(=門下生)(one's)pupil, disciple, follower

もんがい〔門外〕
〈副〉Outside the gate

content.content: 馬車が門外に待っている

content:
もんがいかん〔門外漢〕
〈名〉An outsider; the man in the street:(専門家に対しては)a layman:(集合的に言えば)the laity:(=の) outside; lay

content.content: 内部の事情は門外漢のうかがい知るところでない
The internal state of things is a sealed book to the outsider.
門外漢は口に出す権利が無い
An outsider has no right to interfere in the matter.
門外漢の意見も捨てたものではない
The opinion of the man in the street―Outside opinions―Lay opinions―may prove of some service.
その道にかけては僕は門外漢だ
I am not in the line.

もんがなきん〔紋金巾〕
〈名〉Figured shirtings

content:

〈名〉The style of a gate:(形容詞に用いれば)with a gate

content.content: 門構えの家だ
The house has a gate―The house stands inside a gate.
門構えの立派な家だ
It is a fine house with a gate.

content:
もんきりがた〔紋切型〕
〈名〉A conventional from:(文句なら)a conventional phrase; a set phrase; a stereotyped expression; one's pet saying:(=の) conventional; stereotyped

content.content: 紋切型の口上を述べる
to give a conventional address―make a set speech
紋切型のおどし文句を並べる
to array the stereotyped forms of threat
「忠君愛国」はあの人の紋切型だ
“Loyalty and patriotism” is his pet saying.

content:
もんく〔文句〕
〈名〉
1. (=語句)wording; words; a phrase; an expression

content.content: 歌の文句
the words of a song
歌の文句で言うと「お前とならばどこまでも」だ
To use the words of the song.“I would go to end of the world in tour company.”
この歌は文句が好い
The song is prettily worded.
この歌は文句も節も整っている
The song is composed with word and air.
この手紙は文句が好い
The letter has well chosen expressions.
うまい文句が思いつかない
I can not hit upon a happy expression.
きまり文句
a set phrase―a conventional phrase―a stereotyped expression―a hackneyed expression―cut and dried expressions
きまり文句で言うとあの人は昔何某と言われた身だ
He has, to use a conventional phrase,“seen better days.”
忠君愛国はあの人のきまり文句だ
“Loyalty and patriotism” is his pet saying.
文句を並べる
to multiply words
あの人はいつもきまり文句を並べる
He always arrays cut and dried expressions.
おどし文句
threatening language
おどし文句を並べる、すごい文句を並べる
to try to intimidate one with threats
紋切型のおどし文句を並べる
to array the stereotyped forms of threat
華やかな文句で演説を結んだ
He concluded his speech with a flourish.

content: 2. (=言い分、言い草)a complaint; an excuse; a pretext

content.content: 文句を言う
to complain―grumble―murmur
文句言わずに働け
Work without grumbling!
彼は文句言わずに金を出した
He gave the money without grumbling.
文句言わずに百円出せ
Down with 100 yen without a murmur!
そうすりゃ文句言うところは無い
Then I shall have noting to complain of―That's fair.
彼は僕のすること為すことになんとかかんとか文句言う
He finds fault with everything I do.
彼は仕事を言いつけられるとなんかとかんとか文句言って逃にげようとする
When he is set a task, he tries to evade it on some excuse or other―on some pretext or other.
彼は文句言いづめだ
He is peevish―querulous.
こんなことをされちゃ文句言わずにゃいられない
I can not allow such things to be done.

content:
もんげん〔門限〕
〈名〉Lock-up; closing-time

content.content: 門限を破る
to stay out beyond lock-up―break leave―break gates

content:
もんこ〔門戸〕
〈名〉
1. The door

content.content: 門戸を開放して外人を入れる
to open the door to foreigners
門戸を閉じて外人をいれぬ
to shut the door to foreigners
門戸開放を唱える
to advocate the open door
門戸開放主義
the open-door policy
門戸を構える、門戸を張る
to reside in a fine mansion―cut a dash
地位の手前多少門戸を張る必要がある
It is due to my position that I cut some dash.

content:
もんごん〔文言〕
〈名〉The wording, the effect (of any writing)

content.content: 遺言書の文言が不明だ
The will is obscurely worded.
請願書の文書が不穏だ
The petition is couched in unfitting terms―couched in insolent terms.
手紙の文言はこうである
The letter runs as follows―reads as follows:―
用があつて来られないという文言であった
It was to the effect that business prevented his coming.
仰々しい
pompous diction―sounding rhetoric

もんざい〔問罪〕
〈名〉Accusation; arraignment; indictment:(=する) to accuse (one) of a crime; to arraign (one) for a crime; to indict (one) for a crime

content:
もんざいし〔問罪師〕
〈名〉A punitive force

content.content: 問罪師を差向ける
to send a punitive force against the rebels

content:

3. (=学問)learning; scholarship

content:
もんじゅ〔文珠〕

content.content: 三人よれば文殊の智恵
“Two heads are better than one”―“There is safety in numbers”―“There is safety in the number of counsellors.”

content:
もんしょう〔紋章〕

content.content: 菊桐の御紋章
the Imperial crest of the chrysanthemum and the paulownia
紋章学
heraldry

もんじん〔門人〕
〈名〉A pupil; a disciple; a follower:(集合的に言えば)a following

content.content: 彼は多くの門人をもっている
He has many followers―a large following.

もんせい〔門生〕
〈名〉A pupil; a disciple; a follower

もんせき〔問責〕
〈名〉Reproof; censure:(=する) to reprove, censure (one for a fault); to call (one) to account; to take (one) to task; to bring (one) to book

〈名〉
1. An Imperial prince in Buddhist priesthood; a priest-prince
2. A temple under a prince; (especially) the Honganji

もんぜつする〔悶絶する〕

content:
もんぜん〔門前〕
〈副〉In front of the gate

content.content: 毎日ご門前を通ります
I pass your door every day.
門前市を成す
The door is besieged by a crowd.
門前雀羅を張る
The house is desolate.
門前の小僧習わぬ経を読む
“The sparrows near a school sing the primer.”

content:
もんぜんばらい〔門前払い〕
〈名〉Refusal of admission; shutting the door in one's face:(=する) to refuse (one) admission; to shut the door in one's face

content.content: 門前払いを喰わせる
to slam the door in one's face
来たら門前払いを喰わしてやる
I am not at home to him if he calls.
門前払いを喰った
I had the door slammed in my face.

content:
もんだい〔問題〕
〈名〉
1. (=学問上の問題)a question; a problem

content.content: 問題を出す
to set one a problem―put a question to one
問題を解く
to solve a problem
問題に答える
to answer a question
試験問題
an examination-paper
試験問題を出す
to set an examination-paper
試験にはどんな問題が出たか
What sort of a paper was set you at the examination?
試験問題は皆答えたか
Have you floored the paper?
数学の問題
a problem in mathematics
英語の問題
an English paper
応用問題
a problem for application

content: 2. (=会議、政治上などの問題)a question; a matter; a point

content.content: 問題を議す
to discuss a question―debate on a question―deliberate on a question
問題を論ずる
to discuss a question
この問題は論ずるべき余地無し
The question admits of no discussion.
問題を決する
to settle a question―dispose of a question
軽々に決すべき問題ではない
It is not a question to be lightly disposed of.
決し難い問題だ
It is a vexed question.
未決問題
an open question―a pending question―a moot point
問題は未決だ
The question is open to discussion.
それは本問題にいかな関係があるか
How does that bear on the matter in hands?
問題を復活する
to revive a question―galvanize a question into life
焦眉の問題
a burning question
先決問題
the previous question―a prerequisite

content: 3. (=法律上の問題)an issue; a question; a matter

content.content: 事実問題
an issue of fact―a matter of fact
法律問題
an issue of law―a matter of law
本問題
the matter issue―the main question
枝葉問題
a side issue―a side question
国際問題
an international issue
重大な問題がこれによって決する
A grave issue turns upon it.

content: 4. (=世間一般の問題)a question; a problem; a subject; a topic; a matter; a point; a consideration

content.content: 問題を解決する
to solve a problem―settle a question
それで問題は解決する
That settles the point.
問題の解決に苦しんでいる
I am at a loss how to solve the problem.
問題解決の要はこの点にあり
The solution of the problem turns on this point.
武力をもって問題を解決する
to settle a question by force of arms―submit a dispute to the arbitrament of war
問題を考究する
to consider a matter―take a matter into consideration
これは吾人の考究すべき問題である
That is a matter for our consideration.
考究中の問題は何か
What is the matter under consideration?―the question on the tapis?
問題が持ち上がる
A question arises―A question comes up―A question faces us―A question confronts us.
問題が持ち上がっている
A question is up.
物品をいかに処分すべきかと言う問題が持ち上がった
A question arose as to how to dispose of the goods.
ここに持ち上がった問題をいかに解決するか
How shall we solve the problem that faces us?―the problem with which we are confronted?
問題を惹起す
to raise a question―give rise to a controversy
軍備縮少が問題となった
The reduction of armaments raised a question―came into question.
彼の演説が世間の問題となった
His speech gave rise to public controversy.
英語教授法がまた世間の問題となった
The method of teaching English has again come to the front.
普選は久しく問題となっておった
Universal suffrage had long been under consideration―at issue.
それが成功すればよいがそこが問題だ
It is well if it succeeds, but that's the question.
成功するかどうかが問題だ
The question is whether it will succeed or not―Success is problematical.
そんなことはてんで問題にならぬ
That is out of the question.
人気(のある)問題だ
It is a talking topic.
時日問題(早晩免れぬこと)だ
It is a question of time.
嗜好問題(人々の好き好き)だ
It is a matter of taste.
形式問題に過ぎぬ
It is a mere matter of form.
金銭問題(金次第)だ
It is a question of money.
(彼は金持ちだから)金銭問題には重きを置かぬ
He does not attach importance to the question of money―The consideration of expense does not weigh with him.
そりゃ程度問題だ
That is a question of degree―a matter of degree―a question, not of kind, but of degree―They differ, not in kind, but in degree.
食事は習慣問題(習慣次第)だ
Eating is a mater of habit.
死活問題だ
It is a matter of life and death―a vital question.
名誉に関する問題だ
It is a point of honour with me.
国威問題だ
It is a point of national honour.
首にかかる問題だ
It is a hanging matter.
国家の安危に関する問題だ
It is a matter involving the safety of the State.
問題の点
the point at issue
問題の女
